content:
たこ〔鮹〕
〈名〉The octopus

content.content: 鮹には足が八本ある
The octopus has eight arms ［tentacles］.
熱い湯に入って茹で鮹のようになった
The hot bath has made me as red as a boiled octopus.
鮹壺
an octopus-trap
鮹目玉
saucer-eyes
鮹入道
a big bald-headed man
鮹会社
a bogus company
鮹配当
the dividend of a bogus company (paid out of the capital)

content:
たご〔担桶〕
〈名〉A pail (borne at either end of a pole)

content.content: 肥たご
a night-soil pail

content:
たこう〔多孔〕
〈形〉Porous

content.content: 多孔性
porosity
多孔性の壺
a porous pot

たこう〔多幸〕
〈名〉Great happiness; great good fortune

content:
たごう〔違う〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: たがう〔違う〕

content:
たこうする〔高うする〕
〈他動〉To make (anything) high

content.content: 枕を高うして寝る
to sleep in peace―sleep on a calm conscience
国民は枕を高うして寝られる
The people can now sleep in peace.
悪事を為す者は枕を高うして寝られぬ
Those who do evil, can not sleep on a calm conscience.

たこがいしゃ〔鮹会社〕
〈名〉A bogus company

content:
たこく〔他国〕
〈名〉A foreign country; a strange land:(日本国内のなら)a different province:(=の) foreign

content.content: 他国の土となる
to die in a strange land
他国人
a foreigner―a stranger―an alien―(日本国内のなら)―a man from a different province

content:
たこくご〔多国語〕
〈名〉Many languages; several languages:(=の) polyglot

content.content: あの人は多国語に通じている
He speaks several languages―He is a polyglot.
多国語対照聖書
a polyglot bible

content:
たごさく〔田吾作〕
〈名〉A peasant; a rustic; a bumpkin; a boor; a clodhopper; Hodge

content.content: 田吾作とお鍋
Jack and Jill.

たごとのつき〔田毎の月〕
〈名〉The moon reflected in several rice-fields lying in tiers on a hillside

たこにゅうどう〔鮹入道〕
〈名〉A big bald-headed man

たこはいとう〔鮹配当〕
〈名〉The dividend of a bogus company (paid out of the capital)

たこぶね〔たこ舟〕
〈名〉The argonaut; the paper nautilus

content:
たこん〔多恨〕
〈名〉Much regret

content.content: 多情多恨
sentimental

content:
たごん〔他言〕
〈名〉Disclosure; divulgence; revelation:(=する) to disclose, divulge, reveal (a secret); to blab

content.content: 他言無用
You must keep the secret―You must keep the matter a secret―Mum's the word.
決して他言は致しません
I will keep the secret―keep silent about it―keep mum about it.
他言を禁ずる(他言せぬと誓わせる)
to swear one to secrecy―bind one to secrecy
他言せぬことを誓う
to swear secrecy―vow secrecy―pledge oneself to secrecy―bind oneself to secrecy
僕は他言せぬことを誓ったから言われぬ
I am sworn to secrecy―bound to secrecy―pledged to secrecy―under pledge of secrecy―under a vow of secrecy.

content:
たさい〔多妻〕
〈名〉Many wives; a plurality of wives

content.content: 一夫多妻
polygamy
一夫多妻者
a polygamist

content:
たさい〔多才〕
〈名〉Versatile talents; versatility:(=の) versatile

content.content: 多才の人だ
He is a versatile man―a man of versatile talents―He can turn his hand to anything.
博学多才の人だ
He is a prodigy.

content:
たざい〔多罪〕
〈名〉Many pardons

content.content: 妄評多罪
A thousand pardons for my immature criticism.

content:
たさく〔他作〕
〈名〉Tenant-farming

content.content: 他作農家
a tenant-farmer

content:
たさく〔多作〕
〈名〉Prolificity in writing; polygraphy

content.content: 彼は多作家だ
He is a prolific writer―a polygraph.

ださく〔駄作〕
〈名〉A poor work; trash; sorry stuff; wretched stuff

content:
たさつ〔他殺〕
〈名〉Murder; violence; foul play

content.content: 他殺の形跡あり
The body bears marks of violence―There are signs of violent hands having been laid on him.
他殺の嫌疑あり
There is suspicion of foul play.
どうも他殺のように思われる
I have every reason to believe that it is a murder―that there has been foul play―that violent hands have been laid on him.

content:
たさに
〈接尾詞〉From a desire (to do something)

content.content: 彼は親を悦ばせたさに勉強する
He works-hard from a desire to please his parents.
朝顔を作ると花を見たさに朝起きになる
If you grow morning-glories, you will come to rise early from a desire to see the flowers.

たさん〔多産〕
〈名〉Productivity; fecundity; prolificity:(=する) productive; fecund; prolific

content:
ださん〔打算〕
〈名〉Calculation; computation:(=する) to calculate, compute (from some data); to base one's calculation (upon some data)

content.content: 何から打算したものか
What data is the calculation based upon?
打算の基礎を誤っている
The calculation is based upon false data.

content:
ださんてき〔打算的〕
〈形〉Calculating; prudential

content.content: あの人は打算的だ
He is a calculating man.
あの人のすることは打算的だ
He is actuated by prudential motives.

content:
たざんのいし〔他山の石〕
〈名〉Anything one may profit by

content.content: 他山の石もって玉を磨くべし
One should profit by every circumstance.
もって他山の石とすべし
One may profit by it―learn something from it.
彼の評は他山の石とするに足る
His criticism serves to teach us something.

content:
たし〔足し〕
〈名〉
1. (=補い) something towards (the expenses, etc.)

content.content: これは少ないが路用の足しにして下さい
Here is something towards―a trifle towards―your travelling expenses.
足しになる
to go towards anything
この金は借金払いの足しになる
This money will go towards the debts.
これだけ金があればだいぶ学資の足しになります
This sum will go far towards―go a long way towards―my school-expenses.
(収入などの)足しにする
to supplement―eke out―help out―piece out―one's income (with or by something)
給料が足らないから内職をして足しにする
I supplement my salary―eke out my salary―by doing private work.
彼は焼芋を食って飯の足しにすることが往々あった
He would often help out his meals with roast potatoes.

content: 2. (=用) use

content.content: この発見は実用にはなんの足しにもならぬ
This discovery is of no practical use.
それでもなにかの足しになるだろう
But it must be of some use.

content:
たし〔多士〕
〈名〉Many notabilities

content.content: 多士済々
a galaxy of notabilities

content:
たじ〔他事〕
〈名〉Other things; other matters

content.content: 彼は学問に一心で他事を顧みる暇が無い
He is too intent on his studies to think of anything else.
他事ながら
by the bye

content:
たじ〔多事〕
〈形〉Busy; eventful

content.content: 国家多事の秋
eventful times―stirring times―times of stress
国家多事の際この人を失うは惜しむべし
He is a loss to his country, especially in these times of stress.
多事なる時代
an eventful period
政界ようやく多事ならんとす
The political world begins to show signs of activity―We are on the eve of a stormy political season.

content:
だし〔山車〕
〈名〉A festival car; a pageant; a float

content.content: 山車を引廻す
to draw a festival car about the town

content:
だし〔出し〕
〈名〉
1. ［料理］Stock; a seasoning (given to broth)
2. (=道具に使われる人)a blind, a stalking-horse (to cover one's actions)

content.content: 人を出しに使う
to use a person as a blind―make a stalking-horse of a person
出しに使われる
to be used as a blind―be make a stalking-horse of

だしあい〔出し合い〕
〈名〉Joint contribution; clubbing

content:
だしあう〔出し合う〕
〈他動〉To contribute jointly; to club (the expense)

content.content: 会員が金を出し合って自動車を買った
The members clubbed for a motor-car.

だしいれ〔出し入れ〕
〈名〉Income and outgo; incomings and outgoings; revenue and expenditure; receipts and disbursements

content:
だしおくれ〔出し後れ〕
〈名〉Being behindhand in giving in (one's papers, etc.)

content.content: いささか証文の出し後れの気味だった
It was done with a bad grace.

content:
たしか〔確か〕
〈形〉(=確実な) certain (fact); sure(way); assured (fact); positive (proof); authentic (news); secure (possession); safe (plan); true (aim); genuine (article); conclusive (evidence); convincing (proof); decisive (proof); definite (answer); reliable (source); trustworthy (quarter); sound (doctrine); solid (grounds); firm (basis); steadfast (friend); established (fact); competent (teacher); good, gilt-edged (security, etc.)

content.content: これは確かな事実だ
This is a certain fact―a positive fact―an established fact.
この事実は確かだ
The fact is certain―I am sure of the fact―I am certain of the fact―I am convinced of the fact.
彼の無罪なことは確かだ
His innocence is certain―I am sure of his innocence―I am certain of his innocence―I am positive of his innocence―I am convinced of his innocence.
それは確かか
Is that certain!―Are you sure of it?
これは確かだ
That is certain―I am sure of it―certain of it―positive of it.
これは万々確かだ
That is a moral certainty.
あれは確かな男だ
He is a reliable man―a trustworthy man.
この話は確かな筋から聞いた
I have heard the news from a trustworthy quarter―I have the news from a reliable source―I have the news on good authority.
確かな理由があってそう言うのだ
I have solid grounds for saying so.
あの会社は基礎が確かだ
The firm is on a firm basis―on a solid basis―on a sound basis.
確かな議論
a sound argument―a solid argument
確かな論法
sound reasoning
確かな説
a sound theory―an authentic statement
確かな教義
a sound doctrine
確かな政策
a sound policy
確かな約束
a positive promise―a solemn promise
確かな返事
a definite answer
確かな望み
a certain hope
確かな狙い
true aim
あれは確かな先生だ
He is a competent teacher.
腕前は確かだ
You may trust his ability.
この時計は確かですか
Is this clock right?
警察で尋ねた方が確かだろう
It would be safer to inquire at the police-station.
彼は確かに一番になる
He is a safe first.
確かな品
a genuine article―a sound article
この品なら確かなものだ
This is a genuine article―I will answer for the article―I will guarantee the article.
確かな商会
a good firm
確かな担保
good security―gilt-edged security
確かな貸金
a good debt
確かなことは知らない
I do not know for certain.
確かなことはわからない
I can not say for certain.
気は確かか
Are you of soundmind'―in sound mind?―in your right mind?
気を確かに持て
Keep a good heart!―Be of good heart!
朝日は最も確かな新聞だ
The Asahi is the most reliable paper.
確かな報道
reliable information―authentic news
この電報で先の報道が確かになる
This telegram confirms the report.
この報道はまだ確かでない
The report waits to be confirmed―wants to be confirmed―wants confirmation.
この事実で証拠が確かになる
This fact corroborates the evidence.
この証拠を確かにする事実がある
There are some facts in corroboration of the evidence.

content:
〈副〉
1. (=に)(=確実に) certainly; to a certainty; of a certainty; of a surety; as sure as I am alive; as sure as eggs is eggs; as sure as a gun; as sure as death; as sure as you are there

content.content: 彼は確かに成功する
He will certainly succeed―He is certain to succeed―He is sure to succeed―He will succeed to a certainty―of a certainty―of a surety.
僕は確かに成功すると思う
I am sure I shall succeed―I am sure of success―I am certain I shall succeed―I am certain of success.
君は確かに及第すると思う
I am sure you will pass―I am sure of your passing―You are sure to pass―I am certain you will pass―I am certain of your passing―You are certain to pass.
君の言うことは確かに間違っている
You are certainly wrong.
君の方が確かに悪い
You are certainly in the wrong.
君は確かに米探だ
He is a spy as sure as I am alive―as sure as you are sitting there.
この人なら確かに好いと思う
I am sure he will do―I am convinced of his fitness for the position―I can recommend him with a safe conscience.
今度は確かに手に入った
I am sure of the position―I am secure of the position―this time.
確かに戸締りをしたか
Did you secure the door?
金を確かにお渡し申しました
I have duly handed over the money to you.
確かに受取りました
I have duly received it―I have it all right.
確かにお預かりしました
I will keep it all right.
(受取った金を勘定してみて)確かに
All right!

content: 2. (=多分) I think; I believe; if I am not mistaken; if I remember aright

content.content: あの人はたしか仙台です
He is from Sendai, I believe.
たしか去年の始めのことだった
It happened at the beginning of last year, if I remember aright.
あの人はたしかキリスト教信者だ
He is a Christian, unless I am greatly mistaken.
あの声はたしかあなただと思った
I knew your voice―I recognized the voice as yours.

content:
たしかめる〔確かめる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=つきとめる) to ascertain, make sure of, assure oneself of, convince oneself of, satisfy oneself of (a fact); to see (if it is true)

content.content: この事実は確かめたから間違いない
I have ascertained the fact―made sure of the fact―convinced myself of the fact.
実否を確かめなければならぬ
I must make sure of the truth―convince myself of the truth―satisfy myself of the truth.
実否を確かめて来よう
I will go and ascertain the truth―see if it is true.
実検によって確かめる
to convince oneself by personal inspection
実検して確かめなければ信じられぬ
I must see for myself.
万事間違いないことを確かめた
I assured myself that all was right―I saw that all was well.

content: 2. (=確実にする) to confirm (a report); to corroborate (a statement); to establish (a fact); to verify (an account); to authenticate (the news)

content.content: これは確かめられた事実だ
This is an established fact.
この報道はまだ確かめられない
The report is not yet confirmed―The report wants confirmation.
新聞の記事を確かめる必要がある
We must verify the accounts in the papers.
僕の言うことを確かめる事実がある
There are facts in corroboration of my statement.

content:
たしき〔多識〕
〈名〉Extensive knowledge; wide information; erudition:(=の) erudite; well-informed

content.content: 多識多感の人
a full man

content:
たじたじ
〈副〉Staggeringly; totteringly

content.content: たじたじとなる
to stagger―totter
相手は受け太刀になってたじたじと後へ引いた
His adversary had to stand on the defensive and staggered back.

content:
たじつ〔他日〕
〈副〉Some day; some other time; on some future occasion:(=の) future; prospective

content.content: こんなことでも学んでおけば他日役に立つこともあろう
If I learn these things, such as they are, they may stand me in stead some day.
これを学んで他日の用に充てん
I will learn them for future uses―for possible uses.
これを話すことは他日に譲る
I will tell you some other time―on some future occasion.
(彼と)他日を期して別れた
We parted, deferring the matter to some future occasion.
彼は他日の大臣たるべし
He may be a future minister―a prospective minister.

たじながら〔他事ながら〕
〈副〉By the bye

content:
たしなみ〔嗜み〕
〈名〉
1. (=嗜好) taste

content.content: 彼は文学の嗜みがある
He has a taste for literature.

content: 2. (=慎み) prudence; discretion; modesty

content.content: 女の嗜み
female discretion―feminine modesty
嗜みの好い女
a discreet woman―a modest girl
なんという嗜みの悪い女だ
What an immodest woman she is!

content: 3. (=芸) accomplishment

content.content: 武士の嗜み
the necessary accomplishments of a samurai

content: 4. (=心掛け) providence

content.content: さすがは武士の嗜み太刀を引き寄せた
With a samurai's providence, he drew his sword toward him.

content: 5. (=女の身だしなみ) toilette; attention to personal appearance

content.content: 女は嗜みが大事
A woman should attend to her appearance.

content:
たしなむ〔嗜む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=好む) to like; to have a taste for (anything)

content.content: 読書を嗜む
to have a taste for reading
彼は平素酒を嗜む
He is a habitual drinker.

content: 2. (=慎む) to be prudent; to be careful

content.content: ちと嗜ましゃんせ
You should be more careful, sirrah!

たしなめる〔窘める〕
〈他動〉To rebuke; to reprove; to take (one) to task

content:
だしぬく〔出し抜く〕
〈他動〉To forestall (one); to steal a march on (one)

content.content: 彼は僕を出し抜いて自分でその地位を占めてしまった
He stole a march upon me and secured the position for himself.
出し抜かれてくやしいけれども自分がのろまだから仕方がない
I am vexed at his stolen march, but can only blame my own slowness.

content:
だしぬけに〔出し抜けに〕
〈副〉Suddenly; abruptly; unexpectedly; unawares; without notice; without warning

content.content: 出し抜けにそんなことをしようものなら皆驚いてしまう
Everybody will be astonished if you do such a thing all of a sudden.
その男が出し抜けに打って掛ってきた
He struck at me unawares.
出し抜けに去られては困る
You must not leave without notice―without warning.
彼は出し抜けに妙なことを尋ねた
He abruptly asked me a queer question.
出し抜けに来られて困った
He came unexpectedly upon me―He paid me a surprise visit.

content:
たしまえ〔足し前〕
〈名〉A supplement:(=する) to supplement, eke out, help out piece out (the income, etc.)

content.content: 金が足らないから足し前しておいた
The money was not enough, so I eked it out out of my own pocket.

content:
たしゃ〔多謝〕
〈間投詞〉Many thanks!; A thousand thanks!

content.content: 御好意多謝
Many thanks for your kindness!

content:
だじゃく〔惰弱〕
〈形〉Indolent; effeminate

content.content: 惰弱な国民
an indolent people
今時の学生は惰弱に流れる傾向がある
Students nowadays are apt to become effeminate.

content:
だじゃれ〔駄洒落〕
〈名〉A bad pun

content.content: 駄じゃれを言う
to make bad puns

だしゅ〔打手〕
〈名〉A batter; a batsman

だしゅ〔舵手〕
〈名〉The steersman; the helmsman; the man at the helm; the man at the wheel:(端艇なら)the cockswain

content:
たじゅう〔他住〕
〈名〉Non-residence

content.content: 他住者
a non-resident

content:
たじゅう〔多重〕
〈形〉Multiplex

content.content: 多重電信法
multiplex telegraphy

たしゅたよう〔多種多様〕
〈形〉Various; diverse

たしゅつ〔他出〕
〈名〉Going out:(=する) to go out

たしゅみ〔多趣味〕
〈名〉Many-sided interest:(=の) many-sided (person)

content:
たしょ〔他所〕
〈名〉
1. Another place; a different part of the country

content.content: 他所の人
a stranger―a man from another part of the country
あれは他所の人だ
He is from another part of the country―He is not a native of the place.
被告は犯罪当時現場に在らずして他所に在りしと抗弁せり
The prisoner pleaded alibi.
他所払約束手形
a domiciled note
他所払為替手形
a domiciled bill
他所支払人
a domicile drawee

content:
たしょう〔他生〕
〈名〉A previous existence

content.content: 袖ふれ合うも他生の縁
A chance acquaintance is a divine ordinance.

content:
たしょう〔多少〕
〈名〉(数なら) a number:(量なら) a quantity:(金額なら) an amount

content.content: 勝敗は必ずしも数の多少によるものにあらず
Success in battle does not always depend on numbers.
多少にかかわらず
regardless of the amount―any amount―something―however small
多少にかかわらずご寄付を願います
I beg you will give something towards the expenses.
多少にかかわらず御用命仰付け被下度候
We solicit your orders, however small.
多少に準じて
in proportion to something
功労の多少に準じて恩賞があった
They were rewarded in proportion to their services.
多少によって
according to the amount
出金額の多少によって席順をきめる
The order of precedence is fixed according to the amount given.
恩給は奉職年間の多少によって違うか
Do the pensions vary with the number of years served?

content: 〈形、副〉More or less; some; any (?):(副詞に訳せば) in some measure; in some degree; to a certain extent

content.content: 宗教はどれも多少の真理を含んでいる
Every religion contains more or less truth.
その言は多少真理がある
Your statement is true to a certain extent―There is some truth in what you say―(を通例略して)―There is something in that.
人は皆多少取り柄があるものだ
All men have more or less good in them.
まだ多少望みがある
There is yet some hope.
多少望みがあるか
Is there any hope?
彼は多少学者肌が有る
He has something of the scholar in his composition.
朝鮮へ行くと何事も多少趣きを異にしている
Everything in Korea presents some peculiar features.
君はこの事を多少知っているだろう
You must Know something of the affair.
彼は多少成功したと言わなければならぬ
It must be admitted that he has succeeded to a certain extent.
彼の成功は多少は僥倖だ
His success is in some measure due to luck.
この品は他の品より多少優れている
This article is in some degree superior to the others.
土人は多少 Spain 人の血統を引いている
The natives have some Spanish blood in them.
彼は多少発狂の気味が有る
He has some touch of insanity.
多少有する
to partake of anything
昔は先生の職は多少神聖な性質を帯びておった
In former days, the office of teacher partook of a sacred character.
子どもは両親の性質を多少受けて来る
A child partakes of the natures of both parents.
彼は詩人と哲人の性格を多少兼ている
He partakes of the characters of both the poet and the philosopher.

content:
たじょう〔多情〕
〈形〉
1. (=情愛の深き) tender; ardent; passionate; amorous

content.content: 多情な人だ
He has a hot liver.

content: 2. (=浮気な) inconstant; fickle; licentious; dissolute; profligate

content.content: 多情な女だ
She is a profligate woman.

だじょうかん〔太政官〕
〈固名〉The Central Government (of the Restoration)

だじょうだいじん〔太政大臣〕
〈名〉(The old name for) the prime minister

たじょうたかん〔多情多感〕
〈形〉Passionate

たじょうたこん〔多情多恨〕
〈形〉Sentimental

たじろぐ
〈自動〉To hang back; to hold back; to shrink back; to waver; to vacillate; to hesitate

だしん〔打診〕
〈名〉Percussion:(=する) to percuss, tap (the chest, etc.)

content:
たしんきょう〔多神教〕
〈名〉Polytheism

content.content: 多神教徒
a polytheist

content:
たす〔足す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=加える) to add (one thing to another)

content.content: 二に二足すの四
Two and two make four.
(九十五円あるから)五円足してちょうどにしておこう
I will add five yen to make it a round sum.

content: 2. (=補う) to supply, make good (the deficiency); to make up (the deficit―for the deficit); to supplement, eke out, help out, piece out (one's income)

content.content: 不足を足しておこう
I will make good the deficiency―make up the deficit.
給料が少ないから内職をして足している
I supplement―eke out―my salary by doing outside work.
品物が足りないから買い足しておこう
As we are short of goods, I will buy some more―recruit the supply.

content:
たす〔達す〕
〈他動〉To do (business); to transact (business)

content.content: 用をたす
to do one's business―transact business―(人に頼まれた用なら)―execute a commission―do one a service―(使い歩きの用なら)―run errands―undertake messages―(便通の意味なら)―do one's needs
用をたしに行って来た
I have been to transact some business.
僕に一つ用をたしてくれないか
Will you execute a commission for me?―do me a service?
小僧は用をたしに行きました
The boy has gone on an errand.
君は英語で用がたせるか
Can you make yourself understood in English?
この上衣はずいぶん用をたしている
The coat has seen much service.

content:
だーす〔打<ダース>〕
〈名〉A dozen

content.content: 米国では卵をダースいくらで売る
In America, eggs are sold by the dozen.
箱はダース詰めです
The boxes are packed in dozens.
ハンケチ二ダース
two dozen handkerchiefs
十二ダース
a gross

content:
だーす〔打<ダース>〕
〈名〉A dozen

content.content: 米国では卵をダースいくらで売る
In America, eggs are sold by the dozen.
箱はダース詰めです
The boxes are packed in dozens.
ハンケチ二ダース
two dozen handkerchiefs
十二ダース
a gross

content:
だす〔出す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=いだす)to hold out (one's hand); to put out (one's tongue); to put forth (one's strength); to let out (a man, etc.)

content.content: 手を出す
to hold out one's hand
もっとくれと言って手を出した
He held out his hand for more.
相場に手を出す
to dabble in speculation
哲学のようなむつかしいものには手を出さぬ
I do not meddle with philosophy.
彼はいろいろのことに手を出し過ぎる
He has too many irons in the fire.
手を出すごとに失敗する
He fails in everything he undertakes.
足を出す
to put out one's legs―stretch out one's legs
人の前へ足を出すのは失礼だ
It is bad manners to thrust out your legs before people.
舌を出す
to put out one's tongue
(医者が患者に向かって)舌をお出しなさい
Show me your tongue.
内証で舌を出す
to put one's tongue in one's cheek―laugh in one's sleeve
胸を出す
to throw out one's chest
血を出す
to draw blood―bleed
鼻血を出す
One's nose bleeds―One bleeds at the nose.
力を出す
to put forth one's strength
精を出す
to put forth one's efforts―work hard
木が芽を出す
A tree puts forth its leaves.
勇気を出す
to muster up one's courage
船が速力を出す
A ship puts forth her speed.
全速力を出した
She put forth full speed―developed full speed.
二十ノットの速力を出した
She developed a speed of 20 knots.
顔を出す
to show one's face―call at a place
あそこへちょっと顔を出しておこう
I will just call at the house.
角を出す
to shoot one's horns―(焼餅を焼くの意味なら)―have a fit of jealousy
亀が首を出す
A tortoise puts out its head.
窓から首を出す
to put one's head out of the window
(泳ぐことはできないけれども)どうかこうか首だけ出しておった
I managed to keep myself above water.
口を出す
to interfere in a matter
君はこのことには口を出す権利が無い
You have no right to interfere in the matter.
彼はなんでもかでも口を出す
He will meddle in everything.
智慧を出す
to beat one's brains―cudgel one's brains
僕を出して下さい
Let me out!
犬が出たいのだから出しておやり
Let the dog out!

content: 2. (=取り出す、持ち出す、引き出す、呼び出す)to take out (the contents of a purse); to bring out (anything); to draw (one's purse, etc.)

content.content: 財布の中身を出す
to take out the contents of a purse
懐から財布を出した
He drew his purse from his bosom.
隠しから拳銃を出した
He drew a pistol from his pocket.
(火事の時に)道具を出す
to bring away the furniture
家は焼いても道具だけも出せばよかったに
If the house could not be saved from the flames, you might, at least, have brought away the furniture.
船を出す
to put to sea
舟を出す
to put off―push off
波が高くて舟が出せぬ
The sea is running too high for the boat to put off.
子どもを学校へ出す
to send one's children to school―(初めてなら)―put one's children to school
旗を出す
to put up a flag―hang out a flag
家ごとに国旗を出す
The national flag is put up at every door.
掲示を出す
to put up a notice
お迎えに馬車を出します
I will send a carriage for you.
(強盗が)金を出せ
Bring out your money!―Fork out your money!―Down with your dust!―(追いはぎなら)―Stand and deliver!
亭主を出せ
Bring your master here!
お箱を出す
to mount one's hobby
お箱を出し過ぎる
He rides his hobby to death.
盗み物を出す
to hand up stolen goods
樽から酒を出す
to draw wine from a cask
ランプの心を出す
to turn up the wick
品物を店へ出す
to expose an article in the store―put an article on sale
幽霊を出す
to raise a ghost

content: 3. (=差出す、提出する)to present, submit (a bill to the Diet); to present, prefer (a petition to the authorities); to lay (a bill) before (the Diet); to tender (one's resignation); to produce, bring forward (evidence); to give in, hand in, send in (one's papers)

content.content: 願書を出す
to present an application―file an application―give in one's papers―hand in one's papers
願書は地方庁を経て出すのだ
We must make an application through the local authorities.
請願書を出す
to present a petition―prefer a petition―file a petition
発議を出す
to lay a proposition before the meeting
辞表を出す
to tender one's resignation―send in one's papers
問題を出す
to give one a problem―set one a problem
試験問題を出す
to set an examination paper―set a paper
答案を出す
to give in one's paper―hand in one's paper
礼を出す
to offer one a fee―offer one something in token of my gratitude
礼を出してもなかなか取らない
I offered him money, but he would not take it.
作文を出す
to give in one's composition―hand in one's essay―lay one's exercise on the teacher's desk
証拠物件を出す
to produce evidence―bring forward evidence

content: 4. (=供する)to serve (tea or wine); to offer (one tea or wine); to provide (good cheer)

content.content: ご馳走を出す
to provide good cheer
茶を出す
to serve tea―offer one tea―(入れて暫く出すのは)―let the tea steep―let the tea draw
酒を出す
to serve wine―offer one wine
食事を出す
to serve the meal―set a dinner before one
(食卓にて給仕人が主人に向かって)次を出しましょうか
Shall I bring on the next course?

content: 5. (=出金する)to give (money); to pay (money)

content.content: 金を出す
to give money―put one's hand in one's pocket
いくら出すか
What will you give?
寄付金をいくら出して下さるか
What will you put your name down for?―What shall I put you down for?
どっさり金を出す、奮発して金を出す
to come down handsomely
彼は百円出した
He came down with 100 yen.
会費を出す
(クラブなどなら)to pay one's dues―(宴会などなら)―pay one's subscription
割前を出す
to pay one's share
良い馬はいくら出せば買えるか
What must one give for a good horse?
その洋服にいくら出したか
What did you give for your coat?
こんな物に三百円も出す奴がどこの世界にあるものか
Who ever heard of a man giving 300 yen for such trash?
そんな物に一文も出すものか
I would not give a farthing for it.

content: 6. (=供給する)to supply (one with expenses); to furnish (one with capital)

content.content: 伯(叔)父が学資を出してくれます
My uncle will supply one with my school-expenses.
資金を出す
to furnish the funds
商売をするなら資金を出してやろう
If you wish to engage in commerce, I will furnish you with capital.

content: 7. (=差立てる)to send (a parcel); to despatch (a telegram); to post, mail (a letter)

content.content: この手紙を郵便に出してくれ
Post this letter for me.
郵便を出す
to post a letter―(外国郵便なら)―mail a letter
手紙を出す
(郵送するのなら)to post a letter―(書を送るの意味なら)―write (a letter) to one
手紙を出しておいたからじきに返事があるだろう
I have written to him, and expect to hear from him very soon.
小包を出す
to send anything by parcel post
ハガキを出す
to drop a postcard

content: 8. (=発行する)to publish; to issue; to bring out

content.content: 本を出す
to publish a book―bring out a new work―put out a new work
新聞を出す
to publish a newspaper―issue a paper
雑誌を出す
to publish a magazine
彼は英字新聞を出そうとしている
He is going to start an English paper.

content: 9. (=掲載する)to insert, put (anything in a newspaper)

content.content: 新聞に出す
(広告なら)to put a notice in the papers―(記事なら)―write an account in a newspaper―(人の名なら)―put one's name in the paper
広告を出す
to put a notice in the papers―advertise in the papers―come out with an advertisement
売薬的の広告を出す
to come out with a dazzling advertisement

content: 10. (=さらす)to expose; to show; to bare

content.content: 太股を出す
to expose one's thighs―show one's thighs
膝を出す
to expose one's knees―show one's knees
腕を出す
to bare an arm
ぼろを出す
to expose oneself―unmask oneself
しっぽを出す
to show the cloven foot―betray the cloven hoof

content: 11. (=産出する)to produce; to turn out

content.content: 日本は偉い人を出した
Japan has produced great men.
あの学校は好い人を出している
The school has turned out good men.
雇人に暇を出す
to discharge a servant―dismiss an employee―(from one's service)
女房を出す
to divorce one's wife―put away one's wife
出された女房
a divorced wife
色を出す
to bring out the colour
艶を出す
to bring out the lustre
玉の光りを出す
to bring out the lustre of a gem
景物を出す
to offer a premium
食った物を出す
to vomit―throw up―cast up―fetch up―(the contents of one's stomach)
店を出す
to open a shop―(米国は)―open a store
名を出す
to publish one's name―give one's name
臨時列車を出す
to run a special train
質物を出す
to redeem a pawn
死傷者を出す
to give rise to casualties
声を出す
to utter a voice―utter a cry
声を出して読む
to read aloud

content:
だす〔出す〕
〈接尾動詞〉(=何々し出す)to begin (doing something); to fall to (doing something)

content.content: 雨が降り出した
It has begun raining.
吹き出した
It has begun blowing.
曇り出した
The sky has become overcast.
泣き出す
to fall to crying
家族は悲報に接して泣き出した
The family fell to crying at the sad news―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The sad news set the family crying.
冗談を言うと皆笑い出した
They fell to laughing over the joke―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The joke set them laughing.
Newton はリンゴの落ちるのを見て考え出した
Newton saw an apple fall, and fell to thinking―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The sight of an apple falling set Newton thinking.

content:
たすう〔多数〕
〈名〉
1. (=多い数) a large number; numbers; a multitude; a multiplicity; a plurality:(=の) many; a great many; a good many; a large number of (men); numbers of (men); a multitude of (men); crowds of (men); a multiplicity of (teachers); a plurality of (wives); an army of (reformers); a legion of (books); a host of (admirers); the mass (of people)

content.content: 多数の人
many people―a great many people―a multitude of people―numbers of people―great numbers of people―crowds of people
この地位には多数の望み手がある
There are many applicants for the position.
敵は多数を恃んでいる
The enemy rely on numbers―trust to numbers.
多数は安全なり
There is safety in numbers.
多数のために少数を犠牲する
to sacrifice the few to the many
世に多数の書あり
There are great numbers of books in the world―Books, their name is legion.
多数を占める
to predominate over the others
海軍には薩州出身者が多数を占めていた
Men of Satsuma extraction predominated in the navy.
多数に圧倒される
to be overwhelmed by numbers

content: 2. (=過半数) majority

content.content: こちらが多数だ
The majority is on our side―We have the majority on our side―We are in the majority.
採決の結果議案に反対者が多数であった
On division, the opponents to the bill were found in the majority.
百に対する二百五十の多数で通過した
It was passed by a majority of 250 to 100.
可とするもの多数、否とする者多数
The ayes have it―The noes have it.
大多数、大々多数
a large majority―an overwhelming majority―a swingeing majority
議案は大多数で通過した
The bill passed by a large majority.
危ない多数
a bare majority
百五十に対する百五十一の多数で通過した
It was carried by a bare majority of 151 to 150.
多数によって決する
to decide by majority
多数決
decision by majority
多数に圧倒される
to be overruled by the majority
多数を占める
to command a majority
政友会はその頃議会において絶対多数を占めていた
The Seiyukai then commanded an absolute majority in the House.
多数党
a majority party
多数党の横暴
the tyranny of the majority party

content:
たすうけつ〔多数決〕
〈名〉Decision by majority

content.content: 多数決にする
to decide by majority―Most votes carry the day

content:
たすかる〔助かる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=命などが助かる) to be saved; to be spared; to escape; to live; to survive (a disaster)

content.content: 命が助かった
His life is saved―(は病人など、罪人なら)―His life is spared.
彼はとても助かるまい
He can not be saved―It is impossible to save him.
助かるか助からないか
Will he be saved or lost?―Will he live or die?
あの時は僕は助からぬものと諦めておった
I had given myself up for lost.
君は助からぬものと断念した
We had given you up for lost.
あの破船で助かった者は少ない
Few survived the shipwreck―survived the disaster.
助かった者はありがたがっている
The survivors are thankful for their deliverance.
彼は不思議に助かった
He escaped by a miracle―He had a miraculous escape.
僕の助かったのは天祐だ
I congratulate myself on my escape.
君が助かったのは天祐だぜ
Bless your star that you have escaped!
彼は命からがら助かった
He escaped with bare life.
僕は危ない命を助かった、危ないところを助かった

I had a narrow escape―I had a near escape―I had a hairbreadth escape―It was a close shave―It was a close call―It was a near touch―I escaped by a hair's breadth―I missed it by the skin of my teeth―I was snatched from the jaws of death.
病人は助かりましょうか
Will the invalid live?
助かるか助からないか今夜できまる
This night decides whether he will live or die.
病人はとても助からない
The invalid is past human help―past hope of recovery―It is all over with―all up with―him―He is a gone case.
お陰で命が助かりました
You have saved my life―saved me from death.
一生を誤るところをお陰で助かりました
You have saved me from ruin.
会社が破産するところをお陰で助かりました
You have saved the company from bankruptcy.

content: 2. (=労、費用、困難などが助かる) to be saved (expense or trouble); to be relieved (of trouble)

content.content: 今度の男がよく働くので僕は大変助かる
My new man is very useful, and saves me much trouble.
それではだいぶ費用が助かります
That saves me much expense―It is a big saving to me.
この金を貰って助かった
The money has relieved me of my trouble.
この金を貸して下されば助かります
If you will lend me the money, I shall be relieved―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The money will relieve me.
そうして下さればたいそう助かります
It you will do so, I shall be greatly relieved―(他動詞構文にすれば)―You will greatly relieve me.

content: 3. (=助けになる) to be of help

content.content: そうして下さればたいそう助かります
That will be of great help to me.
君が来たので僕は助かった
Your arrival was my salvation―the salvation of me.

content:
たすき〔襷〕
〈名〉A cord to gird up the sleeves

content.content: 襷をかける
to gird up the sleeves with a cord―(に相当するは)―brace oneself up
襷がけでかかる
to brace oneself for an effort―buckle to one's task
襷十字に綾どる
to gird up one's sleeves with a cord
帯びに短し襷に長しで適当な人が無い
I can not find a suitable person.

content:
たすけ〔助け〕
〈名〉
1. (=助力) help; assistance; aid; support:(=る) to help (one do something); to assist, aid (one in one's work); to support (one's leader); to favour (the brave); to promote (health); to stand by (one's friend); to lend (one) a hand; to lend (one) a helping hand→『

content.content: すける〔助ける〕
人を助けて上げてやる
to help one up
人を助けて下ろしてやる
to help one down
老人を助けて馬車に乗せた
I helped the old man into the carriage.
彼を助けて馬車から下ろした
I helped him out of the carriage.
彼を助けて馬に乗せた
I helped him on his horse.
助けて馬から下ろした
I helped him off his horse.
彼は親父の仕事を助けている
He assists his father in his work.
僕は君に助けて貰おうと思って来た
I look to you for assistance.
君のほかに助けて貰う人は無い
I have no one but you to look to for assistance.
彼は事有る時に主人を助けた
He supported his master in the day of trouble.
運は勇者を佑く
“Fortune favours the brave.”
天は義運を佑けたり
Heaven favours the cause of justice.
果物の汁は消化を助ける
Fruit-juice promotes digestion.
助け合う
to help each other
困った時はお互いに助け合おうじゃないか
Let us stand by each other in time of need!
助けになる

to be a help to one―help to do something―tend to do something―have a share in doing something―be instrumental in doing something―contribute to some result―conduce to some state―go far towards the result―do much towards the result―make for some state
この字書はたいそう助けになります
This dictionary is a great help to me.
あの人はよほど助けになった
He proved a great help to me.
文学は国語を一定する助けになる
Literature helps to fix a language.
文学は心を磨く助けになる
Literature tends to refine the mind.
目的を遂行するに時期が助けになった
The times had a share in effecting my purpose―The times were instrumental in effecting my purpose.
君の助力は大いに僕の成功の助けになった
Your assistance has contributed much to my success―gone a long way towards my success―done much towards my success.
善行は身の幸福の助けになる
Good works will conduce to your welfare.
慈善事業は家の繁昌の助けになる
Works of charity will be conducive to the prosperity of the house.
日英同盟は東洋平和の助けになった
The Anglo-Japanese Alliance made for the peace of the East.
あのような人はまさかの時に助けにならぬ
Such a friend will fail you in time of need.

content: 3. (=救助、救済) help; relief; rescue; deliverance; succour:(=る) to help (one out of difficulties); to save (one from death or ruin); to rescue (one from drowning); to deliver (one from danger); to relieve (the poor); to succour (the needy)

content.content: 助けてー(!)
Help! help!
助けを呼ぶ
to cry for help
助けを呼ぶ声四方に起こる
Cries for help were heard on every side.
僕が困難に陥ったなら助けてくれ給え
When I am in trouble, you will help me out.
彼は僕の財政困難を助けてくれた
He helped me out of my difficulties.
人の命を助ける、死ぬ人を助ける
to save one's life―save one from death
破産に瀕した会社を助けてやった
I saved the company from bankruptcy.
あの人には河で助けられたことがある
He once rescued me from drowning.
猛火の中へ飛込んで女を助けた
I plunged into the fire, and rescued the woman from the flames.
人の難を助ける
to deliver a man from danger
人を助けに行く
to go to one's rescue
貧乏人を助ける
to help the poor―relieve the poor―succour the needy
医者に助けられた
My doctor has brought me through my illness―pulled me through.
弱きを助け強きをくじく
to help the weak and crush the strong―fight for the oppressed against the oppressor
助けると思ってお願いを聴いて下さい
For Heaven's sake, grant my request!
捨てる神があれば助ける神がある
“The angel goes out that the archangel may come in.”
芸は身を助く
Art brings bread.
芸が身を助けるほどの不幸せ
She is so unfortunate that her art must win her daily bread.

content: 4. (=助命) quarter:(=る) to give (one) quarter; to spare (one)

content.content: 命だけお助けを
Spare me!―Have mercy on me!―(敵に向かって言えば)―Quarter!
命は助けやす
I will spare your life.
殺そうか助けようか
Shall I kill or spare?

content:
たすけあう〔助け合う〕
〈自動〉To help each other

content.content: 困った時はお互いに助け合おうじゃないか
Let us stand by each other in time of need!

content:
たすけあげる〔助け上げる〕
〈他動〉To bring (one) to land; to pick up (a shipwrecked crew)

content.content: 河へ飛び込んで子どもを助け上げた
I plunged into the river, and brought the drowning child safe to land.
難船した人々が鹿島丸に助け上げられた
The shipwrecked men were picked up by the Kashima Maru.

content:
たすけぶね〔助け舟〕
〈名〉A rescue boat; a life-boat

content.content: 助け舟を出す
to launch a life-boat
助け舟ー(!)
Help! help!

content:
たずさえる〔携える〕
〈他動〉To have, carry, bring, take (anything) with one; to have (anything) in one's hand; to have (anything) in one's possession; to carry (anything) in one's hand

content.content: 彼はいつも傘を携えている
He always carries an umbrella with him―carries an umbrella in his hand.
手に本を携えている
He has a book in his hand.
手に本を携えて庭を散歩している
He is walking in the garden with a book in his hand―book in hand.
彼は妻子を携えていた
He had his wife and family with him.
妻子を携えて日本へ来た
He brought his family with him to Japan―He came over to Japan with his family.
妻子を携えて行った
I took my family with me―I went with my family.
旅人が携えておった大金を取られた
The traveller lost a large sum of money in his possession.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼は短銃を携えておった
He was armed with a revolver.

content:
たずさわる〔携わる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=手を出す) to meddle with (anything); to concern oneself with, be concerned with (anything); to have anything to do with (something)

content.content: 僕は哲学のようなむずかしいものには携わらぬ
I do not meddle with such deep things as philosophy.
物理化学は宇宙の大原因には携わらぬ
Physics and chemistry do not concern themselves with the First Cause―They have nothing to do with the Creator.
僕は政治には携わらぬ
I do not meddle with politics―I stand clear of politics.

content: 2. (=干与する) to meddle in (some affair); to concern oneself in, be concerned in (some affair); to participate in, take part in (some matter); to have a hand in (the affair)

content.content: 僕はこの事件には携わらぬ
I am not concerned in the affair―I have no hand in the affair―I wash my hands of the affair.
人のことに携わるな
Do not meddle in other's affairs!
学者は選挙運動などに携わるものでない
A scholar should not participate in―take part in―concern himself in―electioneering.
彼は何事にでも携わりたがる
He has a finger in every pie―He pokes his nose into everything.

content:
たずねびと〔尋ね人〕
〈名〉
1. →『

content.content: おたずねもの〔お尋ね者〕

content:
』
2. A wanted person

たずねもの〔尋ね者〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おたずねもの〔お尋ね者〕

content:
たずねる〔尋ねる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=問う) to ask (one a question―one about anything); to inquire (of one about anything); to demand (of one about anything)

content.content: 少々お尋ね申したいことが有る
I want to ask you a question―ask you something.
彼は僕にいろいろのことを尋ねた
He asked me several questions―asked me about several things.
彼は人にものを尋ねることを恥じる
He is ashamed to ask questions―above asking questions.
彼が尋ねたら言おうと思っておった
If he had asked me, I would have told him.
先生に尋ねてみたか
Have you asked your teacher?
試験のことをお尋ねに伺いました
I came to inquire of you about the examination.
巡査が僕の住所姓名を尋ねた
The policeman asked my name and address.
僕はそのわけを尋ねた
I asked the reason―inquired the reason―demanded the reason.
道を尋ねる
to ask the way―inquire (for) the way
ステーションへ行く道を尋ねた
I inquired for the way to the station.
途中で尋ねて家がわかった
I found the house by inquiring on the way.
尋ねても返事が無い
There is no reply to my question.
そんなことを尋ねるものじゃない
You should not ask such questions.
これは尋ねにくいことだ
It is a delicate question to ask.
人を尋ねる
to ask for―inquire for―a man
不在中に僕を尋ねた人は無かったか
Did any one ask for me―inquire for me―while I was out?
人の安否を尋ねる
to ask after―inquire after―a person
商売はご繁昌かと尋ねた
I inquired after his business.
ご病気はいかがですかと尋ねた
I inquired after his health.
彼に尋ねたらそのわけがわかるだろう
He will tell you the reason.
彼に尋ねたらそのことがわかるかも知れぬ
Perhaps he can throw light on the matter.
なお詳しいことは支配人にお尋ね下さい
For further particulars, please apply to my manager―For further particulars, I must refer you to my manager.
うるさく尋ねる
to trouble one with questions―pester one with questions―plague one with questions―ply one with questions
うるさく尋ねるようだがその金は何に要るのか
What do you want the money for, if I am not too inquisitive?
(習慣などの)由来を尋ねる
to inquire into the origin of a custom―trace a custom to its origin
古きを温ねて新しきを知る
We inquire of the ancients about modern affairs.

content: 2. (=捜す) to search for, look for, hunt for (anything missing):(求めるの意味なら) to seek for, look out for (something new)

content.content: 紛失した書類を尋ねたか
Have you searched for―looked for―the missing papers?
尋ねても無い
I have looked for them in vain―I can not find them.
尋ねる時は意地悪く無いものだ
When you look for anything, it will refuse to be found.
無いことがあるものか、よく尋ねてご覧
It must be there. Look well!
どこを尋ねても有りません
It is nowhere to be found.
彼はどこを尋ねてもいません
He is nowhere to be seen.
方々尋ねた
I have looked everywhere―hunted high and low.
家の中をすっかり尋ねた
I have searched the house from top to bottom.
彼は英語の先生の口を尋ねている
He is looking out for a position as teacher of English.
あの学校では英語の先生を尋ねている
They are looking out for an English teacher at that school.
あの角の家がお尋ねになる家です
That house on the corner is the one you want.
一人ずつ顔を見ても尋ねる人がいなかった
I examined their faces one by one, but could not find the man I wanted.
負ぶった子を三年尋ねる
to be absent-minded
七度尋ねて人を疑え
You must be on sure ground before you accuse.
尋ね出す
to find out anything―search out anything missing―seek out a position―look out a position―hunt out a book
尋ね人
a wanted person
お尋ね者
a fugitive from justice―one who is wanted by the police

content:
たずねる〔訪ねる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=訪問する) to visit (one); to pay (one) a visit; to call (on a person―at his house); to look (one) up; to knock up one's quarters; to beat up one's quarters:(立ち寄るの意味なら) to look in, drop in, blow in (upon one)

content.content: 彼は上京すると必ず訪ねてくれる
He makes a point of calling on me whenever he comes to town.
(彼はここにいるそうだから)いつか訪ねてみよう
I'll look him up―knock up his quarters―some day.
こちらの方へおいでの節はぜひお訪ね下さい
If you ever come up this way, do not fail to look in (upon me).
夕方になって二三の友人がふと訪ねて来た
A few friends dropped in―blew in―in the evening.
今日は妙な人が訪ねて来た
I have had a visit from a curious person―had a strange visit―today.

content: 2. (=在不在を問う) to ask for (one); to inquire for (one)

content.content: 不在中僕を訪ねた人は無かったか
Did any one ask for me―inquire for me―while I was out?―Has there been any callers in my absence?
人が訪ねたら病気だと言ってくれ
Should any one ask for me, say I am ill.

content:
たせい〔多勢〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: たぜい〔多勢〕

content:
たぜい〔多勢〕
〈名〉Great numbers; superior numbers; odds

content.content: 敵は多勢を恃んだ
The enemy relied on numbers―trusted to numbers.
多勢を恃んで油断した
They revelled in security in reliance on their numbers.
多勢の敵
a numerous enemy
多勢に無勢
We are outnumbered―We must fight against odds―There is no fighting against such odds―We stand no chance against such superior numbers.

content:
たせつ〔多節〕
〈形〉Polysyllabic

content.content: 多節語
a polysyllable

content:
たせん〔多銭〕
〈名〉Riches; Wealth

content.content: 多銭よく買う
“Money makes the mare to go.”

だせん〔唾腺〕
〈名〉The salivary glands

たそうでんりゅう〔多相電流〕
〈名〉A polyphase current; a multiphase current

content:
たそがれ〔黄昏〕
〈名〉Dusk; twilight; gloaming

content.content: たそがれ時に
at dusk―in the twilight―in the gathering twilight―in the gathering dusk

content:
だそく〔蛇足〕
〈名〉(Literally) a snake's legs; (hence) a superfluity

content.content: 蛇足を添える
to give a snake legs―add something superfluous
あの人は話の中へ得意なしゃれを無理に引っ張り出して蛇足を添える
He will drag in his favourite joke (by the head and shoulders)―lug his favourite joke into the discourse.

たそくるい〔多足類〕
〈名〉Myriapoda; the myriapods; the millepedes

content:
たた〔多々〕
〈形〉Very many

content.content: これは多々ある例の一例に過ぎぬ
This is only one-instance out of many.
多々ますます弁ず
The more, the better.

content:
ただ〔唯、只、徒〕
〈副〉
1. (=単に、唯) only; merely; solely; simply; but

content.content: 唯一つ
only one
神は唯一つあるのみ
There is only one God.
語学を修める方法は唯一つ、それは熟練である
There is only one way to master a language, and that is practice―(単文にすれ)―The only way to master a language is practice
唯一つの
the only―the sole
語学を修める唯一つの方法は熟練である
Practice is the only way to master a language.
学校を休む唯一つの理由は病気である
Illness is the only reason―the sole reason―for absenting oneself from school.
唯一人
only one man
成功したのは唯一人、君だけだ
Only one man has succeeded, and that is yourself―(単文にすれば)―You are the only man who has succeeded.
僕の友人というものは唯一人、君だけだ
I have only one friend, and that is yourself―(単文にすれば)―You are the only friend I have―You are my only friend.
唯一人で
all alone―all by oneself
唯一人で来ました
I came all by myself.
広い世界に唯一人
I am alone in the wide, wide world.
この作文に誤りが唯の一つも無い
There is not a single mistake in the whole composition.
二人の会わないことは唯の一日も無かった
Not a day passed without their meeting.
彼が嘘をついたことは唯の一度も無い
He never once told a lie.
彼は唯正直だけの値打だ
Honesty is his only merit―He is nothing if not honest.
唯冗談にそう言ったのさ
I said so only in joke.
勝利は唯一局部に過ぎぬ
The victory was only partial―but partial.
君が辞職するのは唯それだけの理由か
Is that your only reason―your sole reason―for resigning?
彼らは唯実地だけで学ぶ
They learn only by practice―by mere practice―by simple practice.
生徒は唯点数を取ることばかり考えている
The students are solely bent on getting good marks.
唯言われる通りにしておればよいのだ
You have only to do as you are told to.
彼は唯死ぬために米国へ行ったようなものだ
He went to America, only to die.
唯命これ従う
to be at one's beck and call
米国は唯金これ貴し
Almighty dollar―Dollar is almighty in America.

content: 2. (=無代価で、只で) gratis; gratuitously; free; free of charge; for nothing:(無報酬で) free; for fame

content.content: (欲しけれや)只で上げる
You shall have it free―gratis―for nothing.［注意］これに倣って
(浜へ行くと)魚は只で貰える
Fish may be had for the asking.
(蜜柑山へ行くと)蜜柑が只で貰える
Oranges may be had for the picking.
鉋屑は只で貰える
Shavings may be had for the gathering.
昔はこんな物は只で貰えたものだ
Such things used to be had for the taking―for nothing.
見本は只くれる
The samples are free.
これは只貰った
I received it as a gift―I had it at a gift―It was a free gift―It came to me by free gift.
そんな物は只貰っても要らない
I would not have it for the asking―I would not have it at a gift.
こりゃ只じゃ済まされぬ(奢れ奢れ)
I can't let you off for nothing. You must stand treat.
僕は報酬を取らずに只で書く
I write for fame.
只で教える
I am a free teacher.
配達は只です
The goods are delivered free of charge―We make no charge for the delivery.
只金を払う
to pay for nothing
只乗り
a free ride―a free passage
只乗り客
a free passenger―(米国にては)―a dead-head

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 価は只のようなものだ
The price is nominal.
只同様の価だ
It is a nominal price.
官地はほとんど只で払下げになる
The government land is transferred at a nominal price.
只ほど安いものは無い
The lowest price you can pay for a thing is to ask for it.
只ほど高いものは無い
The highest price you can pay for a thing is to ask for it.
元を洗えば只取った金(盗人の身代)
It was originally no fruit of labour.

content: 3. (=何もせずに) doing nothing; idle; unmolested

content.content: 彼は只居る
He is doing nothing―He is idle.
人は只居るものじゃない
A man should not be idle.
人はいくら金持ちでも只居るものじゃない
However rich a man may be, he ought not to eat the bread of idleness.
只置かぬ
not to let one alone―not to leave one unmolested―molest one
美人は世間で只置かぬ
A beautiful woman is not left alone―“A beautiful flower is soon plucked.”
そんなことをすると只は置かぬぞ
You shall smart for it.
そんなことを言うと只は置かぬぞ
You shall pay dearly for those words.

content: 4. (=に)(=いたずらに) vainly; in vain; to no purpose

content.content: 徒に月日を送る
to live to no purpose
徒に月日を送るものでない
You should live to some purpose.
あたら命を只棄てた
He threw away his precious life in vain.

content: 〈形〉(=の)(=普通の) common; ordinary; plain

content.content: (僕は位も何も無い)只の人間だ
I am a plain individual.
(彼は天才でも何でもない)只の人間だ
He is an ordinary mortal―a mediocrity.
十で神童、十五で才子、二十過ぎれば只の人
A prodigy at ten, a clever young man at fifteen, and a mediocrity after twenty―“A man at sixteen will prove a fool at sixty.”
あれは只の人じゃない
He is no common being.
あれは只の鼠じゃない
He is no common rascal.
これは只の場合ではない
This is no common case.

content:
ただ〔唯、只、徒〕
〈副〉
1. (=単に、唯) only; merely; solely; simply; but

only one
神は唯一つあるのみ

勝利は唯一局部に過ぎぬ
The victory was only partial―but partial.
君が辞職するのは唯それだけの理由か
Is that your only reason―your sole reason―for resigning?
彼らは唯実地だけで学ぶ
They learn only by practice―by mere practice―by simple practice.
生徒は唯点数を取ることばかり考えている
The students are solely bent on getting good marks.
唯言われる通りにしておればよいのだ
You have only to do as you are told to.
彼は唯死ぬために米国へ行ったようなものだ
He went to America, only to die.
唯命これ従う
to be at one's beck and call
米国は唯金これ貴し
Almighty dollar―Dollar is almighty in America.

content: 2. (=無代価で、只で) gratis; gratuitously; free; free of charge; for nothing:(無報酬で) free; for fame

content.content: (欲しけれや)只で上げる
You shall have it free―gratis―for nothing.［注意］これに倣って
(浜へ行くと)魚は只で貰える
Fish may be had for the asking.
(蜜柑山へ行くと)蜜柑が只で貰える
Oranges may be had for the picking.
鉋屑は只で貰える
Shavings may be had for the gathering.
昔はこんな物は只で貰えたものだ
Such things used to be had for the taking―for nothing.
見本は只くれる
The samples are free.
これは只貰った
I received it as a gift―I had it at a gift―It was a free gift―It came to me by free gift.
そんな物は只貰っても要らない
I would not have it for the asking―I would not have it at a gift.
こりゃ只じゃ済まされぬ(奢れ奢れ)
I can't let you off for nothing. You must stand treat.
僕は報酬を取らずに只で書く
I write for fame.
只で教える
I am a free teacher.
配達は只です
The goods are delivered free of charge―We make no charge for the delivery.
只金を払う
to pay for nothing
只乗り
a free ride―a free passage
只乗り客
a free passenger―(米国にては)―a dead-head

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 価は只のようなものだ
The price is nominal.
只同様の価だ
It is a nominal price.
官地はほとんど只で払下げになる
The government land is transferred at a nominal price.
只ほど安いものは無い
The lowest price you can pay for a thing is to ask for it.
只ほど高いものは無い
The highest price you can pay for a thing is to ask for it.
元を洗えば只取った金(盗人の身代)
It was originally no fruit of labour.

content: 3. (=何もせずに) doing nothing; idle; unmolested

content.content: 彼は只居る
He is doing nothing―He is idle.
人は只居るものじゃない
A man should not be idle.
人はいくら金持ちでも只居るものじゃない
However rich a man may be, he ought not to eat the bread of idleness.
只置かぬ
not to let one alone―not to leave one unmolested―molest one
美人は世間で只置かぬ
A beautiful woman is not left alone―“A beautiful flower is soon plucked.”
そんなことをすると只は置かぬぞ
You shall smart for it.
そんなことを言うと只は置かぬぞ
You shall pay dearly for those words.

content: 4. (=に)(=いたずらに) vainly; in vain; to no purpose

content.content: 徒に月日を送る
to live to no purpose
徒に月日を送るものでない
You should live to some purpose.
あたら命を只棄てた
He threw away his precious life in vain.

content: 〈形〉(=の)(=普通の) common; ordinary; plain

content.content: (僕は位も何も無い)只の人間だ
I am a plain individual.
(彼は天才でも何でもない)只の人間だ
He is an ordinary mortal―a mediocrity.
十で神童、十五で才子、二十過ぎれば只の人
A prodigy at ten, a clever young man at fifteen, and a mediocrity after twenty―“A man at sixteen will prove a fool at sixty.”
あれは只の人じゃない
He is no common being.
あれは只の鼠じゃない
He is no common rascal.
これは只の場合ではない
This is no common case.

content:
ただい〔多大〕
〈形〉Much; great; considerable; serious; heavy

content.content: 彼は不幸に逢って多大の同情を得た
His misfortune won him much sympathy.
多大の利益を得た
I realized a considerable profit..
多大の損害を蒙った
I suffered a heavy loss―sustained a serious loss―sustained a severe loss.
この勝利を得るには多大の犠牲を払った
The victory was gained at a great sacrifice of life.

content:
だたい〔堕胎〕
〈名〉Foeticide; wilful abortion:(=する) to commit foeticide; to cause abortion

content.content: 堕胎罪
criminal abortion―a criminal operation

content:
ただいま〔只今〕
〈副〉
1. (=目下) now; at present

content.content: 只今のところでは別に金の必要はありません
I have no particular need of money at present.
只今から田中さんの演説があります
Mr. Tanaka will now favour us with a speech.
今日只今より禁止
I give up drinking from now on.

content: 2. (=たった今) just; just now

content.content: 彼は只今見えました
He has just come―He came just now.
只今(帰りました)
Come home, sir!
只今(お帰りですか)
Welcome home:
只今帰鑑致しました
Come on board, sir!

content: 3. (=今じきに)soon; very soon; presently

content.content: 只今見えます
He will be here very soon―He will be here presently―He is coming.
(呼ばれて)はい只今
I am coming.

たたえる〔称える〕
〈他動〉To celebrate (one's deeds in song); to extol (one) to the skies

content:
たたえる〔湛える〕
〈他動〉To fill

content.content: 両眼に涙を湛える
One's eyes fill with tears―stream with tears.
満面に笑みを湛えた
His face was beaming with smiles.

content:
たたかい〔戦い〕
〈名〉
1. (=戦闘) a battle; a fight; an action; an engagement

content.content: 昔ここに戦いがあった
A battle was fought here of old.
関ケ原の戦いはいつあったか
When was the battle of Sekigahara fought?
戦いがいよいよ始まった
A battle has begun in earnest.
戦いが始まっている
A battle is going on.
戦い酣{たけなわ}なり
A battle is raging―The battle is in full swing.
戦いを挑む
to give battle to the enemy―challenge the enemy
戦いを交える
to join battle (with the enemy)
戦いに勝つ
to win a battle―win the day
戦いに負ける
to lose a battle―lose the day
戦い利あらず
The day is lost.
源平の戦い
a battle between the Minamotos and the Tairas
正々堂々の戦い
a pitched battle―a stand-up fight

content: 2. (=争闘) a strife; a struggle; a conflict; a contest; a war

content.content: 火と水の戦い
the strife of the elements―the war of the elements
恋愛と義務の戦いだ
It is a struggle between love and duty.

content: 3. (=一騎打) a combat

content.content: David と Goliath の戦い
a combat between David and Goliath
戦いを挑む
to throw down the gauntlet―fling down the glove

content: 4. (=戦争) a war

content.content: 戦いを宣す
to declare war

content:
たたかう〔戦う〕
〈自動〉
1. To fight (the enemy―with a power―for liberty); to engage (the enemy); to battle (with the waves); to contend (with difficulties); to struggle (with adversity); to strive (with the enemy)

content.content: 敵と戦う
to fight the enemy―engage the enemy
日本は満洲の平原でロシアと戦った
Japan fought with Russia on the plains of Manchuria.
国家の為に戦う
to fight for one's country―fight one's country's battles
自由の為に戦う
to fight for liberty
米国は独立の為に戦った
The Americans fought for independence.
正義の為に戦う
to fight in the cause of justice―battle for the right
最後まで戦ったのは敵ながらあっぱれだ
To his honour be it said that the enemy fought to the death―fell fighting to the last.
戦うくらいならあくまで戦え
If you do fight, fight it out.
必死の勇を振るって戦った
They fought desperately―fought with desperation―fought with the courage of despair.
真剣で戦う
to fight with real swords―fight hilt to hilt―cross swords with one
日本は戦うごとに勝った
Japan won every battle.
戦いつつ進む
to fight one's way―fight every inch of the ground
敵は戦う気が無い
The enemy have no stomach for fighting.
戦わずして勝つ
to conquer without firing a shot
戦わずして敵を悩ます政略
Fabian policy
戦わずして敵を悩ます
to resort to Fabian policy
困難と戦う
to contend with difficulties
彼は若い時ずいぶん困難と戦った
He had many difficulties to contend with in his youth.
逆境と戦う
to struggle with adversity
風波と戦う
to battle with the wind and waves
誘惑と戦った
I struggled with temptation―I was at grips with the devil.
運命と戦う
to strive against fate

content:
たたかわす〔戦わす〕
〈他動〉To set (dogs) fighting

content.content: 雄鶏を闘わす
to set cocks fighting
議論を戦わす
to engage in wordy warfare―join issue with one―argue it out

content:
たたき〔叩き〕
〈名〉
1. (=敲土) concrete facing; cement facing

content.content: 流しは叩きになっている
The scullery is faced with cement.
池を叩きにしよう
We will have the bed of the pond faced with concrete.

content: 2. (=鳥獣肉の叩き) mince-meat

たたきあい〔叩き合い〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: なぐりあい〔殴り合い〕

content:
たたきあう〔叩き合う〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: なぐりあい〔殴り合い〕

content:
たたきあげる〔叩き上げる〕
〈他動〉To lick (one) into shape:(自分でなら) to work one's way up

content.content: あれは小僧からたたき上げてやったのだ
I have licked him into shape―reared him from a boy.
あの男は小使いからたたき上げたのだ
He has worked his way up from a servant.

たたきあわせる〔叩き合わせる〕
〈他動〉To strike (things) together

content:
たたきおこす〔叩き起こす〕
〈他動〉To knock (one) up; to knock up one's quarters

content.content: 夜中に叩き起こされた
I was knocked up in the middle of the night.

content:
たたきおとす〔叩き落とす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=叩いて落とす) to strike (anything) down

content.content: 彼のピストルを叩き落とした
I struck his pistol from his hand.

content: 2. (=落とすの強声語) to drop (anything) to the ground; to let (anything) fall

たたきこむ〔叩き込む〕
〈他動〉To beat in

content.content: 先生がこの思想をしきりに僕の頭にたたき込んだ
My teacher beat this idea into my head.
この思想をいくら叩っ込んでも頭に入らぬ
I can not beat the idea into his head.

たたきだいく〔叩き大工〕
〈名〉A journeyman carpenter; a bungling carpenter

たたきたおす〔叩き倒す〕
〈他動〉To knock (a man) down

content:
たたきだす〔叩き出す〕
〈他動〉To beat (one) out of doors; to turn (one) out of doors

content.content: 女房を叩きだす
to put away one's wife

content:
たたきつける〔叩き付ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=叩くの強声語) to strike; to beat; to thrash

content.content: うんと叩きつけてやった
I gave him a sound thrashing.

content: 2. (=投げ与える) to throw (anything to one)

content.content: 悔しいから札をたたきつけて出て来た
I was so vexed that I threw the bank-notes at him and flung away.

content:
たたきわけ〔叩き分け〕
〈名〉Share and share alike; going shares; going halves

content.content: 叩き分けで稼いでいる
She goes shares in her earnings.

content:
たたく〔叩く〕
〈他動〉
1. To strike; to beat; to hit; to thrash; to knock; to rap; to tap; to slap; to clap (hands)

content.content: 女房を打つな叩くな
Don't beat her!
うんと叩いてやった
I gave him a sound thrashing.
人の頭を叩く
to strike one on the head―hit one over the head
太鼓を叩く
to beat the drum―(お太鼓をするの意味なら)―toady
門を叩く
to knock at the door
門を叩く音がする、誰か門を叩いている
There is a knock at the door.
門が割れるように叩く音がした
I heard a thundering knock at the door.
門を打てども叩けども応ずる者のあらばこそ
I might knock and knock at the door, but never a man answered me.
戸を叩く
to tap at the door―(は軽く、強くなら)―rap at the door
ステッキで窓をトントンと叩いた
I tapped the window with my stick―tapped my stick against the window.
卓を叩く
to strike (on) the table―rap on the table―hammer the table―bang the table
卓を叩いてそう言った
He said so with a rap on the table.
卓を叩いて論ずる
to discuss a question at a white heat
畳叩いて「まあお聴きなさい」と言った
“Listen to me!” said she, with a rap on the table.
胸を叩く
(歎いてなら)to beat the breast―(医者なら)―tap the breast
人の背中を叩く
to slap one on the back―pat one on the shoulder
人違いをして背中を叩いた
I slapped the wrong man on the back.
平手で人の頬を叩く
to slap one on the cheek
手を叩く
(拍手なら)to clap one's hands―(人を呼ぶためなら)―clap hands
手を叩いて笑った
He clapped his hands for joy.
ご用の節は手をお叩き下さい
Please clap hands when you want me.
(芥を払うために)敷物を叩く
to beat the carpet
石橋を叩いて渡る
to be over-prudent
新聞で叩かれる
to be attacked by the papers―lashed in the papers
彼は新聞でひどく叩かれた
He has been severely lashed in the papers.
人の意を叩く
to sound one's views―feel one's pulse―feel out one's views
このことについて彼の意見を叩いてみよう
I will sound him on the subject.
専門家の意見を叩く
to take advice

content:
ただごと〔只事〕
〈名〉Nothing out of the common; nothing serious; nothing alarming

content.content: 只事でない
It is a serious matter.
こりゃ只事であるまい
It must be something serious―something out of the way.
この風説は只事でない
The rumour in alarming.

content:
だだこねる〔駄駄こねる〕
〈自動〉(子どもなら)to stamp one's feet on the ground (in token of strong insistence or refusal); to fret:(一般に言えば)to break out into violent behaviour (in order to gain one's end)

content.content: お母さんがいないので子どもが駄駄ばかりこねています
Mamma is away, and the child does nothing but fret.
娘が死ぬの生きるのと駄駄こねてとうとう意地を通した
She talked of dying and finally had her own way.

content:
だだこねる〔駄駄こねる〕
〈自動〉(子どもなら)to stamp one's feet on the ground (in token of strong insistence or refusal); to fret:(一般に言えば)to break out into violent behaviour (in order to gain one's end)

content.content: お母さんがいないので子どもが駄駄ばかりこねています
Mamma is away, and the child does nothing but fret.
娘が死ぬの生きるのと駄駄こねてとうとう意地を通した
She talked of dying and finally had her own way.

content:
たださえ〔只さえ〕
〈副〉To add to...

content.content: 只さえ苦しいのに腹までへってきた
To add to our discomfort, hunger began to make itself felt.
只さえ困っているところへ病人までもできた
To add to our misery,―To make matters worse,―one of us fell ill.
只さえ悪いのにその年は凶作ときた
To add to the evil,―To make matters worse,―the harvest failed.
只さえ騒がしい世の中にペルリが艦隊を率いてきた
To add to the tumult, Perry arrived with his squadron.
只さえ豊かでなかった彼は損をしたためにますます窮乏に陥った
To add to his destitution, he suffered a loss which reduced him to greater want.

content:
ただし〔但し〕
〈接続詞〉Provided that; however; but; only

content.content: 但し外人はこの限りにあらず
Provided that this rule does not apply to foreigners―Foreigners, however, are exempted from this rule.
但しそこが疑問だ
But that is the question.
彼は約束はする、但し履行せぬ
He does make promises, only he never keeps them.
この本ならぜひお読みなさい、但し読むなら注意してお読みなさい
Read this book by all means, only read it carefully.→『ただしづき〔但し付き〕』

content:
ただしい〔正しい〕
〈形〉
1. (=正当な)right (conduct); rightful (heir); lawful (claims); legitimate (conclusion, etc.)

content.content: 彼は心が正しい
He is right-hearted―His heart is in the right place.
僕は正しいと思うことをする
I do what is right in my sight.
正しい道を踏む
to tread the right path―tread the path of right
君のやり方は正しい(正しくない)
You go about it (in) the right way―(in) the wrong way.
彼は正しい相続人だ
He is the rightful heir.
これは正しい申し分だ
These are lawful claims.
正しい行動だ
It is a rightful action―a lawful action.
正しい結論だ
It is a legitimate conclusion.

content: 2. (=正義に適った)just (judgment); righteous (conduct)

content.content: 正しい裁判だ
It is a just judgment.
正しい要求だ
There are just demands―lawful claims.
彼は正しい人だ
He is a righteous man.

content: 3. (=正確な)correct (English); accurate (knowledge)

content.content: 彼の英語は正しい
He speaks correct English.
この文は文法上正しい(正しくない)
The sentence is grammatically correct―grammatically incorrect.
君の言い方は正しい
You express yourself correctly.
こう言って正しいですか
Is it good English to say “It is me?”
そう言っては正しくない
It is not good English to say so.
正しい発音
correct pronunciation
正しく発音する
to pronounce correctly

content: 4. (=正直な)honest (calling); upright (man)

content.content: 正しい職業
an honest calling―a legitimate occupation
彼は正しい業に就いている
He lives an honest life―lives on the square.
正しい人だ
He is an honest man―an upright man―a righteous man.

content: 5. (=行儀正しい)proper

content.content: 正しい行い
proper conduct―right conduct―righteous conduct
正しい行いをする
to conduct oneself properly
正しい振る舞い
proper behaviour
正しく振る舞う
to behave properly
彼は品行が正しい
He conducts himself properly―He is well-conducted.
行儀が正しい
He behaves properly―He is well-behaved.
礼儀が正しい
He is polite―well-bred.

content:
6. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 君の論法は正しい
Your logic is sound.
彼は血統が正しい
He is of pure blood.
規律が正しい
The discipline is strict.

ただしがき〔但し書き〕
〈名〉A proviso; a provisory clause; a saving clause; a conditional clause; a condition; a reservation; a stipulation

content:
ただしづき〔但し付き〕
〈名〉Conditional

content.content: 但し付きの約束
a conditional promise
あれは但し付きの代物だ
He is a questionable character.

content:
ただしは〔但しは〕
〈接続詞〉Or

content.content: わざとしたのか但しは偶然か
Was it done by design or by accident?

content:
たたしむ〔起たしむ〕
〈他動〉To rouse (one) to activity

content.content: 彼の弁舌遂に眠れる獅子を起たしむ
His eloquence finally roused the sheeping lion to activity.
その雄弁儒夫をして起たしむるの力有り
His eloquence has power to rouse the timid to activity―to kindle the spark that slumbers in the heart of men.

content:
ただす〔質す〕
〈他動〉To ask (one a question); to inquire (of one about anything)

content.content: 学者に質す
to ask a scholar―inquire of a scholar
専門家に質してみるがよい
You ought to consult a professional man―take advice.
不審の点を質しておこう
I will clear up the doubtful points.

content:
ただす〔正す〕
〈他動〉To correct (a mistake); to rectify (an error); to set (one) right; to mend (one's ways); to amend (one's conduct); to adjust (one's dress)

content.content: 誤りを正す
to correct a mistake―rectify an error
次の文中に誤りあらば正せ
Correct mistakes, if any, in the following:―
彼は誤解していたから正してやった
He was mistaken, so I set him right.
行いを正す
to mend one's ways―amend one's conduct
衣紋を正す
to adjust one's dress―put oneself straight
襟を正す
to put oneself straight―(つつしみかしこむの意味なら)―be awed
その堂に入ると覚えず襟を正す
The hall is awe-inspiring.
見る者をしてそぞろに襟を正さしむ
The spectator is awed in spite of himself.
襟を正して聴く
to listen with attention
威儀を正す、威容を正す
to sit up straight―(は日本、西洋は)―draw oneself up
彼は威儀を正して控えておった
I found him seated in a dignified attitude.

content:
ただす〔糺す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=確かめる)to ascertain, make sure of, assure oneself of, convince oneself of, satisfy oneself of (the fact); to verify (a statement, etc.)

content.content: 真偽を糺す、実否を糺す
to ascertain the truth―make sure of the fact―convince oneself of the fact
早速実否を糺そう
I will ascertain the truth at once.
実検して真偽を糺さなければ信じられぬ
I must make sure of the fact―convince myself of the fact―by personal inspection.
実否を糺してから人を疑え
Be on sure ground before you accuse.
君の言うことは実否を糺さなければ信ぜぬ
I must verify your statement.

content: 2. (=調べる)to investigate (a matter); to inquire into (the cause); to examine into (details); to look into (a case)

content.content: 原因を糺さなければならぬ
We must inquire into the cause.
身元を糺す
to inquire into one's birth and parentage―(溺死者などなら)―prove one's identity―identify a corpse
その人を雇う前に人物を糺さなかったのが悪い
You ought to have inquired into his character before employing him.
もとを糺す
to inquire into the origin―go to the root of the matter―go to the bottom of things
もとを糺せば
originally
人間はもとを糺せば動物
Man is originally an animal.
もとを糺せば只取った金(盗人の身代)
It was originally no fruit of labour.
もとを糺せば深い仲
They were lovers once.
もとを糺せば嘘は人情
When you go to the root of the matter, falsehood is but a part of human nature.
この習慣はもとを糺せば仏教
The custom takes its rise in Buddhism―The custom is derived from Buddhism―The custom is to be traced to Buddhism.
