content:
たちさる〔立去る〕
〈自動〉To depart; to leave; to go away; to take oneself off; to make oneself scarce

content.content: 立ち去れ
Begone!―Begone about your business!―Go away!―Take yourself off!―Make yourself scarce!―Out of my sight!―Away with you!―(古文体にては)―Avaunt!
彼に立ち去れと命じた
I ordered him away―sent him about his business.
疑いが晴れたから安心して立ち去れ
You are cleared of suspicion. You may depart in peace.
こんなところに長居は無用と立ち去った
I took a hurried leave to avoid trouble.

content:
たちすくむ〔立竦む〕
〈自動〉To be transfixed to the ground; to be rooted to the spot; to be petrified; to be paralyzed

content.content: その恐ろしい光景を見て皆立ちすくんでしまった
Everybody stood transfixed at the dreadful sight.
彼はあまりの恐ろしさに立ちすくんでしまった
He was paralyzed with fear―petrified with terror.

content:
たちづめ〔立ち詰め〕
〈名〉(動詞に訳して) to keep standing; to keep on one's legs

content.content: 一日立ちづめで休む暇が無い
I keep on my legs all day―I am never off my legs all day.
電車が満員で終始立ちづめさ
The car was so full that I kept standing all the time.

content:
たちどころに〔立所に〕
〈副〉Then and there; on the spot; on the instant; in an instant; instantly; immediately; directly; at once; in a twinkling

content.content: 衆議たちどころに一決した
Then and there was the question decided―They came to a decision on the spot.
彼の一言で問題がたちどころに解決した
A word of his settled the question on the instant.
この薬を一滴飲むと痛みはたちどころに去る
Take a drop of this medicine, and the pain is gone in a twinkling.
一句たちどころに浮かぶ
I was immediately inspired with a line.

content:
たちどまる〔立ち止まる〕
〈自動〉To stop; to come to a stop; to halt; to come to a halt; to stand still; to come to a standstill

content.content: 急に立ち止まる
to stop short―bring up short―put up short
馬がピタリ立ち止まって進まぬ
My horse came to a full stop.
行列が立ち止まる
The procession halts―comes to a halt.
工事が立ち止まる
The works stand still―come to a standstill.
工事が立ち止まっている
The works are at a standstill.

たちなおる〔立直る〕
〈自動〉To rally

たちならぶ〔立並ぶ〕
〈自動〉To stand in a row

たちのうお〔太刀の魚〕
〈名〉A kind of ribbon-fish

content:
たちのき〔立退き〕
〈名〉Vacation; evacuation; removal; quitting (a house)

content.content: 借家人に立ち退きを命ずる(たなだてを食わせる)
to give a tenant notice to quit―serve a notice on a tenant―evict a tenant―eject a tenant
家主に立ち退きを命ぜられた
My landlord has given me notice to quit―I have notice to quit.
立ち退き命令
eviction―ejectment
彼は家賃を払わないために立ち退き命令を受けた
He was evicted―threatened with eviction―for non-payment of rent.
立ち退き料
a compensation for removal
立ち退き場、立ち退き先
a refuge

content:
たちのく〔立退く〕
〈自他動〉To quit, vacate (a house); to leave, desert (a house or town); to evacuate (a town or a country)

content.content: 早速この家を立ち退いて貰いたい
I want you to quit at once.
借家人を立ち退かせる
to give a tenant notice to quite―serve a notice on a tenant―evict a tenant―eject a tenant
彼は家賃を払わないために家を立ち退かせられた
He was evicted for non-payment of rent.
東京を立ち退かねばならぬ
I must leave the city.
敵が侵入した時市民が立ち退いた
When the country was invaded, the townspeople deserted the town.
敵は市民の立ち退いた後へ入って来た
The enemy entered the deserted town.
その家へ行ってみると家人が立ち退いた後であった
We found the house deserted.
家人の立ち退いた家
a deserted house
どこへ立ち退く
to take refuge somewhere
洪水のため村民は山寺へ立ち退いた
Owing to the flood, the villagers took refuge in a mountain temple.

content:
たちのぼる〔立上る〕
〈自動〉To rise; to ascend

content.content: 煙が立ち上る
Smoke rises into the air.

content:
たちは〔立端〕
〈名〉A chance to leave

content.content: 立端を失う
to lose a chance to go

content:
たちば〔立場〕
〈名〉
1. (=立つ場所) a station

content.content: 立場をとる
to take up one's station
都合の好い所に立場をとった
I took up my station at a convenient position―took up a convenient station.

content: 2. (=立脚地) a position; a situation; ground

content.content: (議論の)立場をきめる
to decide on one's position
立場を明らかにする
to define one's position
君は議論の立場を異にしている
You argue from a different position.
議論の立場を換える
to shift one's ground―change front
人の立場を奪う
to cut the ground from under one's feet
それでは僕は立場が無くなる
Then I shall lose ground―have the ground slide from under me.
安全な立場を占める
to stand on safe ground
彼は不安な立場だ、危ない立場だ
He stands on slippery ground―He has a ticklish footing.
彼は苦しい立場だ
He is in a delicate position―in an awkward situation.
君にそうされると僕は苦しい立場になる
You place me in a delicate position.
そうすれば日本は戦争をしなければならない立場になる
Then Japan will have war forced upon her―Then Japan will be embroiled in a war.

content: 3. (=足場) a footing; a foothold

content.content: 社会に立場を得る
to gain a footing―obtain a foothold―in society
立場を失う
to lose one's footing
そうすると僕は立場が無くなる
Then I shall lose my footing―Then where do I come in?
立場を失わぬ
to keep one's footing
そうなっても君の立場はある
You can keep your footing.

content: 4. (=見地) a standpoint; a point of view

content.content: 商業上の立場から見れば事重要である
The matter is important from a commercial standpoint―from a commercial point of view.
立場を変えて人生を見る
I now see life from a new standpoint.

content:
たちはたらく〔立ち働く〕
〈自動〉To work; to go about one's work

content.content: 彼はハキハキ立ち働く
He works with a will.
まじめに立ち働く
He goes about his work in earnest.
敏活に立ち働く
He moves with alacrity―He is prompt in action.
まめまめしく立ち働いている
He is faithful in my service.

たちばな〔橘〕
〈名〉A kind of orange

content:
たちばん〔立番〕
〈名〉(巡査のは) point-duty:(番兵のは) guard; sentry-go:(=する) to be on guard; to stand guard; to be on sentry; to stand sentry; to be on point-duty

content.content: 立番を置く
to post a guard
立番の巡査
a pointsman

content:
たちふさがる〔立ち塞がる〕
〈自動〉To stand in one's way; to block one's way; to bar one's way ; to confront (one)

content.content: 彼は狂って走って来る大猪の前に大手を広げて立ちふさがった
He opened his arms and barred the way to a raging boar.
一人の学生が少年の前に立ちふさがって名を聞いた
A student confronted the boy with a question.
一人の大男が入口に立ちふさがった
A huge man blocked the door―framed himself in the door.

たちふるまい〔起振舞〕
〈名〉Behaviour; demeanour; bearing; carriage; deportment; comportment

content:
たちぶるまい〔立振舞〕
〈名〉A farewell dinner(given by a departing person)

content.content: 立ち振る舞いをする
to give a farewell dinner

たちふるまう〔起振舞う〕
〈自動〉To behave (oneself), demean oneself, bear oneself, carry oneself, comport oneself (how?)

content:
たちまさる〔立勝る〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: まさる〔勝る〕

content:
たちまち〔忽ち〕
〈副〉
1. (=瞬く間に) in a twinkling; in a moment; in an instant; instantly; immediately; soon

content.content: この薬を一滴飲むと痛みがたちまち去る
Take a drop of this medicine, and the pain will be gone in a twinkling.
この手術はたちまち済む
The operation is over in a moment.
この薬を飲むとたちまち楽になります
This medicine will give you immediate relief.
風説がたちまち全市に広まった
The rumour soon spread all over the town.
たちまち起ってたちまち止む
It passes like smoke.
彼が来るとこんなものはたちまち平らげる
He will make short work of it.
彼はたちまち名を揚げた
He awoke one morning to find himself famous.

content: 2. (=にわかに)suddenly; on a sudden; all of a sudden; all at once

content.content: たちまち起こる人馬の足音
All at once were heard the tramps of a multitude―A sound of multitudinous feet burst on their ears.
角を曲ればたちまち現る壮麗なる光景
When we turned the corner, a magnificent sight burst on the view.

content:
たちまわり〔立廻り〕
〈名〉
1. (=芝居の立廻り) a fighting scene

content.content: あの役者は立ちまわりが好い
He is at his best in a fighting scene.

content: 2. (=活劇)a scene

content.content: 夫婦が大立ちまわりをやった
The couple made a scene.
うちへ帰ると立ちまわりが始まるぞ
When you go home, there will be a scene.

content: 3. (=取っ組み合い)a scuffle; a tussle; a rough-and-tumble (fight)

content.content: それから一場の立ちまわりとなった
Then a scuffle ensued.
転びつまろびつの立ちまわりになった
There was a rough-and-tumble.

content:
たちまわる〔立廻る〕
〈自動〉To act; to conduct oneself; to play one's part; to go to work

content.content: 彼は上手に立ちまわる、下手に立ちまわる
He plays his cards well―plays his cards badly.
はしこく立ちまわる
He is quick―He is prompt in action.
はしこく立ちまわれ
Look sharp!
こすく立ちまわる
to go shrewdly to work
彼は利口に立ちまわっていつも儲ける
He goes so shrewdly to work that he always comes off a gainer.
世の中は立ちまわりよう一つだ
Everything depends on how you play your part.

content:
たちみ〔立見〕
〈名〉Seeing a play from the topmost gallery

content.content: 一幕立ち見しようじゃないか
Let us see an act from the gallery!
立ち見客
the gallery―the gods
立ち見場
the upper gallery

content:
たちむかう〔立向う〕
〈他動〉To confront (the enemy); to stand up to, square up to (an adversary); to make head against (the enemy)

content.content: 日露戦争までは欧州軍に立ち向える東洋人は無いと思っておった
Before the Russo-Japanese War, the Europeans believed that no Orientals could stand up to a Western army.
侵入軍に立ち向かう兵は無かった
There were no troops that could make head against the invaders.

たちもち〔太刀持ち〕
〈名〉A sword-bearer

content:
たちもどる〔立戻る〕
〈自動〉To return

content.content: 本問題に立ち戻ります
To return to our subject.

content:
たちもの〔裁ち物〕
〈名〉Cutting out cloth:(=する) to cut out cloth

content.content: 裁ち物板
a cutting-board―a tailor's board
裁ち物庖丁
a tailor's knife

たちもの〔断ち物〕
〈名〉Abstinence from some food:(=する) to abstain from some food

content:
たちやく〔立役〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: たてやく〔立て役〕

content:
たちゆく〔立ち行く〕
〈自動〉To be capable of being kept up

content.content: 学校は立ち行くか
Can you keep up the school?
あの学校はあればかりの生徒では立ち行くまい
I don't think the school can be kept up with such a small number of students.
これくらいの商売では店が立ち行かない
We can not keep up the house with such small business―Such small business won't do to keep up the house.
こう不景気では小商人は立ち行かない
The times are so bad that small tradesmen can not keep up their business.

content:
だちょう〔駝鳥〕
〈名〉The ostrich

content.content: 駝鳥の羽根
ostrich plumes

content:
たちよる〔立ち寄る〕
〈自動〉To stop (at a place); to call (at a house); to look in, drop in, blow in (on a man)

content.content: 途中仙台へ立ち寄って行きます
I shall stop at Sendai on the way.
彼がいそうだと思う心当りの処へはことごとく立ち寄ってみた
I called at every likely house.
こちらの方へおいでの節はぜひお立ち寄り下さい
If you ever come up this way, don' fail to look in.
そこへ友人が二三人立ち寄ってくれた
A few friends dropped in―blew in―at the moment.

content:
だちん〔駄賃〕
〈名〉A pack-horse charge:(より)a reward (for one's trouble)

content.content: さあお使いの駄賃だよ
Here is something for your trouble.
行きがけの駄賃に有金をさらって行った
He swept the ready money by way of an extra job.

たちんぼう〔立ん坊〕
〈名〉A street tramp; a (grown-up) street arab

content:
たつ〔起つ〕
〈自動〉To rise; to rouse oneself; to bestir oneself; to be up (and doing)

content.content: 病床に臥して再び起たず
He lay down, never to rise again.
挙国一致して起つ
The nation rose as one man.
干戈{かんか}を執って起つ
to rise in arms
圧政に逆らって起つ
to rise against oppression
政府に敵対して起つ
to rise in against―rebel against―revolt against―the government
今度は起つ決心だ
I will rise―bestir myself―this time.
機の熟するを見て彼は猛然として起った
Seeing that the time was come, he roused himself to action with a determined air.
起てよ武夫{ますらお}
Be up and doing, ye warriors!
その雄弁遂に眠れる獅子を起たしむ
His eloquence finally roused the sleeping lion to activity.
彼の雄弁は儒夫をして起たしたむるの力有り
His eloquence has power to rouse the timid and idle to activity―to kindle the spark that slumbers in the heart of men.
国家の為に起つ
to respond to the call of duty―come to the rescue of one's country
正義の為に起つ
to take up the cause of justice
起ってこの難局に当たる者は誰ぞ
Who will grapple with the situation?

content:
たつ〔経つ〕
〈自動〉To pass; to elapse; to expire; to pass away; to pass by; to go by; to go on

content.content: 時がたつ
Time passes―Time elapses―Time goes by―Time goes on.
時が早くたつ
Time flies.
月日のたつのは早いものだ
Time flies―Swift is the flight of time.
時が次第にたつ
Time wears on.
いつの間にか時がたつ、時が知らぬ間にたつ
Time glides on―glides by―slides away―slips by―slips along.
時のたつのを知らずにいた
I took no note of time―I was unconscious of the flight of time.
時がたっているから思い出せない
I can not recollect the affair at this distance of time.
面白く遊んでいると時間が早くたつ
Pleasure makes the hours fly.
千秋の思いで一日たった
The day dragged on.
幾日たっても便りが無い
Days passed without a line from him.
日数がたつから跡がもうわかるまい
The traces must have been obliterated as days have passed since.
彼が死んでから三年たつ
Three years have elapsed since he died―(を通例)―It is three years since he died.
そのことがあってから多くの年月がたっている
Years have elapsed since it happened―(を通例)―It is years since it happened.
彼が行ってから一月もたつがまだ便りが無い
It is a month since he left, but I have not heard from him.
一年たってからまた逢った
We met again after a year had elapsed―after the lapse of a year―at the expiration of a year―at the end of a year―after a year―a year after―a year later.
一時間たってからまた来い
Come again in an hour's time!
一年たてどもまだ見えぬ、二年たてどもまだ見えぬ
I have waited for him a year―two years―in vain.
一月たたぬに金が無くなった
It was not a month before I was out of money.
一年たたぬに皆覚えてしまった
It was not a year before he mastered everything.
一年たつかたたぬにこの始末
A year has hardly elapsed when things have come to this.
二人は結婚して一月たたぬに夫婦げんかを始めた
They had not been married a month before they began to quarrel.
彼は入学して一年もたたぬに飽きてきた
He had not been in the school a year before he began to grow tired of it.
まだ暫くたたなければできません
It will not be ready for some time yet―It will be some time before it is ready.
先生、僕の病気はどれほどたたなければ治りませんか
How long will it be before I am well, doctor?
一カ月もたたなければ君の病気は治らぬ
It will be a month before you are well.
月日がたつに従って彼の決心が弱くなった
As time went by, his resolution grew weaker―His resolution grew weaker with the lapse of time―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Time made his resolution weaker.
月日がたつにつれて悲しみが薄らいだ
As time went on, my grief subsided―My grief subsided with the lapse of time―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Time blunted the edge of my grief.→『たてば〔経てば〕』

content:
たつ〔裁つ、截つ〕
〈他動〉To cut

content.content: 上衣を裁つ
to cut a coat―cut out a coat
寸法に合わして裁つ
to cut a coat to measure
二つに截つ
to cut anything in two
皮を細く截って皮紐にする
to cut a hide into strips―slit a hide
鉄截つ如き弁舌
incisive speech―trenchant wit

content:
たつ〔裁つ、截つ〕
〈他動〉To cut

content.content: 上衣を裁つ
to cut a coat―cut out a coat
寸法に合わして裁つ
to cut a coat to measure
二つに截つ
to cut anything in two
皮を細く截って皮紐にする
to cut a hide into strips―slit a hide
鉄截つ如き弁舌
incisive speech―trenchant wit

content:
たつ〔絶つ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=断絶する) to sever; to cut; to cut off; to break off

content.content: 関係を絶つ
to sever relations―break off relations―sever connections―cut the connection―(between the two)
いっさい関係を絶つ
I cut the whole concern.
僕はこの事件とは関係を絶つ
I wash my hands of the affair.
連絡を絶つ
to sever the connection―cut off the communication―(between the two)
独軍は英仏軍の連絡を絶とうとした
The Germans attempted to cut off communication between the British and the French.
本隊との連絡を絶つ
to cut off a party from the main body
交際を絶つ
to break off friendship with one―sever acquaintance with one―cut connection with one―break with one
君とは交際を絶つ
I will never speak to you again―I will have nothing more to do with you―I have done with you for the future.
国交を絶つ、外交関係を絶つ
to sever diplomatic relations―break off diplomatic relations―with a Power
恩愛の契りを絶つ
to sever family ties
親類縁者と交際を絶つ
to cut loose from all ties
旧習を絶つ
to cut loose from old habits
宗教を絶つ
to abjure one's faith―renounce one's faith

content: 2. (=絶滅する) to exterminate; to extirpate; to eradicate; to suppress; to blot (anything) out of existence; to wipe (anything) out of existence

content.content: (悪弊などの)根を絶つ
to eradicate an evil―extirpate an abuse―suppress an evil―put down an evil―root out an evil
根を絶ち葉を枯らす
to suppress an evil root and branch
病根を絶つ
to strike at the root of the evil―lay the axe to the root of the evil―effect a radical cure
望みを絶つ
(自分でなら) to despair―(他からなら)―blight one's hopes―blast one's hopes―dash one's hopes―extinguish one's hopes
成功の望みを絶った
I despair of success.
この不幸に逢って成功の望みを絶った
The misfortune has dashed my hopes of success.
命を絶つ
to put an end to one's life―kill one
跡を絶つ、影を絶つ
to blot anything out of existence―wipe anything out of existence
悪弊が跡を絶った
The evil has been wiped out of existence―The evil has disappeared.
軍国主義はいまに地上に跡を絶つようになる
Militarism will soon be blotted off the face of the earth―Militarism will soon disappear off the face of the earth.
武力をもって世界を圧した二大国は地上にその影を絶った
The two mighty powers, which domineered over the world by their military power, have been wiped off the face of the earth.
堂々たる艦隊は海上にその影を絶ったのであった
The vaunted armada had been wiped off the face of the deep.

content:
たつ〔辰〕
〈名〉The dragon (one of the twelve zodiacal signs)

content.content: 辰の年
the year of the Dragon

content:
たつ〔断つ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=切り離す) to cut off; to sever

content.content: 首を断つ
to cut off the head―sever the head from the trunk―behead a man―decapitate a man
四肢を断つ
to cut off the limbs―dismember a body
快刀乱麻を絶つ
to cut the Gordian Knot

content: 2. (=遮断する) to cut off; to shut off; to intercept

content.content: 交通を断つ
to cut off communication―cut off a place from communication―isolate a place―taboo a place―quarantine a ship
コレラのあった家は一週間交通を断たれた
The cholera-infected house was cut off from communication―shut off from communication―isolated―tabooed―for a week.
退路を断つ
to cut off the retreat―intercept the retreat
退路を断たれた
We had the retreat cut off.
糧道を断つ
to cut off the supplies
糧道を断たれた
We were cut off from supplies.
水道を断つ
to cut off the water
電流を断つ
to switch off the electric current
学資を断つ
to stop one's school-expenses

content: 3. (=物断ちする) to abstain from (wine); to eschew (flesh); to abnegate (luxuries); to deny oneself (the comforts of life); to give up (drinking or smoking)

content.content: 酒を断つ
to abstain from wine―give up drinking―swear off drinking
彼は主義として酒を断っている
He abstains from wine on principle.
タバコを断つ
to give up smoking―deny oneself the luxury of tobacco
茶を断つ
to deny oneself tea―abnegate tea
肉を断つ
to abstain from meat―eschew flesh
子どもの乳を断つ
to wean a child (from its mother)
食を断つ
to abstain from food―fast

content:
たつ〔立つ〕
〈自動〉
1. (=佇む)to stand

content.content: 棒立ちに立つ
to stand bolt upright―(馬なら)―rear
熊が後足で立つ
A bear stands on his hind legs.
鐙{あぶみ}を踏んで立つ
to rise in one's stirrups
歩哨に立つ
to stand sentry
団結すれば立ち分離すれば倒る
“United, we stand, divided, we fall.”
立ち上がる
to stand up―rise to one's feet―get on one's legs
びっくりして立つ、飛び立つ
to start to one's feet―spring to one's feet
彼は立っている
He is standing―on his legs.
一日立っておった
I kept standing―kept on my legs―all day.
彼はぼんやり立っている
He stands staring―stands with a vacant stare.
側に立っている者は親でも使え
Order about any one who comes handy.
座を立つ
to rise from one's seat―leave one's seat
彼はそう言い捨てて立って行った
With this, he left me―left the room.
便所へ立つ
to go to the W. C
病人は立って歩けるようになった
He can get about now―He has found his legs―He now feels his legs.
それでは僕の立つ瀬が無いじゃないか
Then where do I come in?

content: 2. (=立ち登る) to rise

content.content: 煙が立つ
Smoke rises (into the air).
家々から煙が立つ
Wreaths of smoke curl up from the cottages.
湯気が立つ
to steam―smoke
湯気の立つ御馳走
a steaming dish―a smoking dish
塵が立つ
to be dusty
道路は塵が立つ
The roads are dusty.
風が吹くと塵が立つ
The wind raises a dust.
雨が降ると塵が立たぬ
The rain lays the dust.
塵が立たないように水を撒く
The streets are sprinkled with water to lay the dust.
灰神楽が立つ
A cloud of ashes rise.
波が立つ
The sea gets up.
波が立っている
The sea is up.
風が吹くと波が立つ
The wind causes the sea to get up―A gale lashes the sea into fury.
泡が立つ
to bubble―(沸騰してなら)―effervesce―(怒濤なら)―foam―(ビールなら)―foam―froth―(葡萄酒なら)―sparkle―(煮物なら)―scum―(石鹸水なら)―lather
鳥が立つ
A bird takes flight―takes wing.
この鳥はじきに立つ
This bird takes wing at the least alarm.
足下から鳥が立つ
One does not know what is passing under one's eyes.
立つ鳥跡を濁さず
A bird taking flight does not foul the water―(に相当するは)―“It is a dirty bird that fouls its own nest.”

content: 3. (=建てられる) to be built; to be erected; to go up; to be established; to be founded

content.content: この辺に家が立つ
Houses are going up in this neighbourhood.
ここは今度の家の立つ所だ
This is the site for the new house.
家は崖縁に立っている
The house stands on the edge of a precipice.
この家は百年も立っている
This house has stood for a century.
大隈侯の銅像が立った
A bronze statue was erected to the memory of Marquis Okuma.
この学校が立ってから三十年になる
It is thirty years since this school was established.
明治政府は幕府が倒れた跡に立った
The Meiji government rose on the ruins of the Shogunate.

content: 4. (=出立する) to depart, leave (for America); to start, set out, set off, set forth, set forward (for the capital, etc.)

content.content: いつおたちですか
When are you leaving?
明日米国に向けてたちます
I depart for―leave for―sail for―America tomorrow.
彼は上海へ向けてたちました
He has left for Shanghai.
急に思いたって即刻たって来た
I suddenly thought of coming, and started on the instant.
後れると悪いから早々たて
You must leave in haste―go packing―pack yourself off―lest you should be late.
近々旅行にたつ
I start on a journey shortly.
その翌日たった
I left next day―Next day I was on the road―The next day saw me on the road.
汽車が今たつというところへ行き着いた
I get to the station as the train was on the point of leaving.
たつ前にいま一度顔を出しておこう
I must call there once more before I leave―prior to my departure.

content: 5. (=成り立つ) (a reason) holds good; (an argument) holds water; (a theory) is established; (a claim) is substantiated; (a statement) is made good

content.content: 議論が立つ
The argument holds water―The argument is tenable―The argument is sound―The case is well made out.
そんな議論は立たぬ
The argument does not hold water―The argument is untenable―The argument is unsound―The argument has no log to stand upon.
議論の筋が立っている
The argument is logical―consequent.
議論の筋が立たぬ
The argument is illogical―inconsequent.
理由が立つ
My reason holds good.
そんな理由は立たぬ
Your reason does not hold good.
僕の欠席は理由が立つ、言い訳が立つ
My absence is justifiable―excusable.
病気だと言えば欠席の理由が立つ、言い訳が立つ
My illness will justify my absence―My illness will serve as an excuse for my absence.
そんなことをしては理由が立たぬ、言い訳が立たぬ
Such conduct is unjustifiable―inexcusable―Such conduct admits of on excuse―permits of no excuse―allows of no excuse.
酩酊の上とはいいながら昨夜のようなことをしては言い訳が立たぬ
Granting that he was drunk, that is no excuse for his behaviour of last night.
その口実は立つ
The plea is sound.
戦争を起こしても名義が立つ
A war can be justified.
これで戦争の名義が立つ
This will justify a war.
そんな説は立たぬ
You can not make good your statement―(学説なら)―You can not establish your theory.
そんな要求は立たぬ
You can not substantiate your claim.
世に立つ
to establish oneself in life
三十にして立つ
I established myself at thirty.
文壇に立つ
to appear before the public as a writer―enter upon a literary career
文壇に立っている人
the writers before the public
文をもって立つ
to live by the pen
武をもって立つ
to live by the sword―carve out one's way with the sword
身が立つ
to be saved from ruin
それでは身が立たぬ
Then I shall be ruined.
お蔭で身が立ちます
You have saved me from ruin.
身の立つようにしてやる
I will save you from ruin.
身の立たないようにしてくれるぞ
I will ruin you.
人の上に立つ
to take a leading position―play first fiddle
人の下に立つ
to take a subordinate position―play second fiddle
二人の間に立つ
to go between―mediate between―two parties
保証人に立つ
to stand surety―go security
議員の候補者に立つ
to put up as a candidate
東京の候補者に立つ
to stand for Tokyo
使者に立つ
to go on a mission
勅使が立つ
An Imperial representative is sent.
腹が立つ
I feel angry―I am vexed.
腹が立って堪らぬ
I can not contain my anger.
腹が立つてムカムカする
My heart swells with anger.
気が立つ
to get excited
世間は気が立っている
People are excited.
見込みが立つ、見込みが立たぬ
The chances are in my favour―The chances are against me.
成功の見込みが立った
Success is in sight.
計画が立った
My plan is formed―My plan is laid.
用に立つ、役に立つ
to answer the purpose―serve one's turn―(形容詞をもって言い表せば)―to be useful―serviceable―helpful―available―good for something.
役に立たない奴だ
He is useless―of no use―good for nothing.
女房悦べ、忰がお役に立ったぞや
Rejoice, wife, our boy has proved of service to his lord.
女ながらもまさかの時には何かお役に立ちましょう
Woman as I am, I may be of some help in time of need.
これで友人に対して義理が立った
I have done my duty by my friend.
それでは義理が立たない
Then I shall fail in my duty by my friend.
それでは拙者の役目が立ちません
Then I shall fail in my duty.
それで役目が立ちます
Then I shall have discharged my duty.
顔が立つ
One's honour is saved.
それで僕の顔が立つ
That will save my honour―save my face.
君の顔の立つようにする
I will save your face―save your honour.
この金を返さないと顔が立たない
It is a point of honour with me to pay this money.
男が立つ
One's honour is satisfied.
そんなことをしては男が立たない
It I do such a thing, I shall dishonour myself―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Such conduct will dishonour me.
それで僕の面目が立つ
I shall keep myself in countenance―You will keep me in countenance.
声が立つ、よく立つ声だ
He has a loud voice―a ringing voice.
筆が立つ
He writes well―He is a good writer―He wields a facile pen.
着想は好いが筆が立たない
His ideas are all right, but his style leaves something to be desired.
噂が立つ、風説が立つ
A rumour gets afloat―A rumour gets abroad―A rumour runs current―A rumour circulates.
噂が立っている
A rumour is afloat―abroad―current―in circulation.
その時彼が欠席したために死んだという噂が立った
His absence on the occasion gave rise to the rumour―gave occasion to the rumour―that he was dead.
浮名が立つ
to give rise to scandal
君さえ黙っていれば浮名も立たない
Your silence will prevent scandal.
生計が立つか
Can you get your living?―make both ends meet?
どうかこうか暮らしが立つ
I manage to live―rub along somehow.
彼は立派に生計が立っている
He makes a good living.
語学研究などに順序が立つ
Language-study can be reduced to order―Language-study is amenable to system.
彼の為すことはちゃんと順序が立っている
Whatever he does, is systematic―methodical―business-like.
市が立つ
A market is held―A fair is held.
この戸が立たない
This door will not shut―There is a hitch in the door.
指に刺が立った
I have run a thorn into my finger.
喉に骨が立った
A bone sticks in my throat.
矢が立つ
An arrow pierces anything―An arrow quivers in anything.
白羽の矢が立つ
The choice falls on some one.
歯が立つ
One can get one's teeth into anything.
堅くて歯も立たない
It is so hard that you can not get your teeth into it.
鳥獣が立つ
Game breaks cover.
鳥が立つ
A bird takes flight―takes wing.
この炭はじきに立つ
This charcoal burns too quickly.
蝋燭が立つ
A candle burns shorter.
蝋燭が立ってしまった
The candle has burnt itself out.
揮発油が立つ
Volatile oil evaporates.
こう言うと角が立つ
That sounds harsh.
物も言いようで角が立つ
Some words sound harsh―“Smooth words make smooth ways,”
目に立つ
to strike the eye―stand out
あの女の支度が目に立つ
Her dress is striking―conspicuous―She is conspicuously dressed.
背が立つか
Do you feel the bottom?
背が立たない
I do not feel the bottom―I am off the bottom.
秋風が立った
The autumn wind begins to blow―(より)―His love has cooled towards her.
たちゆく〔立ち行く〕

content:
たつ〔闥〕
〈名〉A door

content.content: 闥を排す
to open the door

content:
たつい〔達意〕
〈形〉Straight-to-the-point

content.content: 文は達意を旨とす
In writing, you should aim at expressing yourself to the point―Use the right word in the right place.
達意の文
a straight-to-the-point style

だつえい〔脱営〕
〈名〉Desertion from barracks:(=する) to desert from one's regiment

だつえいへい〔脱営兵〕
〈名〉A deserter

だっかい〔脱会〕
〈名〉Withdrawal, secession (from a society):(=する) to withdraw from a society; to secede from an association

だっかいしゃ〔脱会者〕
〈名〉A seceder (from a society)

content:
だっかく〔脱殻〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: だっこく〔脱殻〕

content:
たっかん〔達観〕
〈名〉A far-sighted view; a philosophic view; a great grasp of intellect; elevation of thought; exaltation of spirit:(=する) to take a far-sighted view, take an elevated view, take a philosophic view (of things)

content.content: 彼は人生を達観している
He takes life like a philosopher―He is a philosopher.
将来を達観する
to take a far-sighted view―see into the future
彼は物事を達観する
He take an elevated view of things―He sees things from a height.

だっかん〔脱監〕
〈名〉Prison-breaking; jail-breaking:(=する) to break prison; to break jail; to break out of prison; to break out of jail; to escape from prison; to escape from jail

content:
だっかん〔脱艦〕
〈名〉Desertion from a warship:(=する) to desert from a warship

content.content: 脱艦者
a deserter

だっかんしゃ〔脱監者〕
〈名〉A prison-breaker; a jail-breaker

だっかんへい〔脱艦兵〕
〈名〉A deserter from a warship

content:
だっきゃくする〔奪却する〕
〈他動〉To deprive (a person of anything)

content.content: 敵の陣地を奪却する
to dislodge the enemy from his position

だっきゃくする〔脱却する〕
〈他動〉To escape from (danger); to get out of (trouble); to extricate oneself from (difficulties); to get rid of (a habit); to shake off (a yoke); to shake oneself free from (a yoke); to free oneself from (debts); to rise above(the passions)

content:
だっきゅう〔脱臼〕
〈名〉Dislocation, luxation (of a joint):(=する) to be dislocated; to be luxated; to be put out of joint

content.content: 肩が脱臼した
My shoulder is out of joint.

たっきょ〔謫居〕
〈名〉Domiciliary confinement:(また) banishment into the country

content:
たっけい〔磔刑〕
〈名〉Crucifixion

content.content: 磔刑に処す
to crucify a criminal

content:
たっけん〔卓見〕
〈名〉Far-sightedness; clear-sightedness; long-headedness:(=ある) far-sighted; far-seeing; clear-sighted; long-headed

content.content: 彼は卓見が有る
He is far-sighted―He has a long head.
卓見ある経世家
a far-sighted statesman

content:
だっこ〔抱っこ〕
〈名〉Being in one's arms

content.content: 抱っこおし
Come into my arms!
子どもが抱っこしてと言う
The child wants to come into my arms.
子どもを抱っこしている
The child is in my arms.

content:
だっこう〔脱稿〕
〈名〉The completion of a literary work:(=する) a literary work is completed

content.content: やっと辞書が脱稿しました
At last the dictionary is off my hands.

だっこう〔脱肛〕
〈名〉Prolapsus of the rectum:(=する) the rectum slips down

content:
だっこく〔脱殻〕
〈名〉
1. (=抜け殻)a cast skin; a cast shell; slough (of a snake):(複数集合名詞)exuviae:(=する) to exuviate; to cast its skin; to shed its shell

content.content: 蛇が脱殻する
A snake sloughs―casts its skin―sheds its skin.

content: 2. (=麦打ち、脱穀)threshing:(=する) to thresh (corn)

だつごく〔脱獄〕
〈名〉Prison-breaking; jail-breaking:(=する) to break prison; to break jail; to break out of prison; to break out of jail; to escape from prison; to escape from jail

だつごくしゃ〔脱獄者〕
〈名〉A prison-breaker; a jail-breaker

content:
たっし〔達し〕
〈名〉A notice; a notification

content.content: 明日午前九時に出頭するようにという裁判所からの達しがあった
I have had notice from the court to appear at 9 a. m. tomorrow.

だつじ〔脱字〕
〈名〉
1. (=字を落とすこと)omission of a word
2. (=落とした字)an omitted word or letter; an omission

だっしめん〔脱脂綿〕
〈名〉Absorbent cotton

content:
たっしゃ〔達者〕
〈形〉
1. (=丈夫) well; healthy; in good health; hale and hearty; alive and well; safe and sound; sound in life and limb

content.content: ご家族はお達者ですか
Are your family well?
皆すこぶる達者です
They are all in excellent health―in robust health.
いつもお達者で結構です
I am glad you are always in good health.
老人はまめで達者だ
The old man is hale and hearty.
(まだご存命ですかと問われて)祖父も祖母もまだ達者です
My grandfather and grandmother are alive and well.
(禍災などに逢った後)お陰様で皆達者です
Thank Heaven, we are safe and sound.
母子とも達者です
Mother and child are doing well―doing as well as can be expected.
俺が足腰が達者な間はお前達に不自由はさせぬ
You shall not want for anything while I am sound in life and limb.
達者でいてくれ
You must keep yourself well.
ぞうぞお達者で
Be careful of yourself!

content: 2. (=巧者) proficient (in English); adept, expert (in the art); skilful (in war―with the sword); good (at accounts); facile (pen):(=に) with facility

content.content: 彼は英語が達者だ
He is proficient in English―at home in English.
達者に英語を話す
He speaks English with facility―like one to the manner born.
あの西洋人は達者に日本語を話す
He speaks Japanese with facility―like a Japanese.
あの人は計算が達者だ
He is quick at accounts―death on figures.
音楽が達者だ
He is adept in music―expert in music.
筆が達者だ
He wields a facile pen―He is a facile writer―a ready writer.
達者に書く
He writes with facility.
口が達者だ
He has a facile tongue―a glib tongue―the gift of the gab.
足が達者だ
He is a good walker―a good pedestrian.

content:
だっしゅつ〔脱出〕
〈名〉［医学］Prolapsus

content.content: 直腸脱出
prolapsus of the rectum
子宮脱出
prolapsus of the uterus

content:
たつじん〔達人〕
〈名〉
1. (=その道に達した人) an adept; an expert; a master

content.content: その道の達人
an adept in the art―an expert in the art―a master of the art
荒木又衛門は剣道の達人であった
Araki Mataemon was a great master of swordsmanship―a master swordsman.

content: 2. (=偉大な人物) a great man; a great mind; a master mind

content.content: 達人は大観す
A great mind sees far.

content:
たっする〔達する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=どこへ達する) to reach (a place―長く続いて達すれば―to a place); to get to (a place); to gain (a point); to come up to (the mark)

content.content: 目的地に達する
to reach one's destination―get to one's journey's end
砲撃は百マイルの遠きに達した
The sound of firing reached a distance of 100 miles.
その梯子は天に達した
The ladder reached to Heaven.
この原は海岸に達している
The plain reaches to the sea.
やっと頂上に達した
We gained the summit.
天聞に達する、叡聞に達する
to reach the Emperor's ears―come to the Emperor's knowledge
標準に達する、標準に達せぬ
to come up to the standard―fall short of the standard

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 日本の領土は熱帯に達している
The Japanese possessions extend into the tropics.
東北線は上野を起点として青森に達す
The North-Eastern Line starts at Ueno and terminates at Aomori.
Victoria の治世に英国は繁栄の絶頂に達した
In the reign of Queen Victoria, England was at the summit of her prosperity―at the zenith of her prosperity.
力が望みに達せぬ
My means stop short of my wishes.

content: 2. (=いくらに達する) to amount to, come to, mount up to, run up to, foot up to (so much)

content.content: 税金が一万円に達する
The taxes amount to―come to―10,000 yen.
雑費が千円に達する
The expenses mount up to―run up to―foot up to―1,000 yen.
件数は百に達する
The number of cases run up to a hundred.
収入が五万以上に達する
The income comes to over 50,000 yen―exceeds 50,000 yen.
収益は何百万に達する
The profits run up into millions.

content: 3. (=何歳に達する) to attain (one's fifteenth year)

content.content: 二十歳に達した
He has attained his twentieth year―attained the age of twenty.
丁年に達する
to attain one's majority―come of age
老年に達する
to attain old age
学齢に達する
to attain school age
高齢に達する
to attain an advanced age
象は高齢に達する
The elephant lives to a great age.
彼は九十歳の高齢に達した
He attained the advanced age of ninety.
九十歳の高齢に達して死んだ
He died at the advanced age of ninety.

content: 4. (=学芸に達する) to attain proficiency, attain skill (in at art); to become proficient, become skilled, become expert, become adept (in an art); to perfect oneself (in an art); to master (a language)

content.content: 彼は英語に達している
He is proficient in English―at home in English.
彼は武芸に達していた
He was skilled in the use of arms.
文武両道に達している
He is skilled in the arts of war and peace.
婦人は音楽に達している
She is adept in music―expert in music.
一芸に達する
to master one's business―perfect oneself in an art
語学に達するの道は(?)
What is the best way to master a language?
目的を達する
to attain one's object―(は終局の目的、当座の目的なら)―gain one's end―secure one's ends―carry one's point―get there―(無意志なら)―serve a purpose―serve an end.
志す者はたくさんあるが目的を達する者は少ない
Many resolve, but few attain their objects.
もう目的を達したから用が無い
I want nothing more, for I have gained my end.
大望の目的を達する
to attain the object of one's ambition―reach the goal of one's ambition
二重の目的を達する
to serve two ends―serve a double purpose
遊戯や競技は娯楽と運動の二重の目的を達する
Games and sports serve the double purpose of amusement and exercise.
目的を達する手段
a means to an end
希望を達する
to realize one's wishes

content: 6. (=布達する) to notify

content.content: 達する儀有之候条本裁判所に出頭す可し{たっするぎこれありそうろうじょうほんさいばんしょにしゅっとうすべし}
You are required to appear in court to receive a notification.
上聞に達する
to lay anything before the Emperor―submit a matter to the Emperor

content:
だっする〔脱する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=免る)to escape from (danger); to get out of (trouble); to extricate oneself from (difficulties); to get rid of (a habit); to cast off (restraint); to shake off (a yoke); to shake oneself free from (a yoke); to free oneself from (debts)

content.content: 困難を脱する
to extricate oneself from difficulties―get out of trouble
危険を脱する
to escape from danger―get out of danger
虎口を脱する
to be snatched from the jaws of death
束縛を脱する
to cast off restraint―shake off restraint―free oneself from restraint―shake oneself free from restraint
覇絆を脱する
to shake off a yoke―shake oneself free from a yoke
外国の支配を脱する
to shake off a foreign yoke―shake oneself free from a foreign yoke
悪習を脱する
to get rid of a bad habit―break oneself of a bad habit
旧習を脱する
to break oneself of old habits―shake off old habits
国籍を脱する
to denationalize oneself―expatriate oneself
重囲を脱する
to cut one's away through the besieging enemy
奴隷を脱する
to escape from slavery

content: 2. (=超脱する)to rise above (the world); to rise superior to (passion, etc.)

content.content: 俗を脱する
to rise above the world―die to the world
彼は俗を脱している
He is raised above the world―exalted above the world.
情慾を脱する
to rise above the passions―rise superior to passion
慾を脱する
to rise above avarice―rise superior to avarice
虚栄心を脱する
to rise above vanity―rise superior to vanity
己を脱する
to rise above self―be shaken out of oneself

content: 3. (=落とす)to omit, leave out (a word, etc.)

たつせ〔立つ瀬〕
〈名〉A place where one feels the bottom

content.content: それじゃ僕の立つ瀬が無いじゃないか
Then where do I come in?

だつぜい〔脱税〕
〈名〉The evasion of taxes; tax-dodging:(=する) to evade the taxes; to dodge a tax; to defraud the revenues

だつぜいしゃ〔脱税者〕
〈名〉An evader of taxes; a tax-dodger; a defrauder of the revenues

content:
だっせん〔脱線〕
〈名〉
1. Derailment:(=する) to derail; to be derailed; to run off the track; to run off the rails; to run off the metals

content.content: 汽車が脱線して死傷者を出した
A train was derailed―ran off the track―and gave rise to casualties.

content: 2. (=脇道へ逸れた話)a rambling digression:(=する) to digress from the subject; to wander from the point; to ramble; to fly off at a tangent

content.content: 彼は時々得意の問題の方へ脱線する
He will often fly off at a tangent to his favourite topic.

content: 3. (=常軌を逸した行動)erratic behaviour; an escapade:(=する) to commit an escapade; to fly off the handle

content.content: 彼は時々脱線する
He commits frequent escapades.

content:
だっせん〔脱船〕
〈名〉Desertion from a ship:(=する) to desert from a ship; to run away from a ship

content.content: 脱船者
a deserter from a ship―a ranaway sailor

content:
だっそ〔脱疽〕
〈名〉Gangrene; necrosis; sphacelus; mortification

content.content: 脱疽に陥る
to gangrene―sphacelate―mortify
傷が脱疽に陥った
Mortification has set in.

content:
だっそう〔脱走〕
〈名〉Desertion:(=する) to desert; to run away

content.content: 脱走者
a deserter―a runaway

だっそうへい〔脱走兵〕
〈名〉A deserter

だつぞく〔脱俗〕
〈名〉Unworldliness:(=する) to rise above the world; to die to the world

content:
たった〔只〕
〈副〉Only; but; merely; just

content.content: たった一つ
only one
たった一分のことで汽車の間に合わなかった
I was only one minute too late for the train.
たった一人で来た
I came all by myself.
たった十しか無い
There are only ten―no more than ten.
彼はたった今帰って行った
He left just now.
僕はたった今帰ったばかりだ
I have only just―but just―come home.

だったい〔脱退〕
〈名〉Withdrawal; secession:(=する) to withdraw from, secede from (a party, etc.)

たつたひめ〔龍田姫〕
〈名〉The Goddess of Autumn

content:
だったん〔韃靼〕
〈固名〉Tartary:(=の) Tartar

content.content: タタール人
a Tartar

content:
だっちょう〔脱腸〕
〈名〉Abdominal hernia

content.content: 脱腸帯
a truss

content:
たって〔達って〕
〈副〉Earnestly; particularly:(=の) earnest; urgent; pressing

content.content: たってのお望みならそう致しましょう
If you particularly wish it,―If you will have it so,―If you insist upon it,―I shall do so.
たっての仰せだからお言葉に甘えます
Since you are so pressing, I shall presume on your kindness.
友人のたっての頼みだからこの人を使ってみたのだ
I employed the man at the pressing instance of a friend―at the urgent request of a friend.
彼がたってと言うからそのようにしたのだ
I did so at his urgent request―at his pressing instance.
君が仕事を引き受ける気が無いならたってとは言わない
If you are not inclined to undertake the work, I will not press you to do so―press the point.

content:
だって
〈接続詞〉But; yet

content.content: だってきまりが悪いんだもの
But it is so embarrassing.

content: 〈後置詞〉

content.content: なんだって
What did you say?―What does he say?
なんだってそんなことをするのだ
Why do you do such a thing?
なんだってかまわん
I don't care what it is.
そうだって
So they say―So it would seem.
君だってそうだ
So are you.
日曜だって休みやしない
We have no holiday even on Sunday.

content:
だっと〔脱兎〕
〈名〉A running hare

content.content: 始めは処女の如く終りは脱兎の如し
to be deliberate in counsel, prompt in action

content:
たっとい〔貴い〕
〈形〉
1. (=高貴な) noble (birth); high, exalted, august (personage); illustrious (house, etc.)

content.content: 彼は貴い家柄だ
He comes of a noble family―He is of noble birth.
古今の将相を出した貴い家柄だ
It is an illustrious family which has led armies and made laws time out of mind.
もったいなくもこの御方は尊き御方に渡らせられるぞ
You behold in him an august personage.

content: 2. (=貴重な) precious (stone); valuable (property); invaluable (article); priceless (treasure, etc.)

content.content: (忙しい時は)時が貴い
Time is precious.
時は金よりも貴い
Time is more valuable than money.
名は命よりも貴い
Honour is above life.
健康は財宝よりも貴い
Health is above wealth.
女の操は貴い宝である
Female honour is a priceless treasure.
山高きが故に貴からず木あるをもって貴しとす
A mountain is valuable, not because it is high, but because it is wooded.

content: 3. (=貴ぶべき) honourable (man); estimable (scholar); venerable (old age)

だっとう〔脱党〕
〈名〉Secession from a party; apostacy:(=する) to secede from a party; to apostacize

content.content: (政党などの)脱党団
a cave

だっとうしゃ〔脱党者〕
〈名〉A seceder; an apostate; a renegade; a turncoat; a rat

content:
たっとぶ〔貴ぶ、尊ぶ、尚ぶ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=尊敬する) to respect (every man); to have a respect for (every man); to regard (one) with respect; to honour (one's parents); to revere, reverence (one's superiors); to venerate (old age); to esteem (a scholar); to hold (a scholar) in esteem

content.content: 自ら尊んで後人に尊ばる
“Respect yourself, or no one will respect you.”
予言者は古里に尊ばれず
“A prophet is not honoured in his own country.”
道徳家は人に貴ばれる
Virtue commands respect.
人に貴ばれるようにせよ
You must make yourself respected.
彼は尊ぶべき人だ
He is an estimable man―an honourable man.
貴ぶべき老人だ
He is a venerable old man.

content: 2. (=尊重する) to value (honour); to set a value on (honour); to esteem (learning); to hold (learning) in esteem; to prize (liberty); to have a regard for (the laws); to make much of, think much of (anything)

content.content: 日本人は命よりも名を貴ぶ
We value honour above life.
西洋人は生命よりも自由を貴ぶ
The Westerners prize liberty above life.
我が国では学問を貴ぶ
Learning is held in high esteem in our country.
武を尚ぶ
to love war
兵は神速を尚ぶ
“Celerity is the soul of warfare.”
謀は密なるを尚ぶ
“Secrecy is the soul of strategy.”
言は簡単を尚ぶ
“Brevity is the soul of wit.”

content:
たっとぶ〔貴ぶ、尊ぶ、尚ぶ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=尊敬する) to respect (every man); to have a respect for (every man); to regard (one) with respect; to honour (one's parents); to revere, reverence (one's superiors); to venerate (old age); to esteem (a scholar); to hold (a scholar) in esteem

1. (=尊敬する) to respect (every man); to have a respect for (every man); to regard (one) with respect; to honour (one's parents); to revere, reverence (one's superiors); to venerate (old age); to esteem (a scholar); to hold (a scholar) in esteem

content.content: 日本人は命よりも名を貴ぶ
We value honour above life.

The Westerners prize liberty above life.

Learning is held in high esteem in our country.

to love war

謀は密なるを尚ぶ
“Secrecy is the soul of strategy.”

content:
たづな〔手綱〕
〈名〉A bridle; reins:(馬車馬の手綱は) ribbons

content.content: 馬の手綱をとる
to hold a horse by the bridle
馬の手綱を引く
to lead a horse by the bridle
手綱を引いて馬を停める
to rein up a horse―draw rein
手綱を控える
to rein in a horse―draw rein
手綱をゆるめる(馬の行くに任せる)
to give a horse the reins―throw the reins to a horse
この馬は手綱が利く
The horse has a good mouth.
手綱が利かぬ
He has a bad mouth―a hard mouth.

たつのくち〔龍の口〕
〈名〉The spout of a gutter (often in the shape of a dragon's mouth)

content:
たっぴつ〔達筆〕
〈名〉A ready pen; a facile pen

content.content: 彼は達筆だ
He is a ready writer―a facile writer.
手紙が達筆に書いてある
The letter is written with a facile hand.

content:
たっぷり
〈形〉Ample

content.content: 彼は金がたっぷり有る
He has ample means.

content: 〈副〉Amply

content.content: この金でたっぷり間に合う
The sum is amply sufficient for the purpose.
たっぷり一時間はかかった
It took a full hour―a good hour.
ここからたっぷり十マイルはある
It it good ten miles from here―full ten miles from here.
この問題は興味たっぷりだ
The subject is full of interest―very interesting.
あの女は愛嬌たっぷりだ
She is overflowing with smiles―profuse of her smiles.
厭味たっぷりな男だ
He is a very disagreeable fellow.
あの人はお世辞たっぷりだ
He has unctuous manners―oily manners.
あの娘は色気たっぷりだ
She is very amorous―amorousness itself.
彼はこの仕事に色気たっぷりだ
He is inclined to undertake the work―disposed to undertake the work.

だっぷん〔脱糞〕
〈名〉Evacuation (of the bowels); defecation (of excrement):(=する) to evacuate the bowels; to defecate excrement

content:
たつべん〔達弁〕
〈名〉Eloquence; the gift of the gab:(=の) eloquent; voluble; glib

content.content: 達弁を振るう
to put forth one's eloquence
達弁の人だ
He has the gift of the gab―He is a voluble man―He is a glib talker.

content:
だつぼうする〔脱帽する〕
〈自動〉To take off one's hat; to raise one's hat; to lift one's hat; to uncover (oneself)

content.content: 脱帽(号令)
Off with your caps!

たつみあがり〔巽上り〕
〈名〉Growing in violence of speech or behaviour

だつもう〔脱毛〕
〈名〉Falling out of hair:(=する) hair falls out

content:
だつらくする〔脱落する〕
〈自動〉To fall off; to fall out

content.content: 脱落性の(葉、歯、角など)
deciduous (leaves, teeth, horns, etc.)
頭髪脱落病
alopecia

content:
だつりゃく〔奪掠〕
〈名〉Plunder; pillage; rapine; spoliation; sack; depredation:(=する) to plunder, pillage, despoil, sack, loot (a city or its inhabitants); to loot (the treasure)

content.content: 敵は都に入って金銀を奪掠した
The enemy entered the capital, and plundered it of its treasures―looted its treasures.
奪掠物
plunder―spoil―loot―booty

content:
だつろう〔脱漏〕
〈名〉Omission:(=する) to omit, be omitted; to leave out, be left out

content.content: 誤謬脱漏此限に非ず{ごびゅうだつろうこのかぎりにあらず}
Errors and omissions excepted (E. & O. E.―と略す)

content:
たて〔縦〕
〈名〉
1. Length; lengthwiseness:(=の) lengthwise; longitudinal; vertical; perpendicular:(=に) lengthwise; lengthways; longitudinally; vertically; perpendicularly; from end to end

content.content: (紙などを)縦に切る
to cut paper lengthways―cut paper from end to end
日本紙は縦に裂ける
Japanese paper splits only one way.
茸などを縦に裂く
to split a mushroom from end to end
木などを縦に割る
to split wood
縦に線を引く
to draw a perpendicular line
かぶりを縦に振る
to nod assent
「いや」とかぶりを縦に振る
She says “No” and nods assent.
縦縞
stripes―striped clothes
縦三尺に横二尺
three feet long and two feet wide―three feet by two
彼は横の物を縦にもしない
He is too lazy to budge.
縦から見ても横から見ても武士だ
He is every inch a samurai.

content: 2. (=経糸) warp

たて〔楯〕
〈名〉
1. A shield; a buckler

content.content: 君は楯の半面を見ている
You look only on one side of the shield―consider only one side of the question.
楯の両面を見よ
Look on both sides of the shield!―Consider both sides of the question!
(口実などを)楯にとる
to entrench oneself behind―shelter oneself behind―hide behind―some excuse
先方は国際公法を楯にとって論じた
The other party entrenched himself behind the International Law.
彼は憲法を楯にとって頑強に議論を主張した
He sheltered himself behind the constitution, and obstinately maintained his position.
彼は専門の知識を楯にとって素人論を攻撃する
He hides behind his professional knowledge, and attacks the lay argument.
(何を)楯にとって
on the ground of―on the plea of―on the strength of―in reliance on―something
彼は老年を楯にとってご免を蒙ると言っている
He excuses himself from the task on the ground of old age.
病気を楯にとって面会を謝絶した
He declined to see me on the plea of illness.
法律を楯にとってしきりに議論を主張した
He maintained his position on the strength of the law.
敵は地の利を楯にとってよく我が攻撃を防いだ
The enemy defended themselves against our attacks in reliance on his advantageous position.
楯を突く
to oppose―defy―a superior
目上に楯をついても駄目だ
It is no use trying to oppose―set yourself against―your superiors.
お前は主人に楯をつく気か
Do you mean to defy your master?
彼は行きたくて矢も楯も堪らないのだ
He is seized with a sudden impulse to go―He feels an irresistible impulse to go―He is impatient to be gone.
やってみたくて矢も楯も堪らなかったのだ
He was seized with an irresistible impulse to try―He was mad to try―He was wild to try.

content:
たて〔立て〕
〈接尾詞〉(=何々し立て)Just from (abroad); fresh from (school); green from (the mountains); hot from (the oven); wet from, damp from (the press)

content.content: 日本へ来たての西洋人だ
He is a foreigner just from abroad.
帰朝したての人に逢った
I have met a man just returned from abroad.
学校を出たての先生だ
He is a teacher fresh from school.
先生は大学卒業したてだ
He is fresh from college.
田舎から出たての女中だ
She is a servant fresh from the country.
芋は蒸したてのほやほや
The potatoes are hot from the oven―smoking from the oven.
刷りたての新聞
a newspaper wet from the press―damp from the press
買いたての帽子
a hat fresh from the shop―a bran-new hat
風呂に入りたてだ
I am just from the bath―I have just come out of the bath.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 生みたての卵
new-laid eggs
できたての軍艦
a bran-new warship―a brand-new warship
塗りたての戸
a fresh-painted door
結いたての頭
hair just done up
飯を食いたてに散歩するのは悪い
It will do you harm to take a work just after a meal.

content:
たで〔蓼〕
〈名〉The knot-grass; the knot-weed

content.content: 蓼食う虫も好き好き
Tastes will differ―“There is no accounting for tastes.”

content:
だて〔伊達〕
〈形〉Dandyish, dashing, large and conspicuous (design, pattern, etc.)

content.content: だてな柄
large and conspicuous pattern (on cloth)

content: 〈副〉(=に) for show; (not) for nothing

content.content: だてに眼鏡をかける
to wear glasses for show
この目はだてに光らしているのではない
I do not oversee you for nothing.
僕はだてに英語を学んだのじゃない
I have not studied English for nothing.

たてあな〔竪穴〕
〈名〉(=鉱山の竪穴)A shaft

たてあみ〔立て網〕
〈名〉A standing net; a set net

たていし〔立て石〕
〈名〉
1. (=庭の立て石) a standing stone (in a garden)
2. (=道程標) a milestone

content:
たていた〔立て板〕
〈名〉A standing board

content.content: 立て板に水を流すような弁舌だ
He is gifted with a flowing eloquence.

content:
たていと〔経〕
〈名〉Warp

content.content: 縦糸と横糸
warp and woof

content:
たてえり〔立襟〕
〈名〉A stand-up collar

content.content: 立襟の洋服を着ている
He is buttoned up to his chin.

たておやま〔立女形〕
〈名〉The leading actor for a female part

content:
たてかえ〔建替え〕
〈名〉Rebuilding; reconstruction:(=る) to rebuild; to reconstruct

content.content: 家を建て替えなければならぬ
I must have my house rebuilt.

content:
たてかえ〔立替え〕
〈名〉A loan; an advance:(=る) to lend (one money); to advance (one money); to accommodate (one with a loan); to place (money) at one's disposal; to pay for (one)

content.content: 金はご入用だけお立て替えする
I will place at your disposal any sum you may need.
百円ばかりお立て替えを願います
You will please advance me 100 yen.
不足の分は立て替えておいてくれ給え
Please pay the deficit on my account.
木戸銭を立て替えて貰った
He paid the door-money for me.

content:
たてかける〔立て掛ける〕
〈他動〉To stand, lean rest, place, set, prop up (one thing against another)

content.content: 傘を壁に立て掛けた
I stood my umbrella against the wall.

content:
たてかた〔建て方〕
〈名〉Construction; structure; build

content.content: 家は建て方が悪い
The house is defective in construction.

content:
たてがみ〔鬣〕
〈名〉A mane

content.content: 馬のたてがみ
a horse's mane
獅子はたてがみがある
A lion has a mane―A lion is maned.

たてぎょうじ〔立行司〕
〈名〉The head umpire; the chief umpire

たてきる〔立て切る〕
〈他動〉To shut up, close up (a room)

content:
たてぐ〔建具〕
〈名〉Doors and windows; fittings

content.content: 建具造作付き貸家
a house to let with fittings and fixtures complete―a furnished house to let

content:
たてこむ〔建て込む〕
〈自動〉To be crowded with houses

content.content: この辺は家が建て込んでいる
The neighbourhood is crowded with houses.

content:
たてこむ〔立て込む〕
〈自動〉
1. (=人が立て込む) to be crowded with people

content.content: どの店も買い手が立て込んでいる
Every shop is crowded with buyers.

content: 2. (=仕事が立て込む) to be pressed with business; to have one's hands full

content.content: 急ぎの仕事が立て込んでいる
We are pressed with urgent work.
年末はいつも仕事が立て込みます
We always have our hands full at the end of the year.

content:
たてこもる〔立て籠る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=籠城する) to hold (a castle); to betake oneself to (a fastness); to entrench oneself (in a castle)

content.content: 城に立てこもる
to hold a castle―betake oneself to a fastness
脱藩者は筑波山に立てこもった
The deserters entrenched themselves on Mt. Tsukuba.

content:
2. (=垂れ籠める) to confine oneself to one's room; to keep one's room
3. (=籠居する) to live in seclusion

たてさくしゃ〔立作者〕

一両日たてばでき上がります

〈他動〉

立て札を立てる

杭を立てる

旗を立てる
to raise the standard―unfurl the standard―fling out the banner
塵を立てる

灰神楽を立てる

橈を立てる

耳を立てて聴く
to prick up one's ears and listen
馬を立てる
to draw rein
市を立てる
to hold a market―hold a fair
蒸気を立てる
to get up steam
戸を立てる

to make a noise

If you raise your voice, you are a dead man.
煙を立てる
to emit smoke―give out smoke―send forth smoke―smoke
湯気を立てる
to emit steam―give out steam―steam―smoke
彼は頭から湯気を立てて怒っている
He is fuming (with anger)―in a fume.
規則を立てる
to lay down a rule―reduce anything to rule
法を立てる
to lay down a law―establish a law
順序を立てる、秩序を立てる

to reduce language-study to order―reduce language-study to system
順序を立てて
in order―on system
順序を立てて本を読む

策を立てる、案を立てる

to advance a new theory―frame a new theory―propound a new theory―set forth a new theory―put forward a new theory
筋を立てる

目的を立てる
to set an object before one―propose an object to oneself
志を立てる
to form a purpose―form a resolution
方針を立てる
to shape one's course―lay down one's course
大願を立てる
to cherish a great desire―pray for a great gift
誓いを立てる
to make a vow―take one's oath

忠義を立てる

女が男に情を立てた

女が男に操を立てた

後家を立てた

あちら立てればこちらが立たぬ、両方立てれば身が立たぬ
If I am true to one, I must be false to the other; if I am true to both, I must be false to myself.
主義を立てる
to adhere to one's principles―stick to one's colours
主義と利益と相反する時はいずれを立てるべきものか
When your principles run counter to your interests, which should you adhere to?

男を立てる

to get angry―get into a rage―fly into a passion―lose one's temper―get out of temper―take offence

寡婦は針仕事をして細い煙を立てている

人を立てる

to clear oneself―prove one's innocence―establish one's innocence―vindicate one's character

たでる

だでんする〔打電する〕

content:
たとい〔仮令〕
〈接続詞〉Though; even though; even if; if; no matter (who, what, when, where, how); granting (that)

content.content: たといそうでも僕は承知せぬ
Though it may be so, I will not agree to it―It may be so, but I will not agree to it.
たとい学者でも教師に向かない人がある
Though a man may be a scholar, yet he may not do for a teacher―A man may be a good scholar, and. yet he may not make a good teacher.
たとい殺されても離れぬ
Though you may kill me, (yet) I will hold to you.
たとい槍が降っても行く
Even if it should rain pitchforks, I would go.
たとい死んでも止めぬ
I am determined to accomplish my purpose even though I die for it―even though it cost me my life.
たとい誰がそう言おうとも間違っている
No matter who may say so,―Whoever may say so,―Say so who will,―he is wrong.
たとい何事があろうとも覚悟をきめている
No matter what may happen,―whatever may happen,―Come what may,―I am prepared for it.
人はたといどれ程金持ちであろうとも徒食するものでない
No matter how rich a man may be,―However rich a man may be.―Be a man as rich as he will,―Be a man ever so rich,―he ought not to eat the bread of idleness.
たとい酩酊の上とはいいながらあんなことをしては言い訳が立たぬ
Granting that he was drunk, that is no excuse for his behaviour.
たとい大臣であろうと何であろうとその分にはしておかぬ
Minister or no minester, he shall smart for it.
そんな人はたといあるとしてもたんとは無い
There are few, if any, such men.
見込みはたとい有るにしてもたんとは無い
There is little, if any, hope.
彼は本を開くことがたといあってもめったに無い
He seldom, if ever, opens a book.
彼は芝居などへ行くことがたといあるとしても稀だ
He rarely, if ever, goes to the play.
病人は昨日よりたとい好いとしてもあまり好くはない
The invalid is little, if at all, better than he was yesterday.
フランスは日本よりたとい大きいとしても大して大きくはない
France is not much, if at all, larger than Japan.

content: 〈副〉Even

content.content: たとい冗談にも死ぬなどと言うものではない
You should not talk of dying even in joke.
たとい乞食でも見殺しにはできない
You can not leave even a beggar to his fate.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: たとい火の中水の底
I will go through fire and water for your sake.

たとうかい〔多島海〕
〈名〉The Archipelago

たとうがみ〔畳紙〕
〈名〉Folded paper (for keeping things in)

たどうし〔他動詞〕
〈名〉A transitive verb

content:
たどうてき〔他動的〕
〈形〉Passive

content.content: 彼は他動的の人だ
He is passive in his attitude.

content:
たとえ〔例え〕
〈名〉(人や物の例え) an example:(事柄の例え) an instance:(実例、例証の例え) an illustration

content.content: 例えを引く
to give an example―cite an instance
彼は例えを引いて説明する
He cites instances to illustrate his theory―He illustrates his theory by examples.
彼の名は教訓の例えになる
His name serves to point a moral.

content:
たとえ〔喩〕
〈名〉A figure of speech:(明喩なら) a simile; a similitude:(暗喩なら) a metaphor

content.content: 聖書は喩が多いから文字通りに解釈しては誤ることがある
The Bible is loaded with metaphors, and must not always be interpreted literally.
この句も文字通りに解さずに喩として解すべきである
This sentence is to be taken, not literally, but metaphorically.

content:
たとえ〔譬〕
〈名〉
1. (=譬話) an allegory; a parable; a fable

content.content: キリストは譬をもって教えた
Christ spoke in parables.

content: 2. (=諺) a proverb; a common saying

content.content: 譬にもいう通り
The proverb says―as the saying goes―to use a common saying―proverbially.
「人生は風前の灯火の如し」という譬がある
“Life is a candle flickering in the wind,” says the proverb―goes the saying.
紺屋の明後日という譬がある
The dyer is proverbially behindhand with his work.
譬にもある通り岡目八目ということがある
Bystanders proverbially see most of the game.
彼が無学なことは譬になっている
He is a proverb for ignorance―He is proverbially ignorant―He is ignorant to a proverb.

content:
たとえば〔例えば〕
〈副〉(人や物なら) for example:(事柄なら) for instance:(例えば何々の如きと例を挙げるには) such as:(例えば以下の如しは) as:(ある場合には) say

content.content: 例えば本校の如きはその一例である
For example, the present school is a case in point.
例えば嫌疑を受けた場合にはどうすればよいものか
For instance, if one falls under suspicion, what should one do?
例えば人が子も無く縁者も無くて死んだならその財産はどうなるか
If, for instance, a man dies without issue or kin, what becomes of his property?
聖人、例えばキリスト、釈迦、孔子の如き聖賢の世に出ることは稀である
Sages, such as Christ, Sakya, and Confucius, rarely visit this world.
例えば鷹や鷲の如き猛禽は卵を多く生まぬ
Birds of prey, such as the hawk and the eagle, do not lay many eggs.
「ける」の他動詞は受身になると「かる」となる。例えば、「預ける、預かる」「授ける、授かる」
Transitive verbs ending in “-keru” change it into “-karu” when used in a passive sense: as―“azukeru, azukaru,” “sazukeru, sazukaru”.
もし君は大金、例えば一万円も貰ったらどうするか
If you were to get a large sum of money―say 10,000 yen―what would you do with it?

content:
たとえばなし〔譬話〕
〈名〉An allegory; a parable; a fable

content.content: 世界一の譬え話は Bunyan 天路歴程である
Bunyan's “Pilgrim's Progress” is the finest allegory in the world.
キリストは譬え話で教えた
Christ spoke in parables.
Aesop の譬え話は東洋にその類を見ない
Aesop's fables have no equal in the East.

content:
たとえる〔例える、喩える、譬える〕
〈他動〉To liken, compare (one thing to another); to illustrate (a doctrine); to allegorize (life, etc.)

content.content: 人生は航海に譬える
Life is likened to a voyage―compared to a voyage.
宮殿は譬えて見ると牢屋のようなものだ
A palace my be likened to a prison.
美人は花に譬えれば物を言う花だ
A beautiful woman, if compared to a flower, is a speaking flower.
Bunyan の天路歴程はキリスト教信者の生涯を譬えたものだ
Bunyan's “Pilgrim's Progress” allegorizes a Christian life.
商業は戦争をもってこれを譬えん
Let us illustrate commerce by war!
彼は例を引いてその説を例えた
He illustrated his doctrine by citing instances.
喩えて言えば
metaphorically speaking―figuratively speaking―so to speak
喩えて言えば英語は世界の通貨だ
Figuratively speaking, English is a world currency.
彼は喩えて言えば成人した赤ん坊だ
He is, so to speak, a grown-up baby.
その美しさは何に譬えん方も無し
Nothing is comparable to its beauty―It is beautiful beyond comparison―beyond compare.
その景色の好いといったら何に譬えようも無い
The scenery is so beautiful that there is nothing comparable to it―The scenery is beautiful beyond comparison.

content:
たとえる〔例える、喩える、譬える〕
〈他動〉To liken, compare (one thing to another); to illustrate (a doctrine); to allegorize (life, etc.)

content.content: 人生は航海に譬える
Life is likened to a voyage―compared to a voyage.
宮殿は譬えて見ると牢屋のようなものだ
A palace my be likened to a prison.
美人は花に譬えれば物を言う花だ
A beautiful woman, if compared to a flower, is a speaking flower.
Bunyan の天路歴程はキリスト教信者の生涯を譬えたものだ
Bunyan's “Pilgrim's Progress” allegorizes a Christian life.
商業は戦争をもってこれを譬えん
Let us illustrate commerce by war!
彼は例を引いてその説を例えた
He illustrated his doctrine by citing instances.
喩えて言えば
metaphorically speaking―figuratively speaking―so to speak
喩えて言えば英語は世界の通貨だ

彼は喩えて言えば成人した赤ん坊だ
He is, so to speak, a grown-up baby.
その美しさは何に譬えん方も無し
Nothing is comparable to its beauty―It is beautiful beyond comparison―beyond compare.
その景色の好いといったら何に譬えようも無い
The scenery is so beautiful that there is nothing comparable to it―The scenery is beautiful beyond comparison.

content:
たどく〔多読〕
〈名〉Wide reading; extensive reading:(=する) to read extensively; to read widely; to read much

content.content: 先生は多読を勧める
Our teacher exhorts us to read much.
先生は多読家だ
He is a well-read man.

content:
たとする〔多とする〕
〈他動〉To appreciate (one's kindness); to recognize (one's services); to be thankful for (anything); to be grateful for (anything)

content.content: その光栄を多とす
I appreciate the honour.
功労を多とする
to recognize one's services
彼はその功労を多として年金を賜った
He was granted an annuity in recognition of his services.
彼の助力を多とすべきである
We ought to be grateful for―thankful for―his assistance.
彼の如き人のあるのは国家の為に多とすべきである
Such a man is an honour to his country.

content:
タドタド
〈副〉Totteringly; with unsteady steps

content.content: タドタド歩く
to totter along

content:
たどる〔辿る〕
〈他動〉To follow (a path); to follow up (a clue); to trace (a path); to retrace (one's memory)

content.content: 路をたどる
to follow a path―trace a path
田圃路をたどって河へ出た
I followed a path across the rice-fields to the river.
山路をたどる
to trace a mountain-path
家路をたどる
to bend one's steps homeward―turn one's steps homeward
闇路をたどる
to grope one's way in the dark―feel one's way in the dark
遠方に灯火が見えたからそれをたどって行った
I made my way to―made for―a light in the distance―I was a light in the distance, which guided me.
ようやく麓の村にたどり着いた
I made my way down to―got down to―a village at the foot of the mountain.
手掛りをたどって探索する
to follow up a clue
記憶をたどって過ぎ去ったことを思い出す
to retrace one's memory to some past event
字書をたどる
to consult a dictionary―refer to a dictionary―look up words in the dictionary

たどん〔炭団〕
〈名〉A charcoal ball

content:
たな〔棚〕
〈名〉A shelf:(壁から出張った棚) a ledge:(藤や葡萄の棚) a trellis

content.content: 棚を吊る
to make a shelf―fix a shelf to the wall
棚へ上げる
to put anything on the shelf―shelve anything
自分のことは棚へ上げて
“One can not see the beam in one's own eye”―“The pot calls the kettle black.”
自分のことは棚へ上げて人をとがめるな
“One who lives in a glass house must not throw stones.”
運は天にあり牡丹餅は棚にあり
Trust in Providence.
棚から牡丹餅
It is a godsend―a windfall.
棚から牡丹餅は落ちて来ぬ(に相当するは)
“Larks do not fall ready-roasted into your mouth.”
網棚
a basket rack
炉棚
a mantel―a mantelpiece―a mantelshelf
藤棚
a wistaria-trellis―a wistaria-pergola
葡萄棚
a vine-trellis

content:
たな〔店〕
〈名〉
1. (=みせ) a shop; a store

content.content: お店
one's employer's shop
お店者
a tradesman
店を出す
to open a shop
彼は店を出している
He keeps shop―keeps store.
店をしまう
to shut up shop→『たなざらし〔店晒し〕』→『たなぶるし〔店古し〕』

content: 2. (=貸家) a house to let

content.content: 店子
a tenant

content.content: 店請人
a surety fox a tenant

1. (=現在品調査) stock-taking:(=する) to take stock

Closed for stock-taking.

店卸し表を作る
to make an inventory of stock

content: 2. (=穴捜し) fault-finding; disparagement; criticism:(=する) to find faults in (anything); to pick holes in (one's character); to disparage (one's parts); to criticize (anything); to decry, cry down, run down (anything); to tear, pick, pull (anything) to pieces

content.content: 顔の店卸しをする
to criticize one's face
婦人達が茶を飲んで知人の店卸しをしておった
The ladies were at tea, pulling their neighbours to pieces.

〈名〉Tenancy:(=する) to rent a house

たなご

content:
たなごころ〔掌〕
〈名〉The palm of the hand; the hollow of the hand

content.content: 掌を反すが如し
It is as easy as turning a hand.
掌を反すが如く、掌を反す間も無く
before one can say Jack Robinson―in the twinkling of an eye
掌を指すが如く明らかなり
It is as plain as the nose in your face.

content.content: 店晒しになる
to become shop-worn―become shop-soiled
ちと店晒しになったからお安く願っておきます
You shall have it cheap, as it is rather shop-worn.
あの娘は店晒しになった
She is fly-blown.

content.content: 店立てを食う
to have notice to quit―be evicted
店立てを食わせる
to give one notice to quit―evict one

たなばた〔七夕〕
〈固名〉The Festival of the Weaver (the seventh day of the seventh month of the lunar calendar)

content:
たなびく〔棚引く〕
〈自動〉To trail

content.content: 汽船の煙がたなびく
The smoke trails from a steamer.
たなびく煙
trailing smoke
たなびく雲
a bank of clouds
霞たなびく
A haze hangs over the scene.

たなぶるし〔店古し〕
〈形〉Shop-worn, shop-soiled (goods); fly-blown (article, etc.)

content:
たに〔谷〕
〈名〉(広い谷)a valley:(詩にては) a vale:(狭い深い谷) a ravine; a gorge:(人の住む狭い谷) a glen:(木の生えた狭い谷) a dell:(小山と小山の間の谷) a dale:(波と波の間の谷) a trough (of the sea)

content.content: 山と谷
mountain and valley―hill and dale
千仭の谷
a bottomless ravine

content:
だに
〈副〉
1. (=だけでも)only; but

content.content: 日本の土だに踏まするのはもったいない
It is not for them to set foot on Japan's soil.
心だにまことの
If but thy heart be e'er sincere,
道にかないなば
And follow truth's way,
祈らずとても
The gods shall watch o'er thy career,
神や守らん
E'en though thou never pray.

content: 2. (=さえも)even

content.content: 夢だに見ず
I never even dreamed about it.
露をだに厭う
E'en dew of morning she doth dread,
大和のおみなえし
Yamato's tender maid;
ふるアメリカに
That foreign rain her sleeve hath wet,
袖はぬさらじ
Shall of her ne'er be said.

たにあい〔谷間〕
〈名〉A ravine; a gorge; a defile; a chasm

content:
たにがわ〔谷川〕
〈名〉A mountain-stream; a rill

content.content: 落ちれば同じ谷川の水
They all came to the same thing.

content:
たにく〔多肉〕
〈形〉Fleshy

content.content: 多肉果
a fleshy fruit―a pulpy fruit―a succulent fruit―a drupe

content:
たにそこ〔谷底〕
〈名〉The bottom of a ravine

content.content: 千仭の谷底へ陥った
He fell into a bottomless ravine.

content:
たにま〔谷間〕
〈名〉A ravine; a gorge; a defile; a chasm

content.content: 谷間の姫百合
the lily of the valley

content:
だによって
〈副〉Therefore; that is the reason why...

content.content: だによってご注意申したのだ
That is why I warned you.

content:
たにん〔他人〕
〈名〉A stranger

content.content: 赤の他人だ
He is an utter stranger to me―a perfect stranger to me―a complete stranger to me.
他人より身内
“Blood is thicker than water.”
遠い親類より近い他人
“A good neighbour is better than a brother afar off”―He is “a good Samaritan”.
兄弟は他人の始まり
Brothers are incipient strangers―The world begins with brothers.
金銭は親子兄弟も他人
“Business is business.”
他人の空似
an accidental resemblance
他人の飯を食う
to depend on strangers
少しは他人の飯を食ってみるがよい
You ought to know what it is to depend on strangers.
彼は他人の飯を食ったことが無い
He has never been in service.
家は他人の手に渡った
The house passed into other hands.
彼は僕を他人扱いにする
He treats me like a stranger―makes a stranger of me.
他人行儀はお止し
Do not stand on ceremony with me!
彼は他人がましい振る舞いをする
He behaves like a stranger―He has a distant manner.

content:
たにんず〔多人数〕
〈名〉A large number of persons

content.content: 彼の家族は多人数だ
(主人なら)He has a large family―(主人でなくば)―He belongs to a large family.
多人数を使っている
He keeps a large establishment.

content:
たにんずう〔多人数〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: たにんず〔多人数〕

content:
たぬき〔狸〕
〈名〉A kind of raccoon; a badger(は誤訳)

content.content: 取らぬ狸の皮算用
to “count the chickens before they are hatched”―“sell the calf in the cow's belly”
狸寝
sham-sleep―fox-sleep
狸寝をする
to sham sleep―pretend to be asleep
狸をやっているのだ
He pretends to be asleep.
あれは古狸だ
He is an old fox―an old 'un.

content:
たね〔胤〕
〈名〉Paternal blood

content.content: 胤を宿す
to go with child
彼女はその男の胤を宿している
She is with child by him―She is going to be the mother of his child.
情けの胤を宿している、因果の胤を宿している
She is with child by her lover.
情けの胤、因果の胤
a love-child
腹は同じだが胤が違う
They are by the same mother, but by different fathers.→『たねちがい〔胤違い〕』

content:
たね〔種〕
〈名〉
1. (=種子) a seed, seeds:(梅や桃の種) a stone:(蜜柑や梨などの種) a pip:(集合的に言えば) seed

content.content: 種を取る
to gather the seeds
この瓜は種を取るのだ
This melon is kept for the seeds.
種がこぼれる
Plants drop their seeds.
種を蒔く
to sow the seed
地に種を蒔く
to sow seed in the soil―(第二構文は)―sow the soil with seed
畑に種を蒔く
to sow the fields (with seed)
種が悪いか畑が悪いか子ができない
Whether anything is wrong with the seed or the field, no child is born.
蒔かぬ種は生えぬ
“We must sow before we can reap.”
争いの種を蒔く
to sow the seeds of strife
不和の種を蒔く
to sow the seeds of discord
苦労の種を蒔く
to sow the seeds of future trouble
港口には種を蒔いたように水雷が敷設してある
The harbour-entrance is sown with mines.
種蒔き時
seed-time
種屋
a seedsman
桃の種め
a peach-stone
蜜柑の種
an orange-pip
柿の種
a persimmon-pip

content: 2. (=種類) a kind; a species

content.content: 種が違う
They are different in kind―of different kinds.
種を殖やす
to propagate one's species
王公将相何ぞ種あらんや
“One man is as good as another.”
世に盗人の種は尽きまじ
The world will never be free from robbers.

content: 3. (=牛馬の種類) a breed; a stock; a strain

content.content: この馬は英国種だ
This horse is of an English breed.
日本の牡牛は皆外国種だ
Japanese cows are all of foreign breeds.
種を取る
to breed
牛の種を取る
to breed cattle
良い種を取る
to breed from a good stock
この牡牛は種を取るのだ
This bull is kept for breeding.
この牡牛は種が好い
The cow is bred from a good stock.
種牛
a bull
種馬
a stud-horse―a stallion

content: 4. (=品質) quality; tone

content.content: この学校の生徒は種が好い
The students of this school are of good quality.
帝劇は客の種が好い
The Imperial Theatre enjoys a high tone of spectators.

content: 5. (=原) the source; the cause; material; matter (for joy or sorrow)

content.content: 争いの種、不和の種
the cause of quarrel―the subject of dispute―the bone of contention―the apple of discord
仲の好過ぎるのがけんかの種だ
Over-intimacy is the cause of their quarrels.
苦情の種
debatable ground
涙の種だ
It is matter for tears―a source of sorrow.
思い出すも涙の種
The thought brings the tears into my eyes.
心配の種だ
It is matter for anxiety―a source of care.
心配の種が絶えない
I shall never come to the end of my anxieties.
それは悦びの種だ
It is matter for congratulation.
残る煙が癪の種
The smoke that remains behind gives me the spasms.
楽は苦の種、苦は楽の種
No pleasure without pain―Pleasure is bought at the price of pain.
手品の種
a juggler's trick
種を明かす
to reveal the trick―show one's hand
種の無い手品は使われぬ
One can make nothing out of nothing.
金儲けの種にする
to turn anything to account―make capital out of anything
種を握っている
I hold the cards in my hands.
ちゃんと種が上がっている
The proof is before the court―The evidence is in court.
このことを種にして小説を仕組んだのだ
The matter was woven into a novel.
あの料理屋は種が好い
They use good materials at that restaurant.
種が尽きた
The country is played out.
バン種
leaven
菓子の種
stock

content: 6. (=話などの種) a topic (of conversation); a subject, a theme (for conversation); the staple (of conversation); matter (for a newspaper); food (for thought); an adventure

content.content: 戦争は好い話の種だ
The war is a good topic for conversation.
戦争はいつも話の種になる
The war is the staple of conversation.
話の種は尽きぬ
Topics of conversation are never wanting.
話の種が尽きた
We have exhausted the topics of conversation.
これは話の種になる
I have added to my stock of knowledge.
今度の旅行には話の種がたくさんある
I have had many adventures on my journey.
こんな汚い小屋にお泊りになるのもお話の種です
To stay for a night in such a squalid hovel will be an adventure for you.
話の種に一つ見ておこう
I will have a look at it, so that I may be able to say that I have seen it.
笑いの種にする
to turn anything into ridicule
考えの種
food for thought―matter for reflection
新聞の種
news-matter
新聞の種が無くて困っている
They are badly off for matter.
書く種
something to write about
彼は書く種が尽きた
He has written himself out.

〈名〉Rape-seed oil; cole-seed oil

content:
たねちがい〔胤違い〕

content.content: 胤違いの兄弟
half-brothers―half-sisters
腹違いの子
a child by a different father

〈名〉
1. (=種を取る野菜) a vegetable grown for seed
2. (=新聞の種取り) a reporter

content:
たねほん〔種本〕
〈名〉A secret source of information

content.content: 先生はなにか種本があるに違いない
He must have some secret source from which he obtains his materials.

content:
たねまき〔種蒔き〕
〈名〉Sowing:(=する) to sow the seed

content.content: 種蒔き時
seed-time
今が麦の種蒔き時だ
Now is the time for sowing the barley.

content:
たねもの〔種物〕
〈名〉
1. Seeds

content.content: 種物屋
