content: 2. (=蕎麦などの植物) a buckwheat dish with other ingredients

たねん〔他年〕
〈副〉Some other year; in future; in time; some day

content.content: 忍耐せば他年必ず成功するならん
If you will persevere, you will succeed in time.

content:
たねん〔他念〕
〈名〉(=なし) to be the whole man at (anything); to be absorbed in (anything); to be engrossed in (anything):(=なく) with undivided attention; with a whole heart; whole-heartedly

content.content: 彼は研究に他念無し
He is absorbed in study―engrossed in study.
満腔他意無しすべてこれ憂国の情
He is a whole-hearted patriot―He is patriotism itself.

content:
たねん〔多年〕
〈名〉Many years:(副詞に用いれば) for years:(=の) many years' years of (labour, etc.)

content.content: 研究を積むこと多年
He made a study of the matter for years.
多年の研究を積んでようやく成功した
He succeeded after many years' study―years of study.
この本には多年の労を費した
The book cast me years of labour―many years' labour.
彼は多年の知己だ
He is an acquaintance of many years' standing.
戦争は多年に亘った
The war extended over many years―lasted for years.
彼は多年の希望を遂げた
He has realized a long-cherished desire.
多年生植物
a perennial (plant)

content:
たねんせい〔多年生〕
〈形〉Perennial

content.content: 多年生植物
a perennial (plant)

content:
だの
〈副〉And so forth; and so on; and the like; and all that; and what not

content.content: 紅だの白粉だの
rough, powder, and what not

content: 〈接続詞〉And; or

content.content: 世間でなんだのかだのと言う
People will say one thing or another―People will talk.
なんだのかだので金が要る
I need money for this and that.
彼はなんだのかだの言ってなかなか承知しない
He says something or other―makes difficulties―and will not consent.
彼はなんだのかだの言って言い訳ばかりしている
He is always saying something or other to excuse himself.

content:
たのう〔多能〕
〈名〉Versatility:(=な) versatile

content.content: 彼は多能な人だ
He is a versatile genius―He can turn his hand to anything.

content:
たのしい〔楽しい〕
〈形〉Pleasant; delightful; enjoyable; happy; merry; sweet

content.content: 春は楽しい
Spring is a pleasant season.
楽しい一日を暮らした
I passed a pleasant day.
楽しく暮らす
to live a happy life
楽しい新年
a happy New Year
楽しいクリスマス
a merry Christmas
楽しい家庭
a happy home―a sweet home
楽しい思い出
a sweet memory
これを見ると楽しい昔を思い出す
This reminds me of my happier days.
足るを知れば心自ら楽し
One who is contented is happy.

content:
たのしませる〔楽しませる〕
〈他動〉To amuse; to please; to delight; to entertain

content.content: 心を楽しませる
to amuse the fancy
目を楽しませる
to delight the eye―feast one's eyes on wonders
耳を楽しませる
to delight the ear―listen to music
彼は面白い話をして人を楽しませる
He amuses people―entertains people―with interesting stories.

content:
たのしみ〔楽しみ〕
〈名〉
1. Pleasure; delight; joy; enjoyment

content.content: 子どもは楽しみだ
Children are a pleasure―a source of pleasure.
僕は子どもが楽しみだ
My children are my delight―I take delight in my children.
老人には子どもが何よりの楽しみだ
Old people take the greatest delight in children.
お子さんはさぞお楽しみでしょう
What a source of pleasure your children must be?
君は書くのが楽しみだろう
It must be a pleasure to you to write.
僕は楽しみに本を読むのではない
I do not read for pleasure.
読書の楽しみ
the pleasure of reading
読書の楽しみはまた格別だ
Reading is a great pleasure―Reading is a great resource.
僕は楽しみに書くのだ
I write for pleasure―to please myself.
人生の楽しみ
the enjoyment of life―the joys of life
人おのおの楽しみ有り
Each man has his joys.
楽しみその中に在り
Every situation in life has its own joys―I know how to accommodate myself to circumstances.
ならぬうちが楽しみ
The pleasure lies in the pursuit.
何を楽しみにする
to delight in―take delight in―take pleasure in―something
学生は学問を楽しみにしている
The students take delight in their studies.
彼は人を困らして楽しみにしている
He takes a malicious pleasure in annoying people.
(おやおや)お楽しみ
I wish you a pleasant time!―a sweet time!
昨晩はお楽しみ
What a sweet time you must have had last night!
楽しみは後に柱
'Tis sweet to have a post behind,
前に酒
A table spread with wine before,
左右に女
A woman fair on either side,
懐に金
And in your pocket money's store.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 君は何を楽しみに生きているか
What do you live for?
あの女は子どもを楽しみに生きている
She lives for her child.
この世の楽しみ
something worth living for―an object in life
彼はこの世の楽しみが有るまい
He can have nothing worth living for―no object in life.
お婆さんは孫ができてこの世の楽しみが有る
Grandma has an object in life in her grandchild.
この世の楽しみが無くなった
I have lost interest in life―The charm of life is gone.
彼は成功してからこの世の楽しみが無くなったらしい
He seems to have lost all interest in life after attaining his object.
楽しみに待つ
to look forward (with pleasure) to some event
子どもらはお祭りを楽しみに待っている
The children look forward to the festival.
彼の両親は彼の卒業を楽しみに待っている
His parents look forward to his graduation.
船乗りには上陸して遊ぶのが何よりの楽しみだ
Sailors look forward to making merry on shore.
末を楽しみに働く
I work with an eye to the future―I labour with a view to ultimate success.
後は明日のお楽しみ
The rest shall be tomorrow's work.

content:
たのしむ〔楽しむ〕
〈他動〉To enjoy (life); to rejoice in (peace); to delight in (books); to take delight in (one's studies); to take pleasure in (acts of charity); to luxuriate in (argument); to revel in (liberty); to look forward to (the future); to look back to (the past); to amuse oneself with (books); to enjoy oneself over (the wine, etc.)

content.content: 人生を楽しむ
to enjoy life―gather life's roses
風月を楽しむ
to enjoy nature
見て楽しむ、聞いて楽しむ
to enjoy the sight―enjoy hearing
山水を見て楽しむ
to enjoy the scenery
花を楽しむのは日本ばかりでないが花見を年中行事にしたのは日本だけだ
The enjoyment of flowers is not limited to Japan, but the institution of flower-viewing is confined to Japan.
音楽を聞いて楽しむ
to enjoy music
珍書を楽しむ(珍書道楽)
to delight in rare volumes―(読んで楽しむのなら)―feast on rare books
徳を楽しむ(道徳を道楽にする)
to delight in virtue―practise virtue for virtue's sake
日本人は涙を楽しむ(芝居などを見て泣くのが道楽)
Japanese revel in tears.
(出獄した罪人などが)自由を楽しむ
A liberated prisoner rejoices in his freedom―revels in regained liberty.
智者は水を楽しみ仁者は山を楽しむ
Genius delights in motion and activity; character delights in rest and peace.
学生は学問を楽しんでいる
The students take delight in their studies.
あの人は陰徳を積んで楽しんでいる
He takes (a) pleasure in doing good by stealth.
あの男は人を困らして楽しんでいる
He takes a malicious pleasure in annoying people.
船中ではどうして楽しむか
How do you amuse yourselves on board ship?
秋の夜長には本を読んで楽しむ
I amuse myself with books―amuse myself reading―on the long autumn evenings.
彼らはご馳走を食って楽しんでいる
They are enjoying themselves over their feast―They are making merry.
人おのおの楽しむ処あり
Each man has his joys.
この金が有れば一日楽しめる
I can buy a day's pleasure with this money.
将来を楽しむ
to look forward to the future
両親は彼の卒業を楽しんでいる
His parents look forward to his graduation.
両親は彼の卒業を楽しんで暮らしている
His parents live in anticipation of his graduation.
過去を楽しむ
to look back to the past
今を楽しむ
to live in the present
独りを楽しむ
to love solitude―love one's own company―take pleasure in the approbation of one's own heart
衆と共に楽しむ
to share one's joy with the multitude
千よろずの民と
Together with the million souls
共に楽しむに
To share the joy of weal
ます楽しみは
Is of all joys the sweetest far
あらじとぞ思う
That mortal man can feel
楽しんで事に従う
to do anything with pleasure―with delight―with joy
怏々として楽しまず
I am depressed in spirits―in low spirits―in the blues―in the dumps―in the dismals―in the doldrums―I have a fit of the blues.

content:
たのみ〔頼み〕
〈名〉
1. (=依頼、願い) a request; a favour

content.content: 君にお頼みがある
I wish to make you a request―I wish to ask a favour of you―I have a favour to ask of you―May I ask a favour of you?
お頼みがあって来た
I came to ask a favour of you.
人の頼みを聴く
to grant one's request―grant one a favour―do one a favour
お頼みがあるが聴いてくれんか
Will you do me a favour?
お頼みをお聴き下さるならば実にありがたい
If you would grant my request, I should esteem it a great favour.
お頼みを聴いて上げる
I will grant your request―Your request shall be granted.
人の頼みを聴かぬ
to refuse one a favour
君のお頼みなら何でも
I can refuse you no favour―(を通例略して)―I can refuse you nothing.
頼みに応ずる
to comply with one's request―accede to one's request―oblige one
遺憾ながらお頼みに応じかねる
I regret to say that I am not in a position to comply with your request―I am sorry I can not oblige you.
せっかくのお頼みだから置いて上げる
I will take you to oblige you.
彼は快く頼みに応じてくれた
He readily complied with my request.
知事の頼みに応じてこの地位をお受けしたのだ
I accepted the position in compliance with the request of the governor.
ご主人のお頼みによって参上しました
I came at the request of your master.
君のお頼みによって彼を同道したのだ
I have brought him at your request.
友人のせっかくの頼みによってその人を使ってみたのだ
I took the man on trial at the pressing request of a friend.
お頼みというのはどういうことですか
What is your request?―What is it that you wish me to do?
僕に頼みというのは金でも貸せというのか
What can you wish me to do, unless it be to lend you money?
どういう頼みかは知らないが僕の身に叶うことなら何でもして上げよう
What do you wish me to do?―What shall I do for you? I will do for you anything in my power.
たってのお頼みとあればしないものでもない
If you particularly wish it, I do not mind doing it.
苦しい時の神頼み
One will pray to the gods in extremity.
また頼み
an indirect request
また頼みする
to make one a request through another

content: 2. (=信頼、依頼) reliance; dependence; trust; resort; resource

content.content: あの人は頼みになる
He is to be depended upon―to be relied upon―reliable―trustworthy.
頼みにならぬ
He is not to be depended upon―not to be relied upon―unreliable―untrustworthy.
頼みの一刀
a trusty sword
いわゆる友人なるものはまさかの時には頼みにならないものだ
So-called friends will fail you in time of need.
あの人は頼みにならなかった
He failed me in time of need.
あのような友人は頼みになる
He is a trustworthy friend―He is a friend who will never fail you.
この天気は頼みにならぬ
The wealth is doubtful―The weather is uncertain.
頼みにする
to depend on one―rely on one―count upon one―lean on one―trust to one's honour―look to me for assistance―hope for success
君の約束を頼みにして待っていた
I have been waiting in reliance on your promise.
君を頼みにしてよいか
May I count upon you?
僕は君を頼みにしている
I look to you for assistance―I put my trust in you.
たった一人の知人を頼みにして上京した
I came to town with a single acquaintance to look to for assistance.
人の名誉心を頼みにする(紳士を以て人を遇する)
to trust to one's honour
(法律の制裁が無いから)彼の名誉心を頼みにするよりほかは無い
I can but trust to his honour―I have nothing but his honour to trust to.
僥倖を頼みにする
to trust to luck―trust to chance―trust to the chapter of accidents
万一の僥倖を頼みにしてやってみた
I tried on the off chance of success.
頼みにならないものを頼みにする(痩腕に頼る)
to trust to a broken reed―lean on a broken reed
頼みとするもの
one's resort―one's resource―one's strength―one's hope―one's staff―one's prop and stay
英国の頼みとするものは海軍のみ
The navy is England's only resort―England's only resource.
女の頼みとするものは涙のみ
Tears are woman's only resource.
彼の常に頼みとするものは詭弁である
Sophism is his usual resource.
我らの頼みとするものは神のみ
God is our only strength.
息子は老後の頼みだ
A son is the staff of one's declining years.
彼は息子を杖とも柱とも頼みにしている
His son is his only prop and stay.
一家の柱と頼みにした人が死んだ
The main prop and stay of the family died.
この商売が頼みの綱だ
This business is my last resort―my only resource―my only hope.
頼みの綱が切れた
My last resort has failed―My only hope is gone.
頼み少ない身の上です
I am without kith or kin―(寡婦なら)―She is a forlorn widow―(孤児なら)―He is a poor orphan.

たのみがいある〔頼み甲斐有る〕
〈形〉Reliable; trustworthy; true as steel

content:
たのみがいなき〔頼み甲斐無き〕
〈形〉Unreliable; untrustworthy

content.content: 頼み甲斐の無い人だ
He is not to be relied upon―not to be depended upon.
頼み甲斐の無い友人だ
Such a friend will fail you in time of need―He is a fair-weather friend.

content:
たのむ〔頼む、恃む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=願う、乞う、依頼する) to ask (one to do something―a favour of one); to beg (one to do something―one will do something); to request (one to do something); to entreat, implore, beseech (one to do something); to solicit (a favour of one); to call upon (one to do something); to adjure, conjure (one to do something)

content.content: 人に物を頼む
to make one a request―ask a favour of one―solicit a favour of one
お頼み申したいことがある
I wish to make you a request―I wish to ask a favour of you―I have a favour to ask of you―May I ask a favour of you?
お頼みしたいことがあって来た
I came to ask a favour of you.
彼に通弁を頼んだ
I asked him to interpret for me.
彼に通弁を頼まれた
I was asked to interpret for him.
道がわからないから案内を頼んだ
I asked him to show me the way.
田中君に演説を頼んだ
I called upon Mr. Tanaka to make a speech.
ご留任下さるよう幾重にも頼み入る
I entreat you to stay―implore you to stay.
手を合わして頼む
to implore on one's knees
頭を下げて頼む
to beg humbly (for something)―make a humble request (for something)
折り入って頼み入る
I adjure you to do so―conjure you to do so.
男と見込んで頼む
I appeal to you as man to man.
勘弁してやってくれ給え、頼む
Pardon him, I beg you!―Pardon him for my sake!
君にこんなことを頼めた義理じゃない
I have no right to make you such a request―I have no claim on you.
僕の頼むことを聴いてくれんか
Will you grant my request?―grant me a favour?―do me a favour?―comply with my request?―oblige me?
君一つ僕に頼まれてくれんか
Will you do me a favour?
頼んだら聴いてくれるだろう
If I were to ask him, he would grant my request.
彼はいくら頼んでも聴いてくれぬ
He will not grant my request―listen to my prayer.
人に頼まれていやと言う
to refuse one a favour
君には何を頼まれてもいやと言えぬ
(貴方の事なら)I can refuse you no favour―(を通例略して)―I can refuse you nothing.
人に頼まれて
at one's request―to oblige one
彼に頼まれて参りました
I came at his request―on his behalf.
宅では頼まれて下宿人を置くのです
We keep lodgers to oblige some friends.
そんなことは頼まれてもいやだ
I would not do such a thing at any one's request―to oblige any one.
頼まれれば後へは退かぬ
I will not recede from an engagement.
あれは頼めば何でもしてくれる人だ
He is an obliging man―of an accommodating disposition.
人に物を頼みに行く、頼みに来る
to go to one for something―come to one for something
困った時は頼みに来い
When you need a friend, come to me!
僕に頼みに来さえすりゃ助けてやったものを
If he would only have come to me, I would have helped him.
彼に助力を頼みに行った
I went to him for assistance.
彼は口を頼みに来たことがある
He once applied to me for employment.
この説明は君に頼むよりほかは無い
I must turn to you for the explanation.
この問題の解決を誰に頼むか
To whom can we look for a solution of the problem?
仲裁を頼む
to submit a matter to arbitration
案内を頼む(玄関で頼もうと言う)
to call out for admission―(西洋では)―knock at the door―ring at the bell
玄関で頼む頼むと言っている
Some one is singing out at the door.

content: 2. (=依頼する、信頼する、たよる) to depend on (one); to rely on (one); to count on (one); to lean on (one); to trust to (one's honesty); to resort to, have recourse to (some means); to look to (one) for assistance

content.content: (彼は両親に死に別れて)頼む人が無くなった
He had no one to depend on―He was thrown upon the world.
君を措いてほかに頼む人が無い
I have no one but you to look to for assistance―You are the only man to whom I can look for assistance.
僥倖を頼む
to trust to luck―trust to chance―trust to the chapter of accidents
万一の僥倖を頼んでやってみた
I tried on the off chance of success.
(望み無き中にも)万一を頼む
to hope against hope
彼女は万一を頼んで待った
She waited, hoping against hope.
才子は才を恃む
A talented man will rely on his talents (and not work).
彼は才を恃み過ぎる
He places too great reliance on his talents.
多勢を恃む
to rely on numbers―trust to numbers
敵は多数を恃んで油断した
The enemy revelled in security in reliance on their numbers―on the strength of their numbers.
己を恃む
to rely on self
人を力と頼む
to depend on others
股肱と頼む
to trust to one as one's right hand
朕爾を股肱と頼む
We trust to you as our right hand.
金城鉄壁と頼む
to rely on anything as an impregnable fortress
敵は旅順を金城鉄壁と頼んで油断しておった
The enemy looked upon Port Arthur as impregnable, and revelled in fancied security.
英国は海軍を金城鉄壁と頼んでいる
England has a tower of strength in her navy.
彼は味方として頼むべく敵として恐るべし
He is a powerful ally and a formidable foe.
頼みにならぬものを頼む、痩腕をたのむ
to lean on a broken reed―trust to a broken reed
頼むところ
one's resort―one's resource―one's strength―one's hope―one's staff―one's prop and stay
英国の頼むところは海軍のみ
The navy is England's only resort―England's sole dependence.
女の頼むところは涙のみ
Tears are woman's only resource.
彼の常に頼むところは詭弁である
Sophism is his usual resource.
老後に頼むものは息子だ
A son is the staff of one's declining years.
こんな時に頼む処は神のみである
On such occasions, God is our only strength―our only hope.
彼は杖とも柱とも頼む息子に死なれた
He lost a son who was his only prop and stay.
一家の柱と頼む人が死んだ
They have lost the main prop and stay of the house.
ほかに頼むところが無いから英語の先生を始めた
Having no other resource, I took to teaching English.
彼はまだ頼むところが有るらしい
He seems to have some resources left―have some hope left.
命と頼むもの
one's only resort―one's only resource
彼は命と頼む財産を失った
He lost his fortune, which was his only resort.
彼らは頼むに足らぬ
They are not to be depended upon―not to be relied upon―not to be trusted―unreliable―untrustworthy.

content: 3. (=依託する、託す、預ける) to entrust, trust (one with something―something to one); to charge (one with a message―one to do something); to give (one)charge of (valuables); to give (one something) in charge; to place (valuables)in one's charge; to place (valuables) under one's charge; to place (valuables) in one's custody; to give (valuables) into one's custody; to give (one something) to keep; to place (valuables) in one's safe-keeping; to give (valuables) into one's safe-keeping; to place (anything) in one's hands; to leave (anything) in one's hands; to leave (something with one); to place (anything) under one's care; to commit (anything) to one's care; to commission (one to do something)

content.content: 事件を君に頼む
I will entrust you with the matter―entrust the matter to you―place the matter in your hands.
僕のことは君に頼んでおけば安心だ
My affairs are safe in your hands.
事件を弁護士に頼んだ
I have entrusted a lawyer with the matter―entrusted the matter to a lawyer―placed the matter in the hands of a lawyer.
事件を頼んだ弁護士
the lawyer entrusted with the matter
弁護士に頼んだ事件
the matter entrusted to the lawyer
その金を頼まれた

I am entrusted with the money―The money is entrusted to me―given me to keep―given into my safe-keeping―placed in my safe-keeping―given me in charge―placed in my charge―placed under my charge―placed in my custody―given into my custody―committed to my care―placed under my care―placed in my hands―left in my hands―left with me.
金は君に頼んでおけば銀行に預けたも同然だ
The money is safe in your hands.
君にはどんな大金でも安心して頼める
I can trust you with any amount of money.
あの男に大金を頼むのは剣呑だ
You can not trust him with a large sum of money.
金は会計に頼んでおいた
I have left the money with the treasurer.
貴重品は亭主に頼んだ

I have entrusted the landlord with the valuables―entrusted the valuables to the landlord―given the valuables in charge to the landlord―given the landlord charge of the valuables―placed the valuables in the charge of the landlord―placed the valuables under the charge of the landlord―placed the valuables under the care of the landlord―placed the valuables in the custody of the landlord―given the valuables into the custody of the landlord―given the valuables into the safe-keeping of the landlord―placed the valuables in the safe-keeping of the landlord―placed the valuables in the hands of the landlord.
貴重品は亭主に頼んである

The valuables are in the charge of the landlord―under the charge of the landlord―under the care of the landlord―in the custody of the landlord―in the safe-keeping of the landlord―in the hands of the landlord.
亭主には貴重品が頼んである
The landlord is in charge of the valuables―in custody of the valuables.
貴重品を頼んだ人
the man in charge of the valuables
その人に頼んだ貴重品
the valuables in the charge of―under the charge of―the man
君の手荷物を赤帽に頼み給え
Give your luggage (in charge) to the porter.
手荷物を頼んだ赤帽
the porter in charge of the luggage
赤帽に頼んだ手荷物
the luggage in the charge of the porter
仕事を頼まれた
I am entrusted with some work―I have undertaken some work.
人に用を頼む
to charge one with a commission―entrust one with a commission―give one a commission―commission one to do something
買い物を頼まれた
I am commissioned to make some purchases.
人に手紙を頼む
to charge one with a letter
手紙を頼まれて来ました
I am charged with a letter for you.
手紙を友人に頼んでやった
I sent the letter by the hand of a friend.
手紙を誰に頼んでやろうか
By whom shall I send the letter?
彼は僕に渡す品を君に頼まなかったか
Did he not charge you with anything for me?
玄関番に伝言を頼んで来た
I have charged the door-boy with a message―I have left word with the door-boy.
彼に君への伝言を頼んだはずだが忘れたとみえる
I had charged him with a message for you, but he seems to have forgotten it.
僕は君への伝言を頼まれた
I am charged with a message for you.
子どもの教育をお頼み申す
I place my boy under your care.
店の事はいっさい番頭に頼んでおきます
I have committed all business to the care of my manager.
彼に後事を頼んで出た
I charged him to see that all was well during my absence―I charged him to look to my affairs during my absence.
彼が死ぬ時後事を頼まれた
He charged me on his deathbed to look to his affairs after he was gone.

content:
4. 
〈命令法〉

content.content: よろしく頼む
I leave it to your judgment.
万事よろしく頼む
I leave everything in your hands.
この事を頼むよ
Please look to the matter!―see to the matter!
子どもを頼むよ
Please take care of the children!―look after the children!
不在中学校を頼むよ
Please look after the school during my absence!
万事不都合の無いように頼む
See that all is well!―Take care that all is well!
手落ちの無いように頼む
See that nothing is omitted!
子どもらがいたずらをせぬように頼む
See that the boys get into no mischief!
子どもらがいたずらせぬように頼むと彼に言い付けた
I charged him to see that the boys got into no mischief.
留守中万事よろしく頼む
Please see that all is well during my absence!―Please look to everything during my absence!
俺が死んでから後々の事を頼む
See that all is well after I am gone!―Look to my affairs after I am gone!
彼は僕に死後の事を頼むと言った
He charged me to see that all was well after he was gone―He charged me to look to his affairs after his departure.

content: 5. (=雇う、呼ぶ) to hire; to engage; to secure one's services; to call; to procure

content.content: 大工を頼む
to hire a carpenter
家庭教師を頼む
to engage a governess
医者を頼む
to procure a doctor―call in a doctor
弁護士を頼む
to retain a lawyer
坊主を頼んで経を読んで貰った
We had masses said by a priest.
案内者を頼んで登山した
We made the ascent under the conduct of a guide.
人を頼む
to secure one's services
人を頼んで来よう
I will procure help.
今にお頼みするようになるだろう
The time may come when we shall need your services.

content:
たのむ〔頼む、恃む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=願う、乞う、依頼する) to ask (one to do something―a favour of one); to beg (one to do something―one will do something); to request (one to do something); to entreat, implore, beseech (one to do something); to solicit (a favour of one); to call upon (one to do something); to adjure, conjure (one to do something)

content.content: 人に物を頼む
to make one a request―ask a favour of one―solicit a favour of one
お頼み申したいことがある
I wish to make you a request―I wish to ask a favour of you―I have a favour to ask of you―May I ask a favour of you?
お頼みしたいことがあって来た
I came to ask a favour of you.
彼に通弁を頼んだ
I asked him to interpret for me.
彼に通弁を頼まれた
I was asked to interpret for him.
道がわからないから案内を頼んだ
I asked him to show me the way.
田中君に演説を頼んだ
I called upon Mr. Tanaka to make a speech.
ご留任下さるよう幾重にも頼み入る
I entreat you to stay―implore you to stay.
手を合わして頼む
to implore on one's knees
頭を下げて頼む
to beg humbly (for something)―make a humble request (for something)
折り入って頼み入る
I adjure you to do so―conjure you to do so.
男と見込んで頼む
I appeal to you as man to man.
勘弁してやってくれ給え、頼む
Pardon him, I beg you!―Pardon him for my sake!
君にこんなことを頼めた義理じゃない
I have no right to make you such a request―I have no claim on you.
僕の頼むことを聴いてくれんか
Will you grant my request?―grant me a favour?―do me a favour?―comply with my request?―oblige me?
君一つ僕に頼まれてくれんか
Will you do me a favour?
頼んだら聴いてくれるだろう
If I were to ask him, he would grant my request.
彼はいくら頼んでも聴いてくれぬ
He will not grant my request―listen to my prayer.
人に頼まれていやと言う
to refuse one a favour
君には何を頼まれてもいやと言えぬ
(貴方の事なら)I can refuse you no favour―(を通例略して)―I can refuse you nothing.
人に頼まれて
at one's request―to oblige one
彼に頼まれて参りました
I came at his request―on his behalf.
宅では頼まれて下宿人を置くのです
We keep lodgers to oblige some friends.
そんなことは頼まれてもいやだ
I would not do such a thing at any one's request―to oblige any one.
頼まれれば後へは退かぬ
I will not recede from an engagement.
あれは頼めば何でもしてくれる人だ
He is an obliging man―of an accommodating disposition.
人に物を頼みに行く、頼みに来る
to go to one for something―come to one for something
困った時は頼みに来い
When you need a friend, come to me!
僕に頼みに来さえすりゃ助けてやったものを
If he would only have come to me, I would have helped him.
彼に助力を頼みに行った
I went to him for assistance.
彼は口を頼みに来たことがある
He once applied to me for employment.
この説明は君に頼むよりほかは無い
I must turn to you for the explanation.
この問題の解決を誰に頼むか
To whom can we look for a solution of the problem?
仲裁を頼む
to submit a matter to arbitration
案内を頼む(玄関で頼もうと言う)
to call out for admission―(西洋では)―knock at the door―ring at the bell
玄関で頼む頼むと言っている
Some one is singing out at the door.

content: 2. (=依頼する、信頼する、たよる) to depend on (one); to rely on (one); to count on (one); to lean on (one); to trust to (one's honesty); to resort to, have recourse to (some means); to look to (one) for assistance

content.content: (彼は両親に死に別れて)頼む人が無くなった
He had no one to depend on―He was thrown upon the world.
君を措いてほかに頼む人が無い
I have no one but you to look to for assistance―You are the only man to whom I can look for assistance.
僥倖を頼む
to trust to luck―trust to chance―trust to the chapter of accidents
万一の僥倖を頼んでやってみた
I tried on the off chance of success.
(望み無き中にも)万一を頼む
to hope against hope
彼女は万一を頼んで待った
She waited, hoping against hope.
才子は才を恃む
A talented man will rely on his talents (and not work).
彼は才を恃み過ぎる
He places too great reliance on his talents.
多勢を恃む
to rely on numbers―trust to numbers
敵は多数を恃んで油断した
The enemy revelled in security in reliance on their numbers―on the strength of their numbers.
己を恃む
to rely on self
人を力と頼む
to depend on others
股肱と頼む
to trust to one as one's right hand
朕爾を股肱と頼む
We trust to you as our right hand.
金城鉄壁と頼む
to rely on anything as an impregnable fortress
敵は旅順を金城鉄壁と頼んで油断しておった
The enemy looked upon Port Arthur as impregnable, and revelled in fancied security.
英国は海軍を金城鉄壁と頼んでいる
England has a tower of strength in her navy.
彼は味方として頼むべく敵として恐るべし
He is a powerful ally and a formidable foe.
頼みにならぬものを頼む、痩腕をたのむ
to lean on a broken reed―trust to a broken reed
頼むところ
one's resort―one's resource―one's strength―one's hope―one's staff―one's prop and stay
英国の頼むところは海軍のみ
The navy is England's only resort―England's sole dependence.
女の頼むところは涙のみ
Tears are woman's only resource.
彼の常に頼むところは詭弁である
Sophism is his usual resource.
老後に頼むものは息子だ
A son is the staff of one's declining years.
こんな時に頼む処は神のみである
On such occasions, God is our only strength―our only hope.
彼は杖とも柱とも頼む息子に死なれた
He lost a son who was his only prop and stay.
一家の柱と頼む人が死んだ
They have lost the main prop and stay of the house.
ほかに頼むところが無いから英語の先生を始めた
Having no other resource, I took to teaching English.
彼はまだ頼むところが有るらしい
He seems to have some resources left―have some hope left.
命と頼むもの
one's only resort―one's only resource
彼は命と頼む財産を失った
He lost his fortune, which was his only resort.
彼らは頼むに足らぬ
They are not to be depended upon―not to be relied upon―not to be trusted―unreliable―untrustworthy.

content: 3. (=依託する、託す、預ける) to entrust, trust (one with something―something to one); to charge (one with a message―one to do something); to give (one)charge of (valuables); to give (one something) in charge; to place (valuables)in one's charge; to place (valuables) under one's charge; to place (valuables) in one's custody; to give (valuables) into one's custody; to give (one something) to keep; to place (valuables) in one's safe-keeping; to give (valuables) into one's safe-keeping; to place (anything) in one's hands; to leave (anything) in one's hands; to leave (something with one); to place (anything) under one's care; to commit (anything) to one's care; to commission (one to do something)

content.content: 事件を君に頼む
I will entrust you with the matter―entrust the matter to you―place the matter in your hands.
僕のことは君に頼んでおけば安心だ
My affairs are safe in your hands.
事件を弁護士に頼んだ
I have entrusted a lawyer with the matter―entrusted the matter to a lawyer―placed the matter in the hands of a lawyer.
事件を頼んだ弁護士
the lawyer entrusted with the matter
弁護士に頼んだ事件
the matter entrusted to the lawyer
その金を頼まれた

I am entrusted with the money―The money is entrusted to me―given me to keep―given into my safe-keeping―placed in my safe-keeping―given me in charge―placed in my charge―placed under my charge―placed in my custody―given into my custody―committed to my care―placed under my care―placed in my hands―left in my hands―left with me.
金は君に頼んでおけば銀行に預けたも同然だ
The money is safe in your hands.
君にはどんな大金でも安心して頼める
I can trust you with any amount of money.
あの男に大金を頼むのは剣呑だ
You can not trust him with a large sum of money.
金は会計に頼んでおいた
I have left the money with the treasurer.
貴重品は亭主に頼んだ

I have entrusted the landlord with the valuables―entrusted the valuables to the landlord―given the valuables in charge to the landlord―given the landlord charge of the valuables―placed the valuables in the charge of the landlord―placed the valuables under the charge of the landlord―placed the valuables under the care of the landlord―placed the valuables in the custody of the landlord―given the valuables into the custody of the landlord―given the valuables into the safe-keeping of the landlord―placed the valuables in the safe-keeping of the landlord―placed the valuables in the hands of the landlord.
貴重品は亭主に頼んである

The valuables are in the charge of the landlord―under the charge of the landlord―under the care of the landlord―in the custody of the landlord―in the safe-keeping of the landlord―in the hands of the landlord.
亭主には貴重品が頼んである
The landlord is in charge of the valuables―in custody of the valuables.
貴重品を頼んだ人
the man in charge of the valuables
その人に頼んだ貴重品
the valuables in the charge of―under the charge of―the man
君の手荷物を赤帽に頼み給え
Give your luggage (in charge) to the porter.
手荷物を頼んだ赤帽
the porter in charge of the luggage
赤帽に頼んだ手荷物
the luggage in the charge of the porter
仕事を頼まれた
I am entrusted with some work―I have undertaken some work.
人に用を頼む
to charge one with a commission―entrust one with a commission―give one a commission―commission one to do something
買い物を頼まれた
I am commissioned to make some purchases.
人に手紙を頼む
to charge one with a letter
手紙を頼まれて来ました
I am charged with a letter for you.
手紙を友人に頼んでやった
I sent the letter by the hand of a friend.
手紙を誰に頼んでやろうか
By whom shall I send the letter?
彼は僕に渡す品を君に頼まなかったか
Did he not charge you with anything for me?
玄関番に伝言を頼んで来た
I have charged the door-boy with a message―I have left word with the door-boy.
彼に君への伝言を頼んだはずだが忘れたとみえる
I had charged him with a message for you, but he seems to have forgotten it.
僕は君への伝言を頼まれた
I am charged with a message for you.
子どもの教育をお頼み申す
I place my boy under your care.
店の事はいっさい番頭に頼んでおきます
I have committed all business to the care of my manager.
彼に後事を頼んで出た
I charged him to see that all was well during my absence―I charged him to look to my affairs during my absence.
彼が死ぬ時後事を頼まれた
He charged me on his deathbed to look to his affairs after he was gone.

content:
4. 
〈命令法〉

content.content: よろしく頼む
I leave it to your judgment.
万事よろしく頼む
I leave everything in your hands.
この事を頼むよ
Please look to the matter!―see to the matter!
子どもを頼むよ
Please take care of the children!―look after the children!
不在中学校を頼むよ
Please look after the school during my absence!
万事不都合の無いように頼む
See that all is well!―Take care that all is well!
手落ちの無いように頼む
See that nothing is omitted!
子どもらがいたずらをせぬように頼む
See that the boys get into no mischief!
子どもらがいたずらせぬように頼むと彼に言い付けた
I charged him to see that the boys got into no mischief.
留守中万事よろしく頼む
Please see that all is well during my absence!―Please look to everything during my absence!
俺が死んでから後々の事を頼む
See that all is well after I am gone!―Look to my affairs after I am gone!
彼は僕に死後の事を頼むと言った
He charged me to see that all was well after he was gone―He charged me to look to his affairs after his departure.

content: 5. (=雇う、呼ぶ) to hire; to engage; to secure one's services; to call; to procure

content.content: 大工を頼む
to hire a carpenter
家庭教師を頼む
to engage a governess
医者を頼む
to procure a doctor―call in a doctor
弁護士を頼む
to retain a lawyer
坊主を頼んで経を読んで貰った
We had masses said by a priest.
案内者を頼んで登山した
We made the ascent under the conduct of a guide.
人を頼む
to secure one's services
人を頼んで来よう
I will procure help.
今にお頼みするようになるだろう
The time may come when we shall need your services.

content:
たのむにたらぬ〔恃むに足らぬ〕
〈形〉Not to be depended upon; not to be relied upon; unreliable; untrustworthy; not to be trusted

content.content: 当局者は恃むに足らぬ
The insiders are not to be trusted.

content:
たのもしい〔頼もしい〕
〈形〉
1. (=頼みになる) reliable, trustworthy (man) ; trusty (blade, etc.)

content.content: あれは頼もしい男だ
He is to be relied upon―to be depended upon.
頼もしい友人だ
He is a trusty friend―a staunch friend―He will never fail you.
貴君を頼もしく思っております
I put my trust in you.

content: 2. (=末頼もしい) hopeful (boy); promising (lad)

content.content: あれは頼もしい若者だ
He is a promising youth―a young man of great promise.

たのもしこう〔頼母子講〕
〈名〉A mutual aid association

content:
たば〔束〕
〈名〉A bundle (of sticks); a bunch (of keys); a sheaf (of corn); a faggot (of wood); a coil (of rope)

content.content: 札の束
a bundle of banknotes
花の束
a bunch of flowers
一束の矢
a bundle of arrows
一束の稲
a sheaf of rice-plants
一束の薪
a bundle of wood―a faggot
薪は一束いくらで売る
Wood is sold by the bundle.
この薪は一束いくらか
What does a bundle of this wood cost?―How much is this wood a bundle?
一人ずつは面倒だから皆束になってかかって来い
It is troublesome to deal with one at a time. Come on all of you at a time!

だば〔駄馬〕
〈名〉
1. (=荷馬)a pack-horse
2. (=下等な馬)a hack; a jade

たばかる〔謀る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=考える) to think
2. (=相談する) to consult; to take counsel
〈他動〉(=欺く) to deceive

content:
たばこ〔煙草〕
〈名〉
1. Tobacco; the Indian weed; the fragrant weed; the soothing weed; the poor man's solace

content.content: タバコを吸う、タバコを飲む
to smoke (tobacco)―smoke a pipe
君はタバコを飲まないか
Don't you smoke?
酒もタバコも飲みません
I neither drink nor smoke.
酒とタバコは養生に害あり
Wine and tobacco are injurious to health.
タバコを一服吸う
to have a smoke
タバコを一服やろうじゃないか
Let us have a smoke!
タバコを一服吸う間にできます
It can be done while you smoke a pipe.
タバコを吹かす
to puff tobacco―whiff tobacco
タバコの輪を吹く
to puff rings of smoke―whiff rings of smoke―blow rings of smoke
タバコの煙を吹く
to blow tobacco-smoke―blow a cloud of smoke
タバコが好きだ
I am fond of tobacco―I am fond of smoking―I love my pipe.
タバコを止める
to give up smoking
タバコを止めた
I have given up smoking―smoked my last pipe―laid aside my pipe.
好きなタバコを止めた
I have given up my favourite pipe.
タバコが好きで止められぬ
I can not give up my favourite pipe―I am wedded to my pipe―I am an inveterate smoker.
タバコを詰める
to fill one's pipe―replenish a pipe
タバコをつける
to light one's pipe―light up
吸いつけタバコ
a lighted pipe (offered to one)
吸いつけタバコをする
to offer one a lighted pipe
タバコに酔う
to smoke oneself sick
タバコに酔った
I am sick with smoking.
このタバコは辛い
This tobacco is (too) strong.
このタバコは甘い
This tobacco is mild.

content:
2. 
〈複合詞〉

content.content: 刻みタバコ
cut tobacco
巻タバコ
(葉巻)a cigar―(紙巻き)―a cigarette
噛みタバコ
chewing-tobacco
嗅ぎタバコ
snuff
タバコの吸い殻
tobacco-ashes―(巻きタバコのは)―a cigar-end―a cigarette-end
タバコの火
a light―a cigar-light
タバコの火を借りる
to borrow a light for one's pipe
タバコの火をお貸し下さい
Please lend me a light for my cigarette.
タバコ入れ
a tobacco-pouch―a cigar-case―a cigarette-case
タバコ盆
a tobacco-tray
タバコ屋
a tobacconist
煙草専売局
the Tobacco Monopoly Bureau
煙草専売法
the Tobacco Monopoly Law

content:
たばさむ〔手挟む〕
〈他動〉To wear (a sword)

content.content: 武士は両刀を手挟む
The samurai wears two swords.

content:
だはする〔打破する〕
〈他動〉To explode (an old doctrine); to break down (old customs); to shatter (an illusion)

content.content: 旧説を打破する
to explode the old theory―knock the old theory on the head
旧習を打破する
to break down old customs
旧弊を打破する
to break down conservative ideas
迷夢を打破する
to shatter an illusion
誤謬を打破する
to explode a fallacy

たはた〔田畑〕
〈名〉Fields:(一戸の農家に属する田畑は)a farm

content:
たばね〔束ね〕
〈名〉Control; management

content.content: 一家の束ねをする
to control the household―manage the household

content:
たばねる〔束ねる〕
〈他動〉To bundle (sticks); to bunch (keys); to sheave (corn); to fagot (wood); to tie up (corn) in sheaves; to tie up (sticks) in a bundle

content.content: 稲を束ねる
to sheave rice-plants―tie up rice-plants in sheaves
薪を束ねる
to bundle wood―fagot wood―tie up wood in bundles
藁を束ねる
to tie up straw in sheaves

content:
たび〔足袋〕
〈名〉(Japanese) socks

content.content: 足袋一足
a pair of socks
足袋をはく
(常になら) to wear socks―(取ってなら)―put on one's socks
足袋をはいている
I am wearing socks―I have socks on―I am in socks.
足袋を脱ぐ
to take off one's socks
足袋はだしで
in one's socks―in stockings
紺足袋、白足袋、ゴム底足袋
blue socks―white socks―rubber-soled socks

content:
たび〔度〕
〈名〉Time

content.content: ひとたび
one time―once
三度
three times―thrice
三度諫めて聴かざれば臣死す
The last expostulation is death.
いくたびも
many times―many a time―several times―often
このたび
this time
このたびはおめでとう
I wish you joy of the occasion.→『たびごとに〔度毎に〕』

content:
たび〔旅〕
〈名〉Travelling; travel; a journey; a tour; a trip

content.content: 旅をする
to travel―make a journey―(長途なら)―make a tour―(短期なら)―make a trip
旅に出る
to start on a journey―(長途なら)―set out on one's travels―go on a tour―(短期なら)―go on a trip
楽な旅をする
to travel by easy stages
急ぎの旅をする
to travel by long stages―travel post―make a flying visit
京都まで急ぎの旅をして来た
I have made a flying visit to Kyoto.
人生の旅
the journey of life
旅に疲れた人
a wayworn traveller
旅の空
to be away from home―an exile from home―a stranger in a strange land
心淋しき旅の空
Away from home, I miss my friends.
永の旅住居
I am an exile from home.
あの人は旅慣れている
He is used to travelling―a ready traveller.
旅は憂いもの辛いもの
Travelling is full of hardships and privations.
可愛い子には旅をさせよ
If you love your child, send him out into the world.
旅の憂さを晴らす
to beguile the tedium of the journey―beguile the way(with conversation, etc.)
旅は路連れ
“Good company makes the road shorter”―“Good company on the road is the shortest cut.”
旅は路連れ
A good companion on the road,
世は情け
And love to lighten life's load.
旅の恥は掻き捨て
“Once over the borders, one may do anything.”
三人旅はするな
“Three is not company.”
彼は旅芸人で旅から旅へと渡って歩く
He is strolling actor, and ever on his travels.
旅支度
a travelling outfit―a traveller's equipment
旅支度をする
to equip oneself for a journey―fit oneself out for a journey
彼は旅支度をしていた
He was equipped for a journey―dressed for the road.
旅先で病気をした

たまげる〔魂消る〕
〈自動〉To be amazed; to be astonished; to be thunderstruck

content.content: 彼の成功には皆たまげている
Everybody is amazed at his success.
皆たまげて眺めておった
They all looked on in amazement.
わっとたまげる女の泣きごえ
There is a shriek!

content:
たまご〔卵、玉子〕
〈名〉
1. An egg:(魚のは) spawn:(魚腹中にあれば) roe

content.content: 玉子を生む
A hen lays eggs―Fish spawn.
生み立ての玉子
new-laid eggs
この雌鶏はよく玉子を生む、玉子を生まぬ
This hen is a good layer―a bad layer.
玉子を生む雌鶏
a laying hen
雌鶏が玉子を抱く
A hen sits (on eggs)―broods.
雌鶏に玉子を抱かせる
to set a hen (on eggs)―set eggs
卵を孵る
to hatch eggs
卵が孵る
Eggs are hatched.
玉子を割る
to break an egg
玉子を吸う
to suck an egg
玉子を焼く
to fry eggs
玉子焼き
fried eggs―an omelette
玉子をうでる
to boil eggs
うで玉子
hard-boiled eggs
半熟玉子
underdone eggs―soft-boiled eggs
落とし玉子
poached eggs
玉子を掻く
to beat eggs
掻き玉子
beaten eggs―(煮れば)―scrambled eggs
朝飯に玉子を食う
I have eggs for breakfast.
玉子をどうして食うか
How do you eat your eggs?
玉子を生まで食う
I eat my eggs raw.
生ま玉子
raw eggs
玉子が腐る
An egg gets addled.
腐った玉子
an addled egg―a rotten egg
夏は玉子が悪くなる
Eggs get spoilt in summer.
悪くなった玉子
spoilt eggs
玉子の白身
the white of an egg―glair
玉子の黄身
yolk
玉子の殻
an egg-shell
玉子を立てる法
How to stand an egg on end.
丸い玉子も切り様で四角、ものも言い様で角が立つ
“Smooth words make smooth ways. ”
玉子形
oval
玉子に目鼻を付けたような顔
an oval face
玉子酒
egg-nog
玉子色
pale yellow

content: 2. (=何々の玉子) incipient, embryo(と形容詞に訳す)

content.content: 小学校の生徒は国民の玉子だ
The primary-school children are incipient citizens.
彼は外交官の玉子だ
He is an incipient diplomat―an embryo diplomat―a diplomat in embryo.

〈名〉
1. An egg:(魚のは) spawn:(魚腹中にあれば) roe
