たまござけ〔玉子酒〕
〈名〉Egg-nog; egg-flip

たまごやき〔玉子焼〕
〈名〉An omelette; fried eggs

たまころがし〔玉転がし〕
〈名〉Bowling; bowls; roulette

たまざん〔珠算〕
〈名〉Calculation on the abacus

content:
たましい〔魂〕
〈名〉
1. A soul; a spirit

content.content: 刀は武士の魂
The sword is the soul of the samurai.
体に魂が入る
The soul informs the body.
体に魂を入れる
to animate the body
仏造って魂入れず
to leave the body without the soul
魂を入れて事をする
to put one's heart into one's work―to do anything with all one's heart and soul
魂の入れ方一つで何事もできる
You can accomplish anything if you put your heart into your works―if your heart is in your work.
魂を入れ替える
to reform (oneself)―amend (one's conduct)―mend one's ways―lead a new life―turn over a new leaf
これから魂を入れ替えて勉強します
I will turn over a new leaf.
魂を奪う
to charm―captivate―fascinate―ravish―enrapture―one
魂を奪われる
to be charmed―captivated―fascinated―ravished―enraptured
彼はあの女に魂を奪われている
He is captivated with―fascinated with―enthralled by―the woman.
その女に身も魂も打ち込んでいる
He is infatuated with the woman―taken with the girl―gone on the girl.
音楽に魂を奪われる
to be enraptured by music―carried away by music
その音楽を聴いて魂を奪われた
I listened to the heavenly music with rapt attention.
著者が読者の魂を奪う
A writer fascinates his reader.
雄弁家が聴衆の魂を奪う
An orator takes his audience with him―sweeps his audience with him.
あの女優は見物の魂を奪う
She takes the audience by storm.
魂も身に添わぬ
to be beside oneself
嬉しくて(悲しくて)魂も身に添わなかった
I was beside myself with joy―beside myself with sorrow.
魂が天涯に飛ぶ
to be in ecstasies―in raptures
三つ子の魂百までも
“The child is father of the man. ”
一寸の虫にも五分の魂
“Tread on a worm, and it will turn”―“A worm will turn”―“Even a fly has its spleen. ”

content: 2. (=意気) a spirit

content.content: 大和魂
the Japanese spirit

content: 3. (=肖像などの魂) life

content.content: 魂の無い肖像だ
The portrait has no life.

content: 4. (=面の魂) expression

content.content: 魂の無い顔だ
The face fails in expression.

content:
だましうち〔騙し討ち〕
〈名〉A surprise attack:(闇討の意味なら)foul play

content.content: 敵をだまし討ちにする
to take the enemy by surprise―take the enemy at vantage
だまし討ちとは卑怯なり
This is foul play!

content:
だます〔瞞す〕
〈他動〉
1. To cheat, fool, befool, dupe, hoax, bamboozle, humbug, gammon (a man):(上品に言えば)to deceive, delude, circumvent, overreach, outwit, get round (a person):(また)to ompose upon, practise upon, play upon, put upon (a person)

content.content: ばかな奴がだまされてきおったのだ
The fool has been imposed upon.
田舎者は往々あの手でだまされる
Countryfolk are often imposed upon by that trick.
君は人の言うことを信じやすいものだからだまされたのだ
They have practised upon your credulity.
あの女はあの男をだますぞ
She will make a fool of him.
女にだまされる(鼻毛を読まれる)
to be made a fool of
人をだまして金を取る
to cheat―cozen―hoax―fool―gull―do―a man out of his money
やっとだまして帰してやった
I have managed to cozen him into going away.
君はだまされて好い地位を失ったのだ
You have been fooled out of a good position.
まんまとだまされた
I was nicely taken in―done brown.
彼らは外国人を見るとだましてもさしつかえないものだと思っている
They look upon foreigners as fair game.
その手で俺をだます気か
Is that your little game?
またもその手でだます気か
Are you at that game again?―I know that old game of yours―The same old game!
同じ手で二度だまされるばかは無い
“It is a silly fish that is caught twice with the same bait.”
だまされて無駄足を運んだ
I went on a fool's errand.
愚夫愚婦をだます話だ
They are old women's tales―old wives' fables.
だまされた気で試してご覧
Think you are fooled and try.
だまされた人
a dupe
君は奸商にだまされたのだ
You are the dupe of the cunning merchant.
泣く子をだます
to calm―still―hush―soothe―a crying child
うちへ帰って餓鬼でもだませ
Go home and mind your brat!

たますだれ〔玉簾〕
〈名〉A bamboo-blind set with beads

content:
たまたま〔偶々〕
〈副〉
1. (=偶に) occasionally; at times; at long intervals; at rare intervals; on rare occasions; (every) now and then; once in a while; between whiles

content.content: あの人はたまたま来ることがある
He will look in at times―every now and then―once in a while.
たまたま来るかと思えばすぐ帰る
If he does come once in a while, he never stays long.
これはたまたまある事だ
This is a rare occurrence.
あれはたまたま来る客だ
He is a rare visitor―a casual visitor.
これはたまたまある例だ
These are rare instances―stray instances.

content: 2. (=偶然) accidentally; by accident; by chance:(往々動詞に訳して) to chance (to do something) ; to happen (to do something)

content.content: たまたま兄が居合わせた
It so happened that my brother was present―My brother happened to be present.
そこへたまたま僕が通りかかった
It so chanced that I came along―Then I chanced to come along.

content:
たまちる〔玉散る〕
〈形〉Flashing

content.content: 玉散る剣
a flashing blade
玉散る剣抜き連れて
With flashing blades in your hands,
死ぬる覚悟で進むべし
March with your lives in your hands!

content:
たまつき〔玉突〕
〈名〉Billiards:(=の) billiard

content.content: 玉突きをやる
to play (at) billiards
君は玉突きをやるか
Do you play billiards?
玉突きを一番やろうか
Will you have a game at billiards?
玉突きで勝った、玉突きで負けた
I have won a game at billiards―lost a game at billiards.
あの人は玉突きが上手だ
He is a good hand at billiards―a good billiard-player.
玉突き場
a billiard-saloon―a billiard-room
玉突き盤
a billiard-table
玉突き棒
a cue
玉突きする人々
a billiard-player―a cueist
玉突き場のゲーム取り
a billiard-marker

たまつばき〔玉椿〕
〈名〉The privet

content:
たまてばこ〔玉手箱〕
〈名〉A casket

content.content: 明けて悔しき玉手箱
I found the casket empty―I found it an apple of Sodom―I found the bird flown.
少年玉手箱
The Boy's Own Book.

たまなげ〔玉投げ〕
〈名〉(Playing) ball:(=する) to play ball

content:
たまなし〔玉無し〕
〈名〉A total loss

content.content: 一生を玉無しにする
to ruin one's life―spoil one's life
まかりまちがえば玉無しさ
If the worst comes to the worst, I shall lose everything―I shall be a beggar.

content:
たまに〔偶に〕
〈副〉Occasionally; at times; at long intervals; at rare intervals; on rare occasions; (every) now and then; once in a while; between whiles:(=の) occasional; rare; few and far between

content.content: たまには来てくれても罰も当たるまい
You might come to see me every now and then.
たまに来るかと思えばすぐ帰る
If you do come once in a while, you never stay long.
あの人はたまに来ることがある
He will look in at times―(たまーに)―at long intervals―at rare intervals.
彼が勉強することはたまにある
He will work hard on rare occasions.
これはたまにあることだ(たまにしか無いことだ)
This is a rare occurrence.
あれはたまに来る客だ(たまにしか来ない客だ)
He is a rare visitor.
これはたまにある例だ(たまにしか無い例だ)
These are rare instances―stray instances.
そういう人はたまにしか無い
Such men are rare.
そういう人はたまにはある
There are such men, though rare.
こんな果報はたまにしか無い
Such angel-visits are few and far between.

content:
たまのあせ〔玉の汗〕
〈名〉Beads of sweat

content.content: 玉の汗をかいている
Beads of sweat stand on his brow.

content:
たまのお〔玉の緒〕
〈名〉A string through the beads; a bead-string:(より) the thread of life; the fatal thread; life-strings; life

content.content: 玉の緒が切れた
The life-strings are broken―The fatal thread is broken.
玉の緒まさに絶えなんとす
His life is fast ebbing away.

content:
たまのこし〔玉の輿〕
〈名〉Marrying into the purple

content.content: 玉の輿に乗る
to marry into the purple
女は氏無くして玉の輿
A woman of no birth may marry into the purple.

content:
たまのり〔玉乗り〕
〈名〉Dancing on a ball

content.content: 娘玉乗り
a girl-dancer on a ball

content:
たまはばき〔玉箒〕
〈名〉(The poetical name for) a broom

content.content: 酒は憂いの玉箒
“Wine maketh glad the heart of man.”

content:
たまみず〔玉水〕
〈名〉Raindrops

content.content: 軒の玉水
raindrops falling from the eaves
軒の玉水がポタポタ落ちる音を聴いて寝ておった
I lay listening to the drip-drop from the eaves.

content:
たまむし〔玉虫〕
〈名〉The golden beetle

content.content: 玉虫色
iridescence―(形容詞に用いれば)―iridescent

content:
たまもの〔賜物〕
〈名〉A present; a gift; a boon

content.content: 天の賜物
a gift from Heaven―a heavenly gift―a godsend
これは天の賜物だ
This is a godsend to me.
天の賜物を取らざればかえって咎めあり
“Take the good the gods provide. ”
有難い賜物
a welcome gift―an acceptable present―a boon
戦争は貧民にとっては有難い賜物であった
The war was a boon to the poor.
そんな発明ができたら実に人類への賜物だ
Such an invention would be a boon to mankind.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 肺病が治るようになったのは科学の賜物だ

It is all owing to science that people now recover from consumption―We owe the cure of consumption to science―The cure of consumption is due to science―Thanks to science, people now recover from consumption.
僕の今日あるのは彼の賜物だ
He has made me what I am―I owe him everything in life.
英国の今日あるのは石炭と鉄の賜物だ
Coal and iron have made England what she is―England owes her prosperity to her coal and iron―England's prosperity is due to her coal and iron.
日本の今日あるのは武士道の賜物なり
Bushido has made Japan what she is―Japan owes her present greatness to Bushido―Japan's present greatness is due to Bushido.

たまよけ〔玉除け〕
〈名〉A protection against bullets:(のお守り) a charm against bullets; a bullet-proof charm

content:
だまらせる〔黙らせる〕
〈他動〉To silence, gag, shut up (a person); to stop one's mouth

content.content: 彼らをにらめつけて黙らせた
I frowned them into silence―frowned them down.

content:
たまらない〔堪らない〕
〈自他動〉
1. (人を主格として主観的に言えば) I can not bear (it) ; I can not stand (it) ; I can not endure (it) ; I can not put up With (it) ; I can not resist (the desire) ; I can not afford (to do it) ; I can not hold out; I can not contain myself :(事を主格として客観的に言えば) to be unbearable, unendurable, insupportable, intolerable, insufferable; to be galling; to be irresistible; to be too much (for one)

content.content: 暑くて堪らない
I can't stand the heat―The heat is not to be borne―past bearing―unbearable―unendurable―intolerable―insupportable.
暑くて堪らないから飛び出した
The heat drove one out of the house.
(仕事が)苦しくて堪らない
I can not stand the strain―The strain is intolerable―The strain is insupportable―The strain is too much for me.
これじゃとても堪らない
I can't stand this―This is past endurance―past bearing―more than flash and blood can bear.
とても堪らない待遇だ
It is unbearable treatment―galling treatment.
もう堪らない
I can not hold out any longer.
痛くて堪らない
I can not endure the pain―The pain is unendurable―It is painful beyond endurance.
そんな待遇じゃ堪らないね
I could not put up with such terms.
そう金がかかっちゃ堪らない
I can not stand such expenses―can not afford such expenditure.
今頃死んじゃ堪らない
I can not afford to die at this time of day.
嬉しくて堪らなかった
I could not contain myself for joy.
腹が立って堪らない
I can not contain my anger.
おかしくて堪らなかった
I could not keep my gravity―I had much ado to keep my countenance.
心配で堪らない
I am oppressed with anxiety―tormented with anxiety―racked with anxiety.
やってみたくて堪らない
I can not resist the desire to try―I feel an irresistible impulse to try―I am mad to try.
彼は早く行きたくて堪らないのだ
He is impatient to be gone.
彼は彼女に会いたくて堪らないのだ
He is dying to see her.
水が飲みたくて堪らない
I am dying for a drink of water.
行きたくて矢も楯も堪らない
I feel an irresistible impulse to go.
彼はやってみたくて矢も楯も堪らない
He is seized with an irresistible impulse to try―He is mad to try―wild to try.
見せつけられちゃ堪らない
The sight is too much for me.
彼女はどこか堪らない愛嬌が有る
There is an irresistible charm about her.
彼は書きたくて堪らないのだ
He has an itch for writing―His fingers itch to write.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: どうもこれが本当のようで堪らない
I feel that it is true.
僕にできそうで堪らない
I feel within me―feel it in my bones―that I can do it.
この崖から落ちたのだから堪らない
He fell over this precipice, with what result it is unnecessary to say.
華厳の滝へ飛び込んだのだから堪らない
He plunged into the Kegon Falls―the result may be imagined.
この強い酒を一本飲んだのだから堪らない
He finished a bottle of brandy―with what result yon may imagine.
女の方は真剣だから堪らない
To make matters worse, the woman is in dead earnest.

content:
たまり〔溜り〕
〈名〉
1. (=控所) a waiting-room
2. (=一種の醤油) a kind of soy
3. (=階段の上の溜り) a landing

content.content: 主人が階段上の溜りで客を迎える
The host receives the guests at the landing.

content:
たまりかねる〔堪り兼ねる〕
〈自動〉To be unable to contain oneself; to be impatient; to get desperate; to be driven (to do something)

content.content: とうとう堪りかねて吹き出した
Unable to contain myself, I burst out laughing.
暑いのに堪りかねて家を飛び出した
The heat drove me out of the house.
彼は貧乏に堪りかねて自害した
Poverty drove him to suicide.
とうとう堪りかねて口を出した
I was too impatient not to interfere.
堪りかねてやけ酒を飲んだ
Getting desperate, I drowned my care in wine.

content:
だまりこむ〔黙り込む〕
〈自動〉To retire into oneself; to retire within oneself; to shrink into oneself

content.content: また黙り込んでしまった
He has relapsed into silence.

たまりみず〔溜り水〕
〈名〉Standing water; stagnant water; a pool of water; a puddle of water

content:
たまる〔堪る〕
〈他動〉Can bear; can stand; can endure

content.content: なにかはもって堪るべき、ズデンドウと打倒れた
Unable to stand the shock, he measured his length on the ground.

content:
たまる〔溜まる〕
〈自動〉To accumulate; to collect

content.content: 芥がたまる
Dust accumulates.
室の隅に埃がたまった
Dust has accumulated in the corners.
道具に塵がたまっている
Dust is thick on the furniture.
水がたまる
Water collects―Water stands―A pool forms―A puddle forms.
道路に処々水がたまっている
There are puddles on the road.
雨が降ると低い処に水がたまる
When it rains, pools form in hollow places.
水排けが悪いから水がたまる
Water stands owing to bad drainage.
この病は腹に水がたまるのだ
This disease is due to the collection of water in the abdomen.
金がたまる
Money accumulates―Wealth accumulates―(を通例)―to save money―grow rich.
だいぶたまったろう
You must have saved much―You must be pretty rich.
金はなかなかたまらないものだ
It is hard to grow rich.
ためた金はいけない、たまった金でなくちゃいけない
Money saved is not so good as money accumulated.
金持ちと灰吹きはたまればたまるほど汚い
“Muck and money go together.”
借金がたまる
Debts accumulate―Debts run up―Debts stand over.
借金がだいぶたまった
I have run up many debts.
勘定がたまる
Accounts run up―Bills run up.
方々の勘定がたまった
I have run up bills at various houses.
呉服屋の払いがだいぶたまっている
I have run up a long bill at the draper's.
家賃がたまっている
The house-rent is in arrears.
たまっている家賃を払わなければならぬ
I must pay the arrears on rent.
仕事がたまる
Work accumulates―Work stands over.
仕事がたくさんたまっている
I have much work on my hands.
一週間遊んだら仕事がうんとたまった
A week's holiday has accumulated a lot of work.
仕事がこうたまってはやりきれない
I find it hard to dispose of such an accumulation of work.

content:
だまる〔黙る〕
〈自動〉To be silent; to hold one's peace; to hold one's tongue; to contain oneself

content.content: 黙れ
Silence!―Hold your tongue!―Hold your noise!―Hold your jaw!―Stop your jaw!―Stop your gab!―Shut up!―Dry up!
(泣く子に向かって)お黙り
Stop crying!
皆黙っている
They keep silent―observe silence―hold their peace.
(このことをしゃべってはいかんぞ)黙っておれよ
Keep silent about it!―Keep dark about it!―Keep mum about it!―Mum's the word!
あのことは(誰にも言わずに)黙っておった
I have kept silent about the matter―kept dark about the matter―kept the matter to myself.
彼はまた黙ってしまった
He has relapsed into silence.
こんなことをされて黙っておれぬ
I can not pass over such conduct in silence.
そんなことをされて黙って引込む奴があるか
Who ever heard of a man passing over such conduct in silence?
嬉しくて黙っていられぬ
I can not contain myself for joy―I am too glad to contain myself.
黙って見ておれ
Look on in silence!
僕が黙っているのをよいことにして勝手なことを言う
They take advantage of my silence to say what they like of me.
君は黙っていると人に誤解されるぞ
Your silence will place your conduct in an unfavourable light.
数ならぬ身とはいえこの場合黙っていられぬ
Humble as I am, I can not remain silent―I must make myself heard.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 君が虐待されるのを僕は黙って見ていられぬ
I can not allow you to be ill-treated.
僕は虐待されて黙っていられぬ
I will not suffer myself to be ill-treated.
権利を蹂躪されて黙っていられぬ
I can not suffer my rights to be infringed upon.
俺はばかにされて黙っているような人間じゃないぞ
He shall know that I am not to be trifled with.
彼は侮辱されて黙っているような意気地無しだ
He has no spirit to resent an insult.
人の家から黙って帰る
to take French leave
黙って行くとはひどい
It is ill-mannered of him to leave without notice.
この手紙を黙って置いて行きました
He left this note without saying anything.
痛くとも黙って我慢しろ
Grin and bear it!
その名を聞けば泣く子も黙る
The nurse stills her child with the terrors of his name.
黙り込んでしまった
He has retired within himself―shrunk into himself.

content:
たまるものか〔堪るものか〕
〈疑問動詞〉How can...?; How can I...?; How can I stand...?; How can I afford to...?; I am damned if...; I am blest if...

content.content: そんなことがあって堪るものか
How can such things be?―I'm damned if such things be.
昭和の聖世に幽霊などあって堪るものか
How can there be a ghost in this enlightened age?
今頃死んで堪るものか
How can I afford to die at this time of day?
あんな奴の世話になって堪るものか
How can I ask a favour of such a man?―I'm damned if I do such a thing.
そんなことをして堪るものか
How can I do such a thing?―I'm damned if I do―I'm blest if I do.
けがなどして堪るものか
I can't afford to get hurt.
そんな乱暴をされて堪るものか
How can I stand such outrages?

content:
たみ〔民〕
〈名〉The people:(一国民の意味なら) a people

content.content: 民を治める
to govern the people―rule over the people
民の骨血を絞る
to grind down the people
自由の民
a free people―sons of liberty
土着の民
children of the soil

たみぐさ〔民草〕
〈名〉The people; the populace

だみごえ〔濁声〕
〈名〉A thick voice

content:
たむけもの〔手向け物〕
〈名〉An offering; a tribute

content.content: 君の成功は亡きお父様への善い手向け物だ
Your success is a good offering to the spirit of your father.
讃辞を呈して亡き人の手向け物にしよう
I will pay my tribute of praise to the departed.

content:
たむける〔手向ける〕
〈他動〉To offer (flowers to the spirit of the deceased); to pay one's tribute (of praise, etc.)

content.content: 香華を手向ける
to burn incense and offer flowers to one's spirit
讃辞をもって亡き人に手向けん
I will pay my tribute of praise to the departed.
一滴の涙を手向けざるを得なかった
I could not withhold the tribute of a tear.
些細ながらこの成功は亡父の霊に手向けてこれを慰めん
My success, such as it is, shall be a tribute to my father's memory.

content:
たむし〔田虫〕
〈名〉The ringworm

content.content: 頸に田虫ができた
I have a ringworm on the neck.

だむだむだん〔ダムダム弾〕
〈名〉A dumdum bullet

content:
たむろ〔屯〕
〈名〉
1. (=集合、集合所) a rendezvous
2. (=警察の屯所) a police-station:(軍隊の屯所) a military station; a cantonment:(=する) to be cantoned; to be stationed; to be quartered

content.content: インドの地方に英兵が屯している
British troops are cantoned all over India.

content:
ため〔為〕
〈名〉(=利益) good; benefit; advantage; interest; welfare

content.content: 身の為になる
to do one good―benefit one―be beneficial to one―make for one's interests―conduce to one's welfare―(教訓などなら)―to be instructive―edifying―improving―salutary
この本は為になる
The book will do you good―It is an instructive book.
この本を読んで為になった
This book has done me good―I am the better for reading this book.
この学校へ入って非常に為になった
The school has done me a world of good―I am very much the better for attending this school.
為になる事を聞いた
I have heard something to my advantage―to my edification.
そう言う方が君の為になる
It will make for your interests to say so.
黙っている方が君の為だ
It is (to) your interest to remain silent.
本当の事を言う方が君の為だ
It is (to) your interest to speak the truth.
勉強するのが身の為になる
Industry will conduce to your welfare.
そのような事業は学校の為になる
Such undertakings will conduce to the prosperity of the school.
また国家の為になる
They will also conduce to the welfare of the country―They are also salutary to the State.
運動は身体の為になる
Exercise will do you good―Exercise is good for the health―beneficial to health.
学生の為になる演説だ
Such speeches are edifying to the student.
為になる説教
an edifying sermon
為になる話
an instructive story
これは面白くて為になる本だ
This is an interesting and instructive book.
為になる学問
an improving study
為になる改革
a salutary reform
為になる人と交われ
Associate with such men as will do you good.
あのような人と交わっては為にならぬ
Such men will do you no good.
為にならぬ
to do one no good―do one harm―be harmful to one―be injurious to one―make against one's interests
酒は身体の為にならぬ
Wine will do you harm―Wine is bad for the health―injurious to health.
わからない本を読んでも為にならぬ
It will do you no good to read books you do not understand.
偽りを言っては為にならぬぞ
It will make against your interests to tell a falsehood.
そんな議論は君の為にならぬ、かえって害になる
Such arguments do not make for, but against, your interests.
そんなことをしては為にならぬぞ
You are acting against your interests.
そんなことをしては為にはならぬかえって害になる
You are not acting for, but against, your interests.
身の為を図る
to consult one's interests―look to one's interests―have an eye to the main chance
彼は自分の為ばかり図っている
He always consults his own interests―He always takes care of No.1.
後世の為を図る
to consult the welfare of one's successors―look to the interests of posterity
国家の為を図る
to look to the interests of the State―consult the interests of the State―labour for one's country's good
国の為を思う
to have the interests of the country at heart
僕は君の為を思うのだ
I have your interests at heart.
君の為を思ってこう言うのだ
I say this for your good―out of kindness.
彼は為にするところがあるのだ
He has some end in view―some ulterior aims―“an axe to grind. ”
為にするところがあってしたことだ
It was done to gain some private ends.
彼は為にするところがあってあんなことを言うのだ
He is an interested adviser.
お為ごかし
cheating one under colour of kindness
彼は僕をお為ごかしにしようとした
He tried to cheat me under the mask of friendship.

content:
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=に) ［利益］ For; for the benefit of; for the good of; for the sake of; in the cause of; in the service of; in the interests of; in behalf of; in favour of; in honour of

content.content: 国家のために生命を捨てる
to lay down one's life for one's country
君のためなら何でもする
I will do anything for you―for your sake.
君は誰のために勉強するか、皆自分のためじゃないか
For whom do you work? Is it not all for yourself?―for your own sake?
公益のために働く
to labour for the public good
慈善のために働く
to labour in the cause of charity
正義のために働く
to labour in the cause of justice
正義のために私情を捨てる
to sacrifice one's personal feelings to justice
主義のために奮闘する
to fight for one's principles
Lincoln は主義のために斃れた
Lincoln died a martyr to his cause.
彼は学術のために働いた人だ
He has laboured for the benefit of science―in the cause of science―in the service of science―in the interests of science.
人道のために尽す
to labour in the cause of humanity―serve the cause of humanity
彼は終生教育のために尽した
He devoted his life to the cause of education.
王事のために奔走する
to interest oneself in the cause of royalty
彼は社のために働いてくれた人だ
He has laboured in the service of the firm―in the interests of the firm.
彼は学校のために尽力してくれた
He has exerted himself in behalf of the school.
君のために尽力しよう
I will exert myself in your behalf.
彼は弟のために家督を辞した
He resigned his heirship in favour of his younger brother.
この証拠は被告のために利益で原告のために不利益だ
The evidence is in favour of the defendant and against the plaintiff.
君のために利益になることを言おう
I will say something in your favour.
彼のために不利益なことは何も知りません
I know nothing against him.
田中君のために送別会を開く
We give a farewell dinner in honour of Mr. Tanaka.
この宴会は君のために開くのだ
The banquet is held in your honour―on your account.

content: 2. ［目的］ For; for the purpose of; for the sake of; for the good of; for the benefit of; with the object of; with the intention of; with the idea of; with the view of; with a view to; with an eye to; by way of:(不定法が続けば) in order (to do something) :(接続詞に用いれば) in order that, to the end that, so that, that (...may...) :(何々をせざらんために) lest, for fear (...should...)

content.content: 君は何のために上京したのか
What have you come to town for?―(他動詞構文にすれば)―What has brought you to town?
英語研究のために上京した

I have come to town for the purpose of studying English―with the object of studying English―with the intention of studying English―with the idea of studying English―with the view of studying English―in order to study English.
人は金のために働く
Men work for money.
糊口のために働く
to work for one's living
地球は人間のためにできたものだ
The earth was made for man.
この本は学生のために書いた本だ
This book was written for students.
彼は保養のために旅行している
He is travelling for the benefit of his health―for the good of his health.
彼は泰西の文物を視察するために欧米を漫遊した
He travelled in Europe and America with the view of―with a view to―observing things Western.
彼は特待生になるために勉強している
He is working hard with a view to gaining scholarship―with an eye to scholarship.
我々は学ぶために学校へ行く
We go to school (in order) to learn.
立派な人になるために学ぶ
We learn (in order) that we may become wise and good.
彼は洋行するつもりでそのために金をためている
He intends to go abroad, and is saving money for the purpose―to that end.
彼は我々を戒めるためにああ言うのだ
He says so by way of warning―(in order) to warn us―His words are meant for our warning―intended for our warning.
ナイフは切るためのもので口に入れるものではない
A knife is intended to cut with,―meant to cut with,―and not to eat with.
労を省くためにこの方法を用いる
This method is employed (in order) to save trouble.
試験のために彼を使ってみている
I employ him by way of experiment.
彼は家族に楽させるために働くのだ
He works hard (in order) that his family may live in comfort.
人は食うために生きるか生きるために食うか
Does man live to eat or eat to live?―live that he may eat or eat that he may live?
便宜のために文法と言う
It is called grammar for convenience' sake.→『ねんのため〔念の為〕』
この表題を見て誤解を生ぜらんためにここにその意味を説明せん
Lest the title should mislead the reader, I shall undertake here to explain its meaning.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼は職を求めるために上京したのだ
He has come to town in quest of employment.
迷子を捜すために手分けをした
We formed parties to go in search of the lost child.
彼は修業のために洋行した
He went abroad in pursuit of knowledge.
祝意を表するため学校を休業した
The school was closed in honour of the occasion.
謝意を表さんために礼を出した
I offered him a present in token of my gratitude.
僕の言うことを証拠立てんために二三の事実を挙げた
I adduced some facts in proof of my statement.

content: 3. ［理由、原因、結果］For; from; of; through; by; because of; on account of; on the ground of; in consequence of; owing to; thanks to:(形容詞に用いれば) due to; consequent on:(接続詞に用いれば)［理由、原因］ because, for, as, since, owing to the fact that, in view of the fact that;［結果］ so that, the consequence is that

content.content: 命に背いたために罰せられた
I was punished for disobeying orders.
彼は人命を絶ったために賞せられた
He was rewarded for saving a man's life.
職務怠慢のために譴責された
He was reprimanded for neglect of duty.
主義のために迫害を受ける
to be prosecuted for one's faith
彼は勉強が過ぎたために身体をこわした
He made himself ill by overworking himself.
悪い水を飲んだために下痢にかかった
I was attacked with diarrhoea from drinking bad water.
彼は酒を飲み過ぎたために死んだ
He died from drinking too much―He killed himself by overdrinking himself―He drank himself to death.
君の病気は飲み過ぎるためだ
Your illness comes of drinking too, much.
こんなことになったのは君の不注意のためだ
This has happened through your carelessness.
この椿事の起こったのは従業員の怠慢のためだ
The accident has happened, through the negligence of the operatives.
彼は職務怠慢のために免職になった
He has lost his place through neglect of duty.
こうなったのは僕に過失があったためではない
This has happened through no fault of mine.
僕は病気したために一年後れた
I played away a year on account of illness.
彼は病気のために辞職した
He resigned his post on the ground of ill health.
私のためにおかまい下さるな
Do not put yourself out of the way on my account!
君のために失敗した
I have failed on your account―I must thank you for my failure―I own you my failure.
君のために損をした
I have suffered a loss on your account―You have caused me a loss.
君のために迷惑した
I have got into trouble on your account―You have got me into trouble.
君のために心配した
You have caused me anxiety.
戦争のために物価が騰貴した
The prices rose owing to the war―in consequence of the war.
物価騰貴は戦争のためだ
The rise in prices is due to the war―consequent on the war―The war is responsible for the rise in prices.
潮の差し引きは月の引力のためだ
The ebb and flow of the tides is due to the gravitation of the moon.
肺病の治るようになったのは科学のためだ
It is all owing to science that people now recover from consumption―Thanks to science, people now recover from consumption.
彼は不勉強のために落第した
Owing to his idleness, he has failed in his examination―He has failed in his examination in consequence of his idleness.
(何か)無いために、欠乏のために
(理由なら)for want of―for lack of―(原因なら)―from want of―from lack of―something
金が無いために洋行を断念した
I gave up the idea of going abroad for want of means.
降雨欠乏のため百姓が難渋している
The crops are suffering from want of rain.
資本欠乏のため事業を中止した
The enterprise was abandoned for lack of funds.
この地位は適任者の無いために明けてある
The post is left vacant from lack of a fit person.
世間では彼の失敗は無能のためだと言っている
People attribute his failure to his incompetence.
彼が黙っているのは謙遜しているためだと思った
I attributed his silence to diffidence.
ために人死があった
So that lives were lost―There was loss of life in consequence.
ために出発が後れた
The consequence was that my departure was delayed.

content: 4. ［作因］ By

content.content: 彼は敵のために亡ぼされた
He was overthrown by his enemy.

content:
だめ〔駄目〕
〈形〉
1. (=無益)vain; useless; no use; no good

content.content: 駄目だから止せ
It is no use trying―It is no good trying―There is no use in trying―There is no good in trying.
言い訳しても駄目だ
It is no use trying to excuse yourself.
あの人は勧めても駄目だから止せ
It is no use trying to persuade that man―You might as well reason with the wolf as try to persuade that man.
あの男は忠告しても駄目だ
It is no use advising him―All advice is lost upon him―He will give no heed to advice or warning.
こんな物は駄目だ
This is no good.
こんなことじゃ駄目だ
This won't do―This will never do.
そんなことじゃ駄目だ
That won't do―That will never do―That cock won't fight.
今度の先生は駄目だ
The new man is no good.
英語を教えさせちゃ駄目だ、から駄目だ
As a teacher of English, he is a failure―an utter failure.
医者を呼んでももう駄目だ
It will do no good to send for the doctor.
やってみたって駄目じゃないか
What is the use of trying?―Where is the good of trying?
こんなものを覚えたって駄目じゃないか
What is the use of learning such things?
彼に勧めても駄目だった
I tried to persuade him, but in vain―to no purpose―without success.
今度の先生は存外駄目だ
The new man has fallen short of our expectations―He does not come up to our expectations.
(新著述を)こんなものは駄目だと罵倒する
to condemn a new work
駄目になる
to fail―come to naught
せっかくの試みが駄目になった
The attempt has ended in a failure.
せっかくの骨折りが駄目になった
All my efforts have come to naught.
駄目にする
to spoil―waste―ruin―anything
紙を一帖駄目にした
I have wasted a quire of paper.
せっかくのご馳走を駄目にした
I have spoiled the precious dinner.

content: 4. (=不可能)impossible

content.content: とうてい駄目だ
It is quite impossible―a sheer impossibility―It is no go.
駄目だと諦めた
I have given up the attempt in despair―given it up as a bad job.
駄目だと諦めろ
Give it up!―You had better go whistle.
病人はもう駄目だ
It is all over with the invalid―It is all up with the invalid―He is a gone case.
どこへ行ったとて辛抱が無くちゃ駄目だ
Wherever you may go, you can't get on without perseverance.
駄目を押す
to tell one twice
だから間違いの無いように駄目を押したんだ
That is why I told you two several times, that there might be no mistake.

content: 〈助動詞相当〉Must (not)

content.content: 君が行ってしまっちゃ駄目よ
You must not go.
暫く待たなくちゃ駄目よ
We must wait a while.
そんなことをしちゃ駄目じゃないか
You must not do such a thing.

content:
ためいき〔溜息〕
〈名〉A sigh

content.content: ため息を吐く
to sigh―heave a sigh―fetch a sigh
彼は深いため息を吐いた
He heaved a deep sigh―sighed a deep sigh.
安心してホッとため息を吐いた
I gave a sigh of relief.
(高い値段を聞き)彼はため息を吐いて品物を置いた
He put down the article with a sigh.

content:
ためこむ〔溜め込む〕
〈他動〉To save up; to amass

content.content: だいぶ溜め込んだらしい
He seems to have amassed a lot.

content:
ためし〔試し〕
〈名〉A trial; an attempt; a test; an experiment

content.content: ものは試しだ
There is nothing like trying.
ものは試しだ、一つやってご覧
Try!―Make a trial!
一つお試しの上ごひいきを願います
You will give us your custom on trial.
試しに
for trial―(人なら)―on trial―(何にても)―by way of experiment
試しにやってみよう
I will do it for trial―I will make a trial―I will have a try at it.
試しに少し買ってみよう
I will buy some for trial―by way of experiment.
試しに彼を使ってみよう
I will employ him by way of experiment―take him on trial―give him a trial―give him a chance.
試しに一つやってご覧
Just try!
試しに一つ召上がってご覧なさい
Just try it!
試しに一つ着て(かぶって、はいて)ご覧なさい
Just try it on!
運試し
trial of one's luck
運試しをして見よう
I will try my luck―try my fortune.
度胸試し
a test of courage
度胸試しをしてやったのさ
I put his courage to the test.
日本の海軍は実戦の試しに逢った
The Japanese navy has been put to the test of actual warfare.
そして実戦の試しに堪えた(及第した)
And it has stood the test (of actual warfare).
海戦の試し玉
a sighting shot

content:
ためし〔例し〕
〈名〉An example; an instance; a precedent

content.content: 彼は嘘をついた例しが無い
I never knew him tell a lie―He was never known to tell a lie.
彼はずいぶんばかなことをした例しがある
I have known him do some foolish things―He has been known to do some foolish things.
あの人が癇癪を起こした例しがある
I have known him in a passion.
しかしあんなに怒った例しが無い
But I never knew him in such a passion.
あの人は成功した例しが無い
I never knew him succeed―I never knew him successful.
この銃の不発は試しの無いことだ
I never knew this gun miss fire.
あの人は赤面した例しが無い
I never saw him blush―He was never seen to blush.
あの人は英語を話した例しが無い
I never heard him speak English―He was never heard to speak English.
飽きっぽい者が物の役に立った例し無し
A man who can stick to nothing was never known to be good for anything.
裸で落とした例しが無い
One who carries nothing was never―known to lose anything.
死ぬ死ぬと言う者に死んだ例し無し
One who constantly talks of dying was never known to die.
船酔いで死んだ例しが無い
People were never known to die of seasickness.
これは例しの無いことだ
I never knew it happen before―It was never known to happen before―It is an unprecedented affair.
これをしようとして人が死んだ例しがある
Men have died in the attempt.

content:
ためしぎり〔試し斬り〕
〈名〉Testing a new sword

content.content: 試し斬りをする
to try a sword on a man―flesh a sword
昔は新剣が手に入ると試し斬りをしたものだ
When a man bought a new sword, he used to try it on people.

content:
ためす〔試す〕
〈他動〉To try (anything) ; to make a trial of (anything) ; to give (anything) a trial; to attempt (a task) ; to test (gold) ; to put (one's courage) to the test; to put (one's character) to the touch; to put (a matter) to the proof; to experiment, make an experiment (on anything) ; to essay (a person or thing) ; to prove (the calculation) ; to sample (goods)

content.content: (自分の)力を試す
to try one's strength
人の力を試す
to make a trial of one's strength
(自分の)腕を試す
to try one's hand (at anything)
人の腕前を試す
to put one's ability to the test
運を試す
to try one's luck―try one's fortune
武運を試す
to try the fortune of war
大砲を試す
to test a gun―prove a gun
黄金を試すには硝酸を用いる
Nitric acid is used for testing gold.
彼の度胸を試してやったのさ
I put his courage to the test.
彼に金を貸せと言ったのは心を試してみたのだ
I asked him for a loan to put his friendship to the test.
女の心を試す
to put a woman's fidelity to the touch
しからば事の真偽を試さん
Then let us put the matter to the proof!
日本の海軍は実戦で試された
The Japanese navy has been put to the test of actual warfare.
試されて及第した
It has stood the test.
私を使って試してみて下さい
Give me a trial!―Give me a chance!
この薬を試してご覧
Try this medicine!
あの医者は患者にいろいろの薬を飲ませて試す
That doctor experiments on his patients.
刀の切れ味を試す
to see how a sword will cut―try a sword on a man―flesh a sword

content:
ためつすがめつ〔矯めつ眇めつ〕
〈副〉With scrutinizing eyes

content.content: ためつすがめつ人の顔を見る
to scrutinize one's face―scan one's face

content:
ためなみだ〔溜め涙〕
〈名〉Long-stored tears; pent-up tears

content.content: 溜め涙をこぼす
to burst into a flood of tears

ためらう
〈自動〉To hesitate; to vacillate

content:
ためる〔矯める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=曲ったものを真直にする) to make straight; to straighten

content.content: 矢を矯める
to straighten an arrow
角を矯めて牛を殺す
“The remedy is worse than the evil. ”

content: 2. (=まっすぐなものを曲げる) to bend

content.content: 弓を矯める
to bend a bow into shape
枝を矯める
to train a tree
矯めるなら若木のうち
“As the twig is bent, the tree is inclined.”
矯めやすい木
a pliant tree―a pliable tree
法を矯める
to pervert the law―strain the law―stretch the law

content: 3. (=矯正する) to cure (one of a habit) ; to correct (a fault) ; to reform (a malpractice) ; to remedy (an evil) ; to redress (an abuse) ; to put down (an evil, etc.)

content.content: 悪弊を矯める
to suppress abuses―put down evils
悪風を矯める
to reform evil practices
この悪い癖を矯めなければならぬ
I must cure myself of this bad habit―break myself of this bad habit.

content:
ためる〔溜める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=貯蓄する) to save; to lay by; to lay up; to put by; to put aside; to set by; to hoard; to amass; to accumulate

content.content: 金をためる
to save money―hoard money―lay by money―lay up money―amass wealth―accumulate wealth
彼はだいぶためている
He has amassed great treasures.
食うものも食わずに金をためるほど愚かなことは無い
Nothing can exceed the folly of saving money by denying oneself the comforts of life.
ためた金はいけない、たまった金でなくちゃいけない
It is not money saved, but money accumulated, that does any good.
金ため主義
money-grubbing
あの男は金ため主義だ
He is a money-grubber.

content: 2. (=貯蔵する) to store

content.content: 水溜に水を溜めて澄ますのだ
The water is stored in the reservoir to clear it from impurities.

content: 3. (=蓄積する) to amass; to accumulate

content.content: 材料をためる
to accumulate materials

content: 4. (=だんだん集める) to collect

content.content: だいぶ材料をためている
He has collected a mass of materials.
古銭をためる
to collect old coins

content: 5. (=滞らす) to leave (anything) undone

content.content: 仕事をためる
to leave work undone―have work accumulate
だいぶ仕事をためた
I have much work on my hands―I have much work to dispose of.
勘定をためる
to leave bills unpaid―run up bills
方々の勘定をためた
I have run up bills at various houses.
だいぶ洋服屋の払いをためた
I have run up a long bill at the tailor's.

content:
ためん〔他面〕
〈名〉The other side

content.content: 他面を見るとますますその必要を感ずる
If we look on the other side, we shall feel the necessity more and more.

ためんたい〔多面体〕
〈名〉A polyhedron

content:
たも〔手網〕
〈名〉A hand-net; a landing-net; a scoop-net; a spoon-net

content.content: (釣り上げた魚を)手網で掬う
to scoop a fish with a hand-net

content:
たもう〔賜う、給う〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: たまう〔賜う〕
たまう〔給う〕

content:
たもう〔賜う、給う〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: たまう〔賜う〕
たまう〔給う〕

content:
たもつ〔保つ〕
〈他動〉(=失わずに保持する) to keep (the balance); to keep up (one's credit); to hold (a position); to maintain (one's position); to preserve (one's health); to retain (one's youth); to sustain (a character); to support (a part, etc.)

content.content: 秩序を保つ
to keep order―maintain order―preserve order
健康を保つ
to preserve one's health―keep oneself well
生命を保つ
to preserve one's life―keep oneself alive
地位を保つ
to maintain one's position―hold one's post―sustain one's office
彼は今の地位が保てればどんな職にも堪える
If he can maintain his present position, he will be equal to any office.
信用を保つ
to maintain one's credit―keep up one's credit
あの先生は生徒の信用が保てない
He can not keep his ground with his students―He is losing ground with his students.
元気を保つ
to keep up one's spirits
威厳を保つ
to maintain one's dignity
人は地位に相当の威厳を保たねばならぬ
One must maintain a dignity due to one's social position.
平均を保つ、権衡を保つ
to keep the balance―maintain the equilibrium
二者は平均を保っている
The two balance―The two are in equilibrium.
平均を保たせる
to keep two forces in equilibrium―keep two weights in equipoise―counterbalance the excess―counterpoise the excess
平和を保つ
to maintain peace―preserve peace
安寧を保つ
to maintain the public peace―preserve the public peace
安寧秩序を保つ
to maintain peace and order―preserve law and order
敵と接触を保つ
to keep in touch with the enemy
陣地を保つ
to hold a position
株を(落とさないように)保たなければならぬ
I must sustain my character―support my character―I have a character to sustain―a character to support.
若さを保っている
He retains his youth―She is well conserved.
彼は店を保ちかねている
He can not keep up his business―keep his business going.

content: 〈自動〉(=持つ、持ち堪える) to last; to hold; to hold out; to stand out; to endure; to be durable:(食物なら) to keep (long):(着物なら) to wear (well)

content.content: 石造の家は長く保つ
A stone house lasts long―A stone house is durable.
この家はもう十年保つ
This house will last another ten years.
病人は長くは保つまい
The invalid will not last long―He has not long to live.
この夏中保つまい
He will not last through the summer―hold out through the summer―live out the summer.
あの会社はもう保たぬ
That firm can hold out―stand out―any longer.
油は今夜中保つか
Will the oil last through the night?―hold through the night?
薪は冬期中保つか
Will the fuel last through the winter?―hold through the winter?
これだけ石炭があれば航海中保つだろう
The coal will last through the voyage―hold through the voyage.
夏の魚は保たぬ
Fish do not keep in summer.
木で熱した蜜柑は長く保たぬ
Oranges ripened on the tree do not keep long.
この魚は明日まで保つか
Will this fish keep till tomorrow?―keep overnight?
この梨は春まで保つか
Will these pears keep over the winter?
この羅紗はよく保つ
This cloth wears well―There is much wear in this stuff.
この洋服は長く保つだろう
This coat will wear well.
この洋服は三年保った
This coat has lasted me three years.
あのような先生は長く保たぬ
Such teachers do not wear well.
この天気が保てばよいが
I wish this weather would hold.
この風が保てばじきに行き着く
If the breeze holds, we shall soon be there.
この釘は保たぬ
This nail will not hold.
この縄は保つか
Will this rope hold?
あの木は柱でやっと保っている
The tree is barely kept standing by a support.

content:
たもと〔袂〕
〈名〉
1. The sleeve; the sleeve-pocket

content.content: 袂に入れる
to put anything in one's pocket
袂を反す
to turn one's pocket inside out
袂を別つ
to part from one
西と東に袂を別った
We parted right and left.
惜しき袂を別った
to tear oneself from a companion
袂を振り放した
I tore myself away from him.
袂をつらねて辞職する
to resign in a body
橋の袂
the approach to a bridge
あの橋の袂に交番がある
There is a police-box at the approach to the bridge.
山の袂
the foot of a hill

content:
たやす〔絶やす〕
〈他動〉To suppress; to exterminate; to eradicate; to extirpate; to root out; to put down; to let (anything) die out; to allow (anything) to run out

content.content: 禍の根を絶やす
to eradicate an evil―extirpate an evil―suppress an abuse―put down an abuse―root out an evil
鼠を絶やすにはどうすれば一番に好いか
What is the best way to exterminate vermin?―rid a house of vermin?
アイヌ人を絶やさないようにしたいものだ
We must not let the Ainos die out.
種を絶やさないようにせよ
Do not let the seed run out!
手前どもでは酒を絶やしません
We never run out of wine―We are never out of wine.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 望みを絶やす
to blight one's hopes―blast one's hopes―dash one's hopes―extinguish one's hopes
火種を絶やしてしまった
The fire has gone out.
火を絶やすな
Keep the fire alive!
話を絶やさぬようにせよ
Keep up the ball!―Keep the ball rolling!

content:
たやすい〔容易い〕
〈形〉Easy; simple; light

content.content: こんなたやすいことは無い
Nothing is easier―Nothing can be simpler.
どんな困難なことでも慣れるとたやすくなる
The hardest things are made easy by force of habit.
君のするのを見るとたやすそうだ
To see you do it, one would think it easy.
(何をしたとて)たやすい仕事はあるものじゃない
It is hard to find an easy task―a light task―a soft job.

content:
たやすく〔容易く〕
〈副〉Easily; with ease; readily; with facility; without difficulty; without trouble

content.content: 彼はたやすく成功した
He succeeded with ease―without any difficulty―without the least trouble―with scarcely any trouble―He achieved an easy success.
彼はいつもに似ずたやすく承知した
He readily consented, which is not his custom.
彼は英語を話すのも書くのも等しくたやすい
He speaks and writes English with equal facility.
芸はたやすく覚わるものでない
An art is not learned in a day.

たゆう〔大夫〕
〈名〉
1. ［官職］ A lord steward
2. (=芸人) a performer
3. (=高等の遊女) a high-class prostitute

content:
たゆむ〔撓む〕
〈自動〉To flag; to slacken one's efforts; to remit one's efforts; to relax one's attention

content.content: たゆまぬ熱心
unflagging zeal―unremitting zeal
惓まずたゆまず勉強した
He worked with unremitting efforts―with untiring zeal―with indefatigable attention―with dogged perseverance.

たよう〔多用〕
〈形〉(To be) busy, pressed with business

たようひこうき〔多葉飛行機〕
〈名〉A multiplane

たよく〔多慾〕
〈名〉Avarice; cupidity; greed:(=な) avaricious; covetous; greedy

content:
たより〔便り〕
〈名〉News; tidings; intelligence; communication; a letter:(=する) to write a letter to (one); to write to (one); to communicate with (one)

content.content: 便りを聞く
to have a letter from one―hear from one
お国からお便りが有りましたか
Have you heard from home?
彼からは久しく便りが無い
He has not written to me―I have not heard from him―for a long while.
なぜ時々便りをしないか
Why don't you write (to me) sometimes?―Why don't you let me hear from you sometimes?
時々便りをしてくれ給え
Write and let me Know―Let me hear from you―from time to time!
幾日たっても便りが無い
Days passed without a line from him.
風の便りに聞いた
A little bird whispered to me.
音楽が風の便りに聞こえる
The music comes floating on the wind―The music is heard on the breeze.
花の香が風の便りに匂う
The fragrance of flowers comes floating on the wind―comes wafted by the breeze.
花の便り
the first tidings of the blossoms
便りの無いのは好い便り
“No news is good news.”

content:
たより〔頼り〕
〈名〉Reliance; dependence; trust; help; assistance; resort; resource; staff; stay; prop

content.content: あの人は頼りになる
He is to be depended upon―to be relied upon―reliable―trustworthy.
頼りにならぬ
He is not to be depended upon―not to be relied upon―unreliable―untrustworthy.
人は頼りにならぬものだ
Men are not to be relied upon.
あのような人はまさかの時に頼りにならぬ
Such men will fail you in time of need.
あの人はまさかの時に頼りになる
He will not fail you in time of need―He will never fail you.
人を頼りにする
to rely on one―depend on one―lean on one―trust to one's honesty―look to one for assistance
人を頼りにするな
Do not depend on others!―Rely on yourself!
彼は息子を頼りにしている
He leans on his son.
杖を頼りにして歩く
He leans on his staff.
彼は弁舌を頼りにして生活している
He trusts to his eloquence as a means of living.
僕は君を頼りにしている
He look to you for assistance.
たった一人の知人を頼りに上京した
I came to town, looking to an only acquaintance for assistance.
頼りならぬものを頼りにする(痩せ腕を頼りにする)
to trust to a broken reed―lean on a broken reed
仮名を頼りに新聞を読む
to read a newspaper by the help of the kana
頼りにするもの
one's resort―one's resource
英国の頼りとするものは海軍のみ
The navy is England's only resort―only resource.
頼りにする人
one's strength―one's hope―one's staff―one's prop and stay
彼は一人息子を杖とも柱とも頼りとしている
His only son is his only prop and stay.
息子は老後の頼りになる
A son is the staff of one's declining years.
われらの頼りとするものは神のみ
God is our only strength―our only hope.→『たよりなき〔頼り無き〕』
頼り渚の捨て小舟
(頼る人が無いの意味なら) I am thrown upon the world―(取りつく島も無いの意味なら)―I am thrown upon my own resources―(路頭に迷うの意味なら)―I am turned adrift

content:
たよりなき〔頼り無き〕
〈形〉Forlorn; forsaken

content.content: 頼りの無き身の上です
I am without kith or kin―(寡婦なら)―I am a forlorn widow―(孤児なら)―He is a helpless orphan.
なんという頼り無い返事だろう
What a vague answer―what an indefinite answer―it is!

content:
たよる〔頼る〕
〈他動〉To rely on (one); to depend on (one); to lean on (one); to trust to (one's honesty); to resort to (some means); to have recourse to (some means); to look to (one) for assistance

content.content: 君は人に頼り過ぎる
You depend too much on others.
人に頼るものでない
You should not depend on others―You should rely on yourself.
彼は息子に頼っている
He leans on his son.
(彼は両親に死に別れて)頼る人が無い
He has no one to depend upon―He is thrown upon the world.
君を頼ってきた
I look to you for assistance.
君を借いて頼る人は無い
I have no one but you to look to for assistance―You are the only friend to whom I can look for assistance.
たった一人の知人を頼って上京した
I came to town, looking to an only friend for assistance.
頼りし人は東京を去りしと聞く悲しさ
I found, to my disappointment, that the man to whom I looked for assistance had left Tokyo.
便りにならぬものに頼る(痩腕に頼る)
to trust to a broken reed―lean on a broken reed
頼るもの
one's resort―one's resource―one's strength―one's hope―one's staff―one's prop and stay
英国の頼るところは海軍のみ
The navy is England's only resort―only resource.
彼は杖とも柱とも頼る息子に死なれた
He lost a son who was his only prop and stay.
一家の柱と頼る人が死んだ
The main prop and stay of the family is dead.
我らの頼るものは神よりほかに無い
God is our only strength―our only hope.
老後に頼るものは息子よりほかに無い
A son is the only staff of one's declining years.
何の頼るべき証拠も無い
There is no reliable proof―no trustworthy evidence.

content:
たら
〈接続詞〉If; when

content.content: 来たら知らせる
If he comes, I will let you know.
明いたら返してくれ
Return it me when you have done with it.
問い合わせてみたら嘘だった
On enquiry, the report proved false.

content: 〈副〉How! so

content.content: あの人はしわん坊たらない
He is so stingy―How stingy he is!

content:
たら〔鱈〕
〈名〉The cod; the codfish

content.content: 鱈の油
cod liver oil

content:
たらい〔盥〕
〈名〉A flat tub (for washing)

content.content: 洗濯盥
a wash-tub

だらいばん〔ダライ盤〕
〈名〉A lathe

content:
だらく〔堕落〕
〈名〉Fall (of man); degeneration (of a people); depravity (of an individual); ruin (of a woman); degradation (of character); debasement (of taste); decadence (of art):(=する) to fall; to fall away; to degenerate; to go wrong:(個人なら)to become depraved; to go to the bad; to stray ［wander, err］ from the path of duty:(女なら)to lose her chastity; to err from the path of virtue; to be ruined:(学生なら)to fall into error; to go astray:(信徒なら)to backslide; to fall from grace:(人格なら)to become degraded:(嗜味なら)to become debased:(芸術なら)to fall into decadence

content.content: 彼は細君が死んでから堕落した
He has gone wrong―gone to the bad―since his wife died.
こんな有為の青年を堕落させるのは社会の罪だ
It is the fault of society that such promising youths should fall into error―drift into error.
堕落せる天使
a fallen angel
堕落せる国民
a degenerate people
堕落した人物
a depraved man―a degraded character
堕落した女
a ruined girl―an abandoned woman
堕落した嗜味
debased taste
堕落せる芸術
decadent art
堕落した学生
an erring student
堕落女学生
an erring sister
堕落の淵に沈む
to sink into the depths of depravity
堕落のどん底に落ちている
He is in the last stage of degradation.

content:
だらけ
〈接尾形容詞〉Full of (something); covered with (something)

content.content: 作文は誤りだらけだ
The composition is full of mistakes.
この本は誤植だらけだ
The book is full of misprints.
着物は孔だらけだ
My coat is full of holes.
彼の作は穴だらけだ
His works are full of faults.
海峡は暗礁だらけだ
The straits are full of rocks.
お前は垢だらけだ
You are full of dirt―covered with dirt.
靴は泥だらけだ
The boots are covered (all over) with mud.
着物ははねだらけだ
The clothes are bespattered (all over) with mud.
全身毛だらけだ
He is covered with hair all over.
毛だらけのすね
hairy legs
彼は血だらけだった
He was covered (all over) with blood.
血だらけの死骸
a bloody corpse―a gory corpse
本は芥だらけだ
The book is covered (all over) with dust.
芥だらけの本
a dusty old volume
全身傷だらけだ
He is covered with cuts and bruises all over.
全身痣だらけだ
He is black and blue all over―a mass of bruises.
顔は墨だらけ
His face is besmeared (all over) with ink.
手はひびだらけだ
His hands are chapped all over.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 汗だらけだ
He is in a lather―in a sweat―all of a sweat.
あの人は借金だらけだ
He has run up debts everywhere.
不如意なことだらけだ
Everything goes wrong with me―Everything goes against me.

content:
だらける
〈自動〉
1. (=だるくなる)to be languid; to swelter

content.content: 暑いと身体がだらける
The heat makes one feel languid.

content: 2. (=なまける)to be idle; to flag; to slacken one's efforts

content.content: 熱心がだらけ出した
He has begun to flag in his zeal.

content:
だらしない
〈形〉Untidy (dress); slouched (air); slovenly (habit or man); sluttish, slatternly, dowdyish (woman); loose (liver); slipshod (style); sprawling (writing); rambling (house); straggling (town); silly (talk); foolish (smile)

content.content: だらしない男だ
He is a slovenly man―a sloven.
だらしない女だ
She is a slattern―a slut―a dowdy―a drab.
だらしない奴だ(行いに締まりの無い男)
He is a loose fish.
あの男はだらしない風をしている
He has a slouched air.
姿がだらしない
He is down at heels.
僕はだらしない文章は大嫌いだ
I hate a slipshod style―a sprawling style.
この文章はだらしなく長い
The sentence sprawls.
家はだらしなく広い
It is a rambling house.
あの町はだらしなく広い
It is a straggling town.
だらしない歩きようをする
He slouches along―shuffles along―shambles along―flops along.
あの人はだらしないことばかり言っている
He is always saying silly things.
だらしなく笑う
He smiles foolishly―smiles like an imbecile.
長椅子にだらしなく寄りかかる
to loll on a sofa
だらしなく香水を匂わせる
He smells like a rose-bush.
だらしなく女に手をつける
He makes free with all women.

content:
たらす〔垂らす〕
〈他動〉(=滴らす) to drop; to drip; to dribble; to let fall

content.content: 水を垂らす
to drop water―dribble water
薬を一滴目に垂らす

二三滴垂らす
to let fall a few drops
獣が血を垂らして逃げた

涎垂らす

この子は始終涎を垂らしている
The child is always running at the mouth―His mouth is always running.
はな垂らす
to snivel―run at the nose
この子は始終はな垂らしている
The child is always running at the nose―His nose is always running.
彼は汗を垂らしている

content:

〈他動〉To coax; to cajole; to wheedle; to seduce (a woman); to make a fool of (a man)

content.content: あの男は女をたらす
He will seduce a girl.
女をたらす事が上手だ(女たらし)
He is a deceiver of women―a libertine―a Don Juan.
あの女は男をたらす
She will make a fool of a man―She is a coquette.
男をたらして金品をまき上げる
She will wheedle a man out of his possessions.
彼女は老人をたらして何でもさせる
She will coax the old man into doing anything.
老人をたらして何でも買ってもらう
She will cajole him out of anything she wants.

content:

かかる輩は共に語るに足らず

貧は恥じるに足らず

彼の成功はあえてあやしむに足らず

価は論ずるに足らず

国籍は論ずるに足らず
The nationality makes no difference.
一二の差は論ずるに足らず
One more or less is of no consequence.

content: 〈副〉Nearly

content.content: 百円足らずかかった

content.content: 百円足らずの金

そこまで十マイル足らずである

一カ月に三日足らずだ

十円に五十銭足らず
ten yen less fifty sen―ten yen minus fifty sen―ten yen wanting fifty sen

to dangle

content:
たり...たり
〈接尾詞〉And; by turns; now..., now...; what by..., what by...; what with..., what with...

content.content: 行ったり来たりする
to come and go―go backward and forward
見たり聞いたり
seeing and hearing
子どもは見たり聞いたりして覚える
A child learns from its surroundings.
飲んだり食ったり
eating and drinking

They spend all their money in food and drink.
上がったり下がったり
rising and falling―now rising, now falling
赤くなったり青くなったりした
He turned red and pale by turns.
降ったり晴れたり
It rains off and on.
立ったり坐ったり
He stands and sits by turns.
泣いたり笑ったり
He cries and laughs by turns.
泣いたり笑ったり大騒ぎだ
What with crying, what with laughing,―Between laughing and crying,―there is a great noise.
おどかしたりすかしたりしてとうとう思いを遂げた

踏んだり蹴ったりする
to add insult to injury
踏んだり蹴ったりの目に逢う
to suffer wrongs and contumelies

content:
たりない〔足りない〕
〈形〉Not enough; insufficient; deficient; wanting; lacking; short

content.content: 金が足りない
The money is insufficient―The money is not enough―We are short of money.
いくら足りないか
How much is wanting?―What is the wanting sum?―What is the deficit?
百円足りない
The sum comes short by 100 yen―The sum is 100 yen short―We are 100 yen short.
手が足りない
We are short of hands―short-handed.
何人足りないか
How many are wanting?
三人足りない
Three men are wanting―We want three men―We are three men short.
力が足りない
He is not strong enough―(は体力、学力なら)―He is wanting in ability.
知恵が足りない
He has not wit enough (to do so).
皆で十冊あるのだからまだ一冊足りない
There ought to be ten volumes in all, so there is one volume still wanting.
まだまだ足りない
There is not nearly enough―(は量、数なら)―There are not nearly enough.
あの男は少し足りない
He wants twopence in the pound―He is weak in the upper story.

たる

content.content: 教師たる者の義務

父たるの道
the duty of a father
子たる者の務め

人たるの道を踏む
to tread the path of duty

no matter who it may be―whoever it may be―irrespective of persons

content.content: 恵みを垂る

彼の名は家名に光輝を垂る
His name sheds lustre on his family.
名を竹帛に垂る
to leave one's mark on history―win immortal fame
範を後世に垂る
to leave an example to posterity―“leave one's footprints on the sands of time”

content:
たる〔足る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=充分なり、間に合う) to be enough; to be sufficient; to suffice; to serve; to answer; to do

content.content: 百円あれば足ります
100 yen will be enough―be sufficient―suffice―do
これで用が足る
This will answer the purpose―serve the purpose―serve my turn―do the business―This will do―This will serve.
これでは用が足りない
This will not do―not serve―not answer.
この箱で食卓の用が足る
This box will answer the purpose of a table―serve the purpose of a table―serve for a table.
この事実は彼の正直なることを証するに足る
This fact serves to show that he is honest.
彼は非凡の人なりと言えば事足らん
Suffice it to say that he was no common being.
今日は今日の苦労にて足れり
“Safficient unto the day is the evil thereof”
この米は一連隊の兵を一カ月間養うに足る
The rice will serve (to feed) a regiment for a month.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: この島は一万人を養うに足る
The island can support 10,000 people.
彼は僕の相手をするに足る
He is a match for me.
相手にするに足らぬ
He is no match for me.
書はもって姓名を記すに足る
Cultivate enough penmanship to sign your name.
衣食足りて礼節を知る
One must be well fed before one can be well bred―Well fed, well bred―One must have bread before one can be well bred―Bread before breeding.
足らない
to be insufficient―not enough―too little―deficient―wanting―short―inadequate
何が足らない
to be short of something―wanting in something
いくら足らない
to come short by so much―want so much of the standard―to be less so much―minus so much―wanting so much
金が足らない
The money is insufficient―The money is not enough―The money will not do―I am short of money.
いくら足らないか
How much is wanting?―What is the wanting sum?―What is the deficit?
金が十円足らない
The money comes short by10 yen―The money is 10 yen short―The money is 10 yen too little.
君は勉強が足らない
You do not work hard enough―You are wanting in diligence.
力が足らない
I am not strong enough―(は体力、学力なら)―I am wanting in ability.
この仕事には英語が足らない
My English is inadequate to the work.
人員が足らない
The number of men is insufficient―There are not enough men―We are short of men.
人員がまだ一人足らない
One man is still wanting―There still wants one man―(米国にては)―There still needs one man―(いずれにても)―We are one man short.
船員が十人足らない
The ship wants ten men―(米国にては)―The ship needs ten men―(英米いずれにても)―The ship is ten men short.
手が足らない
We are short of hands―short-handed.
食糧が足らない
We are short of provisions.
食糧が足らなくなった
We have run short of provisions―Provisions have run short.
今年は雨が足らない
There is not enough rain―It has not rained enough―this year.
完全には少し足らぬ処がある
It wants something of perfection.
ご規則には一インチ足らない
It wants one inch of the regulation measurement.
一月に三日足らぬ
It wants three days of a month―It is a month less three days―It is a month minus three days―It is a month wanting three days.
十円に五十銭足らない
It wants fifty sen of 10 yen―It is ten yen less fifty sen―It is ten yen minus fifty sen―It is 10 yen wanting fifty sen.
まだ足らないものがある
Something is still wanting―We still want something―(米国にては)―We still need something.
足らない物は何か
What is wanting?
皆で十冊あるのだから一冊足らない
There ought to be ten volumes in all, so there is one volume wanting.
足らないのは何巻目か
What is the wanting number?
まだまだ足らない
There is not nearly enough―(数なら)―There are not nearly enough.
泣いても足らぬ
I can not cry enough.
余ると足らぬとどちらが好いか
Which is the better of the two too much or too little?

content.content: 彼は騎兵には丈が足らない

彼は丈が足らないために徴兵免除になった
He was exempted from military service for shortness of stature.
まだなし足らないことがある
Something remains to be done.
仕事が完成するにはまだ足らないところがたくさんある
Much remains to be done before the work is finished.
まだ言い足らないことがある
Something remains to be said.
このことを君達に充分に解らせるにはまだ言い足らないことがたくさんある
Much remains to be said before you can understand the matter fully.
毎日足らない勝ちで暮らしている
I can not make both ends meet.
あの男は少し足らない
He wants twopence in the shilling―He is weak in the upper story.→『たらず〔足らず〕』

content: 3. (=何々する価値がある) to deserve (something); to be worthy of (something); to be worth (doing something)

content.content: この本は一読するに足る
The book is worth reading―worthy of being read―worthy of a perusal.
彼の処置は賞するに足る
His conduct deserves praise―His conduct is worthy of praise.
この説は信を置くに足る
The statement is worth believing―worthy of belief―credible.
見るに足る品が無い
There are no articles worth seeing―worthy of inspection.
あの男は信任するに足る、大事を託するに足る
He is worthy of confidence.
彼ら如きは取るに足らぬ
Such men are unworthy of notice―beneath notice―beneath contempt.
彼の成功はあえてあやしむに足らず
It is no wonder that he should have succeeded.
彼の成功は驚くに足らぬ
His success is not to be wondered at.
あの息子なら誇るに足る
He is a boy to be proud of.
あんな息子を持ったとて誇るに足らぬ
Such a son does him no credit.
他は論ずに足らぬ
The rest are not worth mentioning.
価は論ずるに足らぬ
The price does not matter.―does not signify.
国籍などは論ずるに足らぬ
The nationality makes no difference―The nationality is of no consequence.
一二の差は論ずるに足らぬ
One or two more or less is of no consequence.

content: 4. (=満足する) to be content; to be contented; to be satisfied

content.content: 足ることを知れ
Learn to be contented.
足ることを知るものは幸福なり
One who is contented is happy―To be contented is to be happy―Contentment is happiness―Happiness consists in contentment.
足ることを知るものは富む
He who is content with a little, is rich.
彼は足ることを知らぬ
He is insatiable.
物足らぬ心地がする
I have an unsatisfied feeling―I feel something is wanting―I miss something.
これだけては物足らぬ心持ちがする
Without something more, it leaves an unsatisfied feeling―it makes me miss something.
洋食の宴会は何だか物足らない
A foreign dinner leaves an unsatisfied feeling.
君が来ないと物足らない心持ちがする
We miss you very much.
ご馳走に酒が無いと物足らぬ
The feast is incomplete without the wine.
名簿にお名前が無いと物足らぬ
The list would be incomplete without your name.
事足れば足るに任せて
The man who has enough and more,
事足らず
On more and more his soul is bent;
足らで事足る
How truly happy is the boor
身こそ安けれ
Who with a little is content

content:
たれ〔誰〕
〈疑問代名詞〉→『

content.content: だれ〔誰〕

content:
だれ〔誰〕
〈疑問代名詞〉Who (whose, whom)?; Which (of them)?

content.content: (番兵曰く)誰か
Who goes there?
誰がそう言ったか
Who said so?
あれは誰の家か
Whose house is that?
君は誰を尋ねるのか
Whom do you want?
誰に聞けばよいだろう
Whom shall I ask?
そんな話を誰に聞いたか
Who told you the story?
その本を誰に貰ったか?
Who gave you that book?
その本を誰から借りたか
Who lent you that book?
それは誰であったか
Who was is?
誰だと思うか
Who do you think it is?
誰だか知っているか
Do you know who it is?
誰だか知らぬ
I don't know who it is.
誰かしら
I wonder who it can be.
来た人があるから誰かと思えばしかも噂の主人公さ
Who should come but the very man we were talking about?
あの中で誰が一番好きか
Which of them do you like best?
兄弟の中で誰が一番に才子か
Which of the brothers is the cleverest?

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 誰がそう言っても間違っている
Whoever may say so, it is false.
誰が何と言ってもそんなことはせぬ
I would not do such a thing for anybody.
誰が何と言っても聴かない
Whatever any one may say, she will not listen to him.
今日は誰が来ても面会しない
I am not at home to any one today.
誰一人悦ばぬ者は無い
Everybody is glad.
誰一人そう言わぬ者は無い
Everybody says so.
誰言うとなくその風説が広まった
The rumour spread of itself.
誰言うとなく彼は発狂したという風説が立った
It began to be rumoured that he was mad.
誰か烏の雌雄を知らんや
Who can tell the one from the other?

content:
だれいうとなく〔誰言うとなく〕
〈副〉Of itself

content.content: その風説が誰言うとなく広まった
The rumour spread of itself.
誰言うとなく彼が発狂したという評判が立った
It began to be rumoured that he was mad.

content:
だれか〔誰か〕
〈不定代名詞〉Somebody; some one:(名詞に伴えば)some:(疑問なら)any body; any one:(名詞に伴えば)any

content.content: (誰だか覚えていないが)誰かそう言った
Somebody said so.
誰か来たようだ
There is some one at the door.
(あの家か)あれは誰か西洋人の家だ
It is some foreigner's house.
(僕にはわからないから)誰かほかの人に聞け
Ask somebody else.
誰か来たのか
Has any one come?
誰かこの問題のできる人があるか
Can anybody solve this problem?
君らの中で誰かできるか
Can any one of you do it?
誰か来たなら不在だと言ってくれ
If any one calls, say I am out.

たれかざり〔垂れ飾〕
〈名〉A pendant

content:
だれかしら〔誰かしら〕
〈不定代名詞〉
1. Somebody or other; some one or other

content.content: Columbus がアメリカを発見しなかったら誰かしら発見したに違いない
If Columbus had not discovered America, somebody or other must have done it.
君が取らなければ(どうせ)誰かしら取るのだ
If you will not take it, some one or other will.

content:
2. 
〈熟語〉I wonder who...

content.content: こんなことをした者は誰かしら
I wonder who can have done such a thing.
(誰か来たようだが)いったい誰かしら
I wonder who on earth it can be.

content:
たれかれ〔誰彼〕
〈名〉Persons

content.content: 法律は誰彼を論ぜぬ
The law has no respect of persons―The law is no respecter of persons.
誰彼の別無く入会を許す
All are admitted without respect of persons―irrespective of persons.
彼は誰彼を論ぜず交際する
He holds promiscuous intercourse.

たれこめる〔垂れ籠める〕
〈自動〉To be confined to one's room; to keep one's room

content.content: 誰某様
Mr. So-and-so.

だれだって〔誰だって〕
〈不定代名詞〉→『

content.content: だれでも〔誰でも〕
誰だってそんなことはできるさ
Anybody can do that.
誰だってそんなことは知っているさ
Everybody knows that.

content:
だれだれ〔誰々〕
〈疑問代名詞〉Who (with a plural verb)?; Which (of us, you, them)?

content.content: 誰々及第したか
Who have passed?―Which of you have passed?
そのほか誰々が来るか
Who else are coming?

content:
だれでも〔誰でも〕
〈不定代名詞〉
1. (=誰でも勝手な一人)anybody; any one:(名詞に伴えば)any

content.content: 誰でもそんなことはできる
Anybody can do that.
誰でもやってご覧
Any one may try.
誰でも好し
Any one will do.
日本人なら誰でもできることだ
Any Japanese can do it.

content: 2. (=誰でも彼でも皆)everybody; every one:(名詞に伴えば)every

content.content: 誰でもそんなことは知っている
Everybody knows that.
誰でも癖がある
Everybody has his faults.
戦争がすんで誰でも悦ばぬ者は無かった
Everybody was glad that the war was over.
ここにいる者は誰でもあの本を読まない者は無い
Every one of us has read the book.
日本人なら誰でも知っている話だ
Every Japanese knows the story.

content: 3. (=誰でも何々する者)any one who (whose, whom); whoever (whosever, whomever)

content.content: 誰でも来たい者は来てよろしい
Any one who wants to come―Whoever wants to come―may do so.
誰でも来たいという者を連れて来い
Bring with you any one who wants to come―whoever wants to come.
誰でも欲しいという者にこの本をやれ
Give the book to any one who wants it―to whoever wants it.
誰でも君が好きな人にこの本をやれ
Give this book to any one whom you like―to whomever you like.

たれながし〔垂れ流し〕
〈名〉Paralysis of the anus; proctoparalysis

たれながす〔垂れ流す〕
〈自動〉To dirty one's clothes

content:
だれにもせよ〔誰にもせよ〕
〈接続代名詞〉Whoever (whosever, whomever) may...; no matter who (whose, whom) may...

content.content: そう言う者は誰にもせよ(誰がそう言うにもせよ、誰がそう言おうとも)それは間違っている
Whoever may say so,―No matter who may say so,―Say so who may,―it is false.

content:
だれひとり〔誰一人〕
〈不定代名詞〉(=誰一人何々せぬもの無し)Everybody

content.content: 戦争がすんで誰一人悦ばぬ者は無かった
Everybody was glad that the war was over.

content:
たれみみ〔垂れ耳〕
〈名〉Lop-ears; flap-ears

content.content: 垂れ耳の犬
a flap-eared dog
垂れ耳の家兎
a lop-eared rabbit

content:
だれも〔誰も〕
〈不定代名詞〉
1. Nobody ［not anybody］; no one ［not any one］:(名詞に伴えば)no ［not any］

content.content: 誰もこの問題のできる者は無い
Nobody can solve this problem.
とにかくここにいる者は誰もできぬ
At least, no one of us―none of us―can do it.
ほかに誰もできる者は無い
No one else can do it.
誰にも逢わなかった
I met no one―I did not meet any one.
学校の生徒には誰にも逢わなかった
I met no student―I did not meet any student.
(君がこの金を取っても)誰も知る人は無い
Nobody will be the wiser.

content: 2. (=誰でも)everybody; anybody

content.content: そんなことなら誰も知っている
Everybody knows that.
そんなことは誰もできる
Anybody can do that.
勉強なら誰にも負けぬ
I can work as hard as anybody―I can work with the best of them.

content:
だれもかれも〔誰も彼も〕
〈不定代名詞〉Everybody; anybody and everybody; all the world and his wife

content.content: 誰にも彼にも賞められるのはよろしくない
It is not well that anybody and everybody should speak well of you.
(英国では)誰も彼も競馬に賭けをする
Anybody and everybody―All the world and his wife―bets on the horses.

content:
たれる〔垂れる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=垂れ下げる) to hang (one's head); to droop (one's face); to drop (a line); to let down (the blind)

content.content: 彼は恥じて頭を垂れた
He hung his head for shame.
犬が尾を垂れる
A dog droops his tail.
犬が尻尾を垂れてこそこそ逃げた
The dog slunk away with his tail between his legs.
暑いと犬が舌を垂れる
A dog lolls out his tongue in hot weather.
釣糸を垂れる
to drop a line
簾を垂れる
to let down the blind

content: 2. (=受ける) to confer, bestow (anything on one)

content.content: 恩恵を垂れる
to bestow a favour on one
憐みを垂れる
to take pity on one―have mercy on one
この罪人にお慈悲を垂れさせ給え
Lord have mercy on me, a miserable sinner!
糞を垂れる
to move the bowels―evacuate the bowels―void excrement―go to stool―obey the calls of nature―shit
小便を垂れる
to make water―pass water―ease nature―relieve nature
屁を垂れる
to break wind―fart

content:
〈自動〉
1. (=垂れ下がる) (flowers) droop; (hair) hangs, trails; (ears) lop, flap; (the brim of a hat) slouches; (the ceiling) sags; (clouds) sag down

content.content: 髪の毛が額の辺に垂れる
The hair hangs about the neck.
木の枝が垂れる
The branches droop.
実がたくさん生って枝が垂れる
The fruit weighs down the branches―The branches are weighed down with the fruit.
天井が垂れる
The ceiling sags.
雲が垂れる
The clouds sag down.
耳の垂れた犬
a flap-eared dog
耳の垂れた兎
a lop-eared rabbit
縁の垂れた帽子
a slouch-hat

content: 2. (=滴る) to drop; to drip

content.content: 水が垂れる
Water drops.
着物が雨に濡れて水が垂れている
His clothes are dripping with rain.
涎が垂れる
His mouth is running―He is running at the mouth.
はなが垂れる
His nose is running―He is running at the nose.

content:
だれる
〈自動〉To drag; to flag; to languish

content.content: 学期の終りに近くなると教場がだれる
The class drags towards the end of the term.
話しがだれてくる
The talk begins to flag―The conversation languishes.

content:
だろう
〈助動詞相当〉May; must; will

content.content: なにごとかあるだろう
Something may happen.
なにかの間違いだろう
It must be some mistake.
君だろう
It must be you.
どうにかなるだろう
Things will come round.

content: 〈副詞相当〉Perhaps; probably; possibly; maybe

content.content: 君あの人を知っているだろう
Perhaps you know him.
彼の言うことは本当だろう
His statement is probably true.
あるいはそうだろう
It may possibly be so.
皆作りごとだろう
Maybe it is all a fabrication.

content: 〈熟語相当〉I think; I hope; I fear ［I am afraid］; I suppose; I presume; I dare say; I should think; I should say

content.content: そうだろう
I think it is so.
明日は天気になるだろう
I hope it will be fine weather tomorrow.
また落第だろう
I am afraid he will fail again.
お前も行きたいだろう
You want to go, too, I suppose?
さぞお疲れだろう
You are tired, I presume―I dare say.
あの人は四十前後だろう
He is about forty, I should think―I should say.

content:
たわいない
〈形〉Frivolous (conduct); puerile (talk); silly, giddy, nonsensical (talk); flimsy (reason, etc.)

content.content: たわいないことをする人だ
He indulges frivolous conduct―indulges in frivolities―He is a trifler―a fribble.
たわいないことをするな
Don't be frivolous!―Don't trifle!―Don't fribble!
たわいない男だ
He is a frivolous character―a trifler―a fribble.
たわいないことを言うな
Don't say silly things!―Don't talk nonsense!―Don't talk rot!
彼は子どものようなたわいないことばかり言っている
His talk is puerile.
彼はたわいない理屈をつけて学校を休む
He absents himself from school on flimsy pretexts.

content:
たわいなく
〈副〉
1. (=分別無く) frivolously

content.content: 彼はたわいなくお金を使ってしまう
He frivols away―fritters away―his money.

content: 2. (=易く) easily

content.content: たわいなく負けた
He proved an easy conquest.
たわいなく勝った
He simply walked over the course.

content: 3. (=前後不覚に) as if dead

content.content: たわいなく寝ている
He sleeps like one dead.
たわいなく酔っている
He is dead drunk.

content: 4. (=無邪気に) innocently

content.content: 子どものようにたわいなくしゃべる
He prattles like a child.

たわいなし
〈名〉A trifler; a fribble

content:
たわけ〔戯け〕
〈名〉Foolery; tomfoolery:(=る) to fool; to tomfool; to trifle; to fribble; to frivol; to play the giddy goat

to fool―tomfool―play the fool―make an ass of oneself

None of your fooleries!
たわけた真似を止せ
No more of your tomfooleries!
たわけたことを言うな
Don't talk nonsense!―Don't talk rot!

content:

〈名〉A fool; a tomfool

content.content: このたわけ者め

lamentation over the country's ruin

content: 2. (=歎賞) admiration

たん〔短〕
〈名〉A fault; a defect; a demerit; a shortcoming; a weak point

content.content: 長と短
merits and faults―merits and defects―merits and demerits

Every man has his merits and faults.
長を取り短を捨てる

to remedy one's defects

長をもって短を補う
to set off a merit against a fault

長短相い補う

content.content: 短時間、短日月

content: 8. (=何々の段じゃない)(It is) no word for it, no name for it

content.content: 暑い暑くないの段じゃない

変りが有る無いの段じゃない

content:

content.content: 談たまたま文学に及ぶ

〈名〉Abandonment; relinquishment; despair:(=する) to abandon; to relinquish; to give up; to despair of, abandon all hope of, relinquish all hope of, renounce all hope of, give up all hope of (success); to abandon the idea of, relinquish the idea of, give up the idea of (doing something); to abandon the attempt, give up the attempt (in despair); to give it up as a bad job; to relinquish one's hopes; to furl one's hopes; to have done with (anything)

content.content: もう成功を断念した

I tried and failed so many times that I gave up the attempt in despair―gave it up as a bad job.
